original: sdig pa thams cad bshags par bya'o //🔽bsod nams kun gyi rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad bshags par bya'o // bsod nams kun gyi rjes su yi rang bar bya'o //
translated: I confess all my evil deeds.🔽I rejoice in all merit.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: I beseech all Buddhas to turn the Wheel of the Dharma.

original: bdag gi shes pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar gyur cig ces bya ba ste /🔽mdo sde'i tshig de bzhis rim @127a * //
analyzed: bdag gi shes pa bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya bar gyur cig ces bya ba ste / mdo sde'i tshig de bzhis rim @127a * //
translated: I beseech all Buddhas to live on for immeasurable aeons.

original: bzhin du bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang gsol ba dang / bsngo ba rnams bstan to //
analyzed: bzhin du bshags pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang gsol ba dang / bsngo ba rnams bstan to //
translated: By these four lines of the Sutra, confession, rejoicing, beseeching, and dedication are taught in order.

original: 'di ni thabs rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third kind of means.

original: bya ba grub pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba grub pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fourth means is the accomplishment of deeds.

original: bya ba grub pa'i thabs ni ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams te /
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i thabs ni ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams te /
translated: The means of accomplishing deeds is the doors of concentration and retention,

original: de gnyis kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don rnams 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don rnams 'grub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by these two one accomplishes one's own and others' aims.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don 'grub par byed do //
translated: One accomplishes others' aims by means of concentration, demonstrating various kinds of miracles.

original: gzungs kyis ni bshad pa'i don dang tshig 'dzin pas bdag gi don 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: gzungs kyis ni bshad pa'i don dang tshig 'dzin pas bdag gi don 'grub par byed de /
translated: By means of the retention of what is heard, one accomplishes one's own aim by retaining the meaning and the words of what has been heard.

original: 'di ni thabs bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth method.

original: lam mi gcod par mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: lam mi gcod par mkhas pa ni //
translated: Skill in not interrupting the path

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is explained in the verse.

original: lam mi gcod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung mi gcod pa ste /
analyzed: lam mi gcod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung mi gcod pa ste /
translated: Not interrupting the path means not interrupting the lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: de'i thabs ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de'i thabs ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam mo //
translated: The method for that is the path of non-abiding nirvana.

original: de la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of path of non-abiding nirvana:

original: shes rab dang snying rje'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje'o //
translated: wisdom and compassion.

original: de la shes rab dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba na gnas kyang 'khor ba'i nyes pas mi gos te /
analyzed: de la shes rab dang ldan pa ni 'khor ba na gnas kyang 'khor ba'i nyes pas mi gos te /
translated: One who has wisdom abides in cyclic existence but is not defiled by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: dper na padmo chu las skyes kyang chu'i nyes pa 'dam gyis mi gos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na padmo chu las skyes kyang chu'i nyes pa 'dam gyis mi gos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a lotus is born in the water but is not defiled by the faults of the water, such as mud.

original: snying rje dang ldan pas ni 'phags pa nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu mi 'jug gi /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pas ni 'phags pa nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu mi 'jug gi /
translated: One who has compassion does not enter only nirvana, like the noble disciples.

original: 'khor bar sems can gyi don byed de /
analyzed: 'khor bar sems can gyi don byed de /
translated: One acts for the sake of sentient beings in cyclic existence.

original: 'di ni thabs rnam pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs rnam pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth method.

original: de yang chad kyis thabs kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: de yang chad kyis thabs kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: And this is the teaching of the classification of the methods.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs //
translated: The methods of the bodhisattvas

original: sa rnams kun la mnyam pa med //
analyzed: sa rnams kun la mnyam pa med //
translated: are unequaled on all stages.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'jig rten pa dag rang gi don grub par bya ba'i phyir thabs la gnas pa yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag rang gi don grub par bya ba'i phyir thabs la gnas pa yod /
translated: the worldly people have a method for accomplishing their own aim.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang rang gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i thabs la gnas pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang rang gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i thabs la gnas pa yod mod kyi /
translated: The noble disciples and the solitary sages have a method for attaining their own result.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu dag na thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa lnga la gnas pa ni gnas pas khyad zhugs pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu dag na thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa lnga la gnas pa ni gnas pas khyad zhugs pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But the bodhisattvas, on the ten stages, have a method for accomplishing the aims of others, and they are unequaled by those two in terms of their method.

original: thabs gang la ni gnas nas su //
analyzed: thabs gang la ni gnas nas su //
translated: On what method do they stand

original: don rnams thams cad 'grub par byed //
analyzed: don rnams thams cad 'grub par byed //
translated: in order to accomplish all aims?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams thabs mkhas pa rnam pa lnga la gnas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams thabs mkhas pa rnam pa lnga la gnas na /
translated: if the bodhisattvas stand in the five methods,

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gnyi ga 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gnyi ga 'grub par byed de /
translated: It accomplishes both one's own aim and the aim of others.

original: de ni thabs mkhas pa'i las so //
analyzed: de ni thabs mkhas pa'i las so //
translated: This is the function of skill in means.

original: gzungs rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzungs rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Three verses on the analysis of the powers

original: thabs kyi 'og tu gzungs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: thabs kyi 'og tu gzungs kyi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of the powers and the previous chapter on skill in means?

original: gzungs kyi byang chub sems dpa' byang chub @127b kyi phyogs thams cad kyang thob la /
analyzed: gzungs kyi byang chub sems dpa' byang chub @127b kyi phyogs thams cad kyang thob la /
translated: The bodhisattva who has the powers obtains all the accessories of enlightenment.

original: gzungs kyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gsungs pa'i don dang tshig rnams kyang ma lus par 'dzin par byed cing /
analyzed: gzungs kyi stobs kyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gsungs pa'i don dang tshig rnams kyang ma lus par 'dzin par byed cing /
translated: By the power of retention, he retains all the meanings and words spoken by the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and

original: sngon ma thos pa'i chos dang don rnams kyang sems la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa'i chos dang don rnams kyang sems la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: the meanings and teachings of the Dharma that he has not previously heard appear to his mind.

original: de bas na thabs dang ldan na chos dang gzungs dang don 'dzin pa'i gzungs thob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas na thabs dang ldan na chos dang gzungs dang don 'dzin pa'i gzungs thob pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because he obtains the powers of retention of Dharma, of retention of meanings, and of retention of teachings, respectively,

original: thabs kyi 'og tu gzungs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: thabs kyi 'og tu gzungs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: the explanation of the powers is connected to the previous chapter on skill in means.

original: yang na thabs mkhas pa dang gzungs la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi nang du gtogs pas /
analyzed: yang na thabs mkhas pa dang gzungs la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi nang du gtogs pas /
translated: Or else, since skill in means and retention and so on are included among the factors of enlightenment,

original: de'i don mi bshad du mi rung ba'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: de'i don mi bshad du mi rung ba'i phyir bshad do //
translated: it is explained because it is necessary to explain their meaning.

original: yang na gtsug lag 'di ni mdo sde'i don 'chad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gtsug lag 'di ni mdo sde'i don 'chad pa yin te /
translated: Or else, this treatise explains the meaning of the sutras,

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde las /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde las /
translated: because the meaning of retention and so on is explained in the sutras of the Great Vehicle.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.

original: thabs dang / gzungs dang / smon lam dag 'byung ste de'i don bshad dgos pas gzungs kyi don bshad do //🔽rnam smin thos pa goms pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gzungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thabs dang / gzungs dang / smon lam dag 'byung ste de'i don bshad dgos pas gzungs kyi don bshad do // rnam smin thos pa goms pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gzungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.

original: gzungs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang las bstan te ;
analyzed: gzungs kyi rab tu dbye ba dang las bstan te ;
translated: The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.

original: 'dir gzungs kyi rang bzhin ma bshad mod kyi /🔽gzungs kyi rang bzhin ni dran pa dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzungs kyi rang bzhin ma bshad mod kyi / gzungs kyi rang bzhin ni dran pa dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.

original: dran pa dang shes rab khyad par can la gzungs zhes bya'o //🔽de la gzungs rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab khyad par can la gzungs zhes bya'o //🔽de la gzungs rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.🔽The meaning of retention is explained because it is necessary to explain its meaning.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs so //
translated: The dhāraṇī that arises from the maturation of karma, the dhāraṇī that arises from the cultivation of hearing, and the dhāraṇī of samādhi.

original: de la tshe rabs gzhan du dam pa'i chos dris pa dang / mchod pa dang / bcangs pa dang / klags pa la sogs pa gzungs thob par 'gyur pa'i klas dge ba bsags pas gang du skyes par 'di lta bu'i phung po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tshe rabs gzhan du dam pa'i chos dris pa dang / mchod pa dang / bcangs pa dang / klags pa la sogs pa gzungs thob par 'gyur pa'i klas dge ba bsags pas gang du skyes par 'di lta bu'i phung po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Among those, the dhāraṇī that arises from the maturation of karma is as follows. Through the accumulation of virtue in other lives, such as asking about the sublime Dharma, making offerings, holding, reading, and so on, one attains dhāraṇī. Wherever one is born, such a heap is actualized.

original: phung po gang grub pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang bshad pa'i don dang tshig rnam lan cig bshad pas kun 'dzin par nus te /
analyzed: phung po gang grub pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang bshad pa'i don dang tshig rnam lan cig bshad pas kun 'dzin par nus te /
translated: Through the heap that is actualized, one is able to retain all the meanings and words that are explained by the buddhas and bodhisattvas through a single explanation.

original: 'di ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the dhāraṇī that arises from the maturation of karma.🔽Therefore, in the noble Akṣayamatisūtra,

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: it says:

original: de la gzungs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzungs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is inexhaustible dhāraṇī?

original: gzungs zhes bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa dran pas chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi 'dzin pa dang / kun 'dzin pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / dran pas kun 'dzin pa 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽tshe 'dir dge ba'i @128a * //
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa dran pas chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi 'dzin pa dang / kun 'dzin pa dang / mi brjed pa dang / dran pas kun 'dzin pa 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so // tshe 'dir dge ba'i @128a * //
translated: As for the term “dhāraṇī,” it is the retention of the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma through the recollection that accumulates the roots of virtue, the retention of all of them, the non-forgetting of them, and the retention of them through recollection. This is called “dhāraṇī.”

original: bshes gnyen mang po la chos mang po lan mang du mnyan pa las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas bshad pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pas bshad pa'i chos kyi don tshig ma lus par 'dzin nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bshes gnyen mang po la chos mang po lan mang du mnyan pa las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pas bshad pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon la sogs pas bshad pa'i chos kyi don tshig ma lus par 'dzin nus par 'gyur te /
translated: In this life, through listening many times to many teachings from many spiritual friends, one is able to retain all the words and meanings of the teachings explained by the buddhas and bodhisattvas and the teachings explained by preceptors, masters, and so forth.

original: 'di ni thos pa la goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thos pa la goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the dhāraṇī that arises from being habituated to listening.”

original: gzungs de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzungs de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of that dhāraṇī,

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang //
translated: the noble Aksayamati Sūtra says:

original: yang gzungs zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa thams cad 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyis smras pa dang /
analyzed: yang gzungs zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa thams cad 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyis smras pa dang /
translated: Moreover, dhāraṇī is the retention of all that is taught by the Bhagavān Buddha,

original: legs par smras pa thams cad ma lus par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: legs par smras pa thams cad ma lus par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: and the retention of all that is spoken and well spoken by all bodhisattvas, all pratyekabuddhas, all śrāvakas, and all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called dhāraṇī.

original: gang gis stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang gang yang rung ba cig bsgoms te mngon du byas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bshad pa'i don dang tshig rnams la lan cig gis 'dzin par nus pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang gang yang rung ba cig bsgoms te mngon du byas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bshad pa'i don dang tshig rnams la lan cig gis 'dzin par nus pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs zhes bya'o //
translated: The dhāraṇī of samādhi is the ability to actualize and cultivate any of the samādhis, such as emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the ability to retain the words and meanings that are explained by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: chung ba dang ni chen po dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chung ba dang ni chen po dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The small, the medium, and the great.

original: gong du bshad pa'i gzungs gsum las /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i gzungs gsum las /
translated: Among the three retentions explained above,

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs ni chung ngu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs ni chung ngu zhes bya'o //
translated: the retention that arises from the cause of ripening and the retention that arises from the cause of cultivating learning are called small.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs ni chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs ni chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The retention of samadhi is called great.

original: chen po la yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chen po la yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great is also threefold.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs chen por bshad pa la chen po de la yang rnam pa gsum du gzhag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs chen por bshad pa la chen po de la yang rnam pa gsum du gzhag ste /
translated: The retention of samadhi, which was explained as great, is also posited as threefold within that greatness.

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //🔽ma zhugs zhugs pa brtan rnams kyi //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o // ma zhugs zhugs pa brtan rnams kyi //
translated: It is small, medium, and great.🔽The small, medium, and great are for those who have not entered, have entered, and are stable.

original: chung ngu dang ni 'bring po dang / sa dag pa yi sa yin te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chung ngu dang ni 'bring po dang / sa dag pa yi sa yin te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The small, medium, and great are for those who have not entered, have entered, and are stable.

original: sa dang po la ma zhugs pa mos pas spyod pa rnams ting nge 'dzin 'ga' zhig bsgoms pa las gzungs thob pa ni chung ngu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa dang po la ma zhugs pa mos pas spyod pa rnams ting nge 'dzin 'ga' zhig bsgoms pa las gzungs thob pa ni chung ngu zhes bya ste /
translated: Those on the levels of engagement through belief who have not entered the first level and have cultivated some samadhi attain retention, which is called small.

original: chung ngu ni chos dbyings mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ngu ni chos dbyings mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The small one is so called because the Dharma-element is not realized.

original: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa rnams kyi gzungs la yang sa dang po yan chang sa bdun pa man chad ma dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin las grub pa'i gzungs ni 'bring po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa rnams kyi gzungs la yang sa dang po yan chang sa bdun pa man chad ma dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin las grub pa'i gzungs ni 'bring po zhes bya ste /
translated: The medium dhāraṇī is that which is accomplished from impure samādhi on the first stage up to the seventh stage.

original: sa de dag na brtsal ba dang 'bad pa yod @128b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa de dag na brtsal ba dang 'bad pa yod @128b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called medium because there is seeking and striving on those stages.🔽The great one is the pure stage.

original: dag pa'i sa ni chen po'o zhes bya ba las brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzungs ni brtsal ba 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dag pa'i sa ni chen po'o zhes bya ba las brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i gzungs ni brtsal ba 'bad med par lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: The great dhāraṇī is that which is born from pure samādhi on the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages, the pure stages, because it functions effortlessly and spontaneously without seeking and striving.

original: des ni gzungs kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gzungs kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: This explains the classification of dhāraṇī.

original: gzungs rnams la ni rab gnas te //
analyzed: gzungs rnams la ni rab gnas te //
translated: The bodhisattva who is well-established in the dhāraṇīs

original: yang dang yang ni byang chub dag / dam pa'i chos kyang ston byed cing //
analyzed: yang dang yang ni byang chub dag / dam pa'i chos kyang ston byed cing //
translated: teaches the excellent Dharma again and again

original: rtag par rab tu 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: rtag par rab tu 'dzin par byed //
translated: and always retains it.

original: ces bya ba la /🔽byang chub sems dpa' dag gong du bshad pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs gsum la gnas shing brten nas rgyun du sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos kyi tshig dang don kyang ston cing bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa'i don dang tshig kyang
analyzed: ces bya ba la / byang chub sems dpa' dag gong du bshad pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs gsum la gnas shing brten nas rgyun du sems can la phan par bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos kyi tshig dang don kyang ston cing bdag la phan par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsungs pa'i don dang tshig kyang
translated: Bodhisattvas, abiding in and relying on the three kinds of retention explained above, retention that arises from the karmic result, retention that arises from the practice of learning, and retention that arises from concentration, they teach the words and meanings of the excellent Dharma in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed de /
translated: And they retain the meanings and words taught by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas in order to benefit themselves.

original: de ni gzungs kyi las so //
analyzed: de ni gzungs kyi las so //
translated: This is the activity of retention.

original: yang dang yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang rgyun ma chad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dang yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang rgyun ma chad par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Again and again means constantly and uninterruptedly.

original: thos pa goms pas ni tshe 'di la mang du thos pa 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thos pa goms pas ni tshe 'di la mang du thos pa 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By the practice of learning, they retain what they have learned in this life and so on.

original: tshe 'dir dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po la lan mang du mnyan pa las sangs rgyas la sogs pas bshad pa'i don dang tshig 'dzin cing mi brjed par bzung ba'i mthu yod de /
analyzed: tshe 'dir dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po la lan mang du mnyan pa las sangs rgyas la sogs pas bshad pa'i don dang tshig 'dzin cing mi brjed par bzung ba'i mthu yod de /
translated: One has the power to retain and not forget the meanings and words explained by the Buddhas, etc., from having listened many times to many spiritual masters in this life.

original: de ni thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs zhes bya'o //🔽smon lam rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni thos pa goms pa las byung ba'i gzungs zhes bya'o // smon lam rnam par dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is called retention that arises from cultivation of hearing.🔽Three verses on the analysis of vows

original: gzungs kyi 'og tu smon lam gyi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gzungs kyi 'og tu smon lam gyi skabs bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of retention and the explanation of vows that follows it?

original: de ltar gzungs thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag dang gzhan gyi don du smon lam 'debs te /
analyzed: de ltar gzungs thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag dang gzhan gyi don du smon lam 'debs te /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have attained retention make vows for their own and others' goals.

original: smon lam btab pa yang smon lam gang dang gang btab pa de dang de dag thams cad de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: smon lam btab pa yang smon lam gang dang gang btab pa de dang de dag thams cad de bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And whatever vows they make, all of them are fulfilled just as they wished.

original: de bas na gzungs kyi 'og tu smon lam gyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na gzungs kyi 'og tu smon lam gyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of vows is connected to the explanation of retention.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems pa ni //
translated: Volition endowed with desire

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas smon lam gyi rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / sa dang / dbye ba dang / las bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas smon lam gyi rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / sa dang / dbye ba dang / las bstan to //
translated: Thus, the nature of the vow, its cause, its stages, its varieties, and its function are shown.

original: de la 'dod pa ni 'dod par bya ba'i dngos po la 'dod pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni 'dod par bya ba'i dngos po la 'dod pa skye ba ste /
translated: Here, desire is the desire that arises for a desirable object.

original: 'dir yang bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu ji ltar thob par bya snyam du sems shing 'dod pa ni 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu ji ltar thob par bya snyam du sems shing 'dod pa ni 'dod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And here, desire is the desire to attain the fruit of supreme enlightenment, thinking, “How may I attain it?”

original: sems pa ni sems g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid de sems bskyed @129a * //
analyzed: sems pa ni sems g-yo zhing 'gul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid de sems bskyed @129a * //
translated: Thought is the characteristic of the mind’s movement and agitation.

original: nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu ji lta bar thob par bya snyam du sems shing tshig tu 'byin pa ni smon lam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nas bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi 'bras bu ji lta bar thob par bya snyam du sems shing tshig tu 'byin pa ni smon lam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Having generated the thought, “How may I attain the fruit of supreme enlightenment?” one utters the vow. This is the nature of the vow.

original: ye shes kyis ni de bskul te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni de bskul te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is inspired by intuition.

original: ye shes ni 'di'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni 'di'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la bya ste /
translated: Intuition is the nonconceptual intuition of the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu las byung bas na ye shes kyis bskul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu las byung bas na ye shes kyis bskul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The prayers of the bodhisattvas are called “stimulated by gnosis” because they arise from the cause of nonconceptual gnosis.

original: yang na ye shes de thob par bya bar bsngos pa ni ye shes kyis bskul ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ye shes de thob par bya bar bsngos pa ni ye shes kyis bskul ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, they are called “stimulated by gnosis” because they are dedicated to the attainment of that gnosis.

original: 'dis ni rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu bstan to //
translated: This shows their cause.

original: brtan pa rnams kyi smon lam ni //
analyzed: brtan pa rnams kyi smon lam ni //
translated: The prayers of the steadfast

original: sa rnams kun la mnyam pa med //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sa rnams kun la mnyam pa med // ces bya ba la /
translated: are unequaled on all the levels.

original: brtan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu thams cad du smon lam 'debs pa de ni 'jig rten pa dag lha dang mi'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: brtan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa bcu thams cad du smon lam 'debs pa de ni 'jig rten pa dag lha dang mi'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Here, the prayers of the steadfast bodhisattvas on all the ten levels are unequaled by the prayers of mundane beings, who pray for the results of gods and humans, or by the prayers of the listeners and solitary realizers, who pray for the attainment of the result of their respective vehicles.

original: smon lam de dag kun pas kyang khyad zhugs pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smon lam de dag kun pas kyang khyad zhugs pas na mnyam pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they are superior to all those prayers, they are called “unequaled.”

original: 'dis ni sa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa bstan to //
translated: This shows their level.

original: rgyur gyur pa yang shes par bya //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa yang shes par bya //
translated: The cause of that should be understood.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni don thams cad 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni don thams cad 'grub pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The prayers of the bodhisattvas should be understood as the cause of the accomplishment of all aims.

original: de la don thams cad 'grub par bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la don thams cad 'grub par bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of accomplishment of all aims:

original: tshe 'dir bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par bya ba dang / tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'dir bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par bya ba dang / tshe rabs gzhan du bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par bya ba'o //
translated: accomplishment of one’s own and others’ aims in this life and accomplishment of one’s own and others’ aims in other lives.

original: sems las 'phral du 'bras bu'ang de //🔽zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: sems las 'phral du 'bras bu'ang de // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The result is also immediate from the will.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smon lam dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smon lam dang sbyar te /
translated: The word “that” refers to the prayer.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam de zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sems las zhes bya ba ni sems tsam las she'am //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam de zhes bya ba'i don to // sems las zhes bya ba ni sems tsam las she'am //
translated: The meaning is that the result is immediate from the will of the bodhisattvas’ prayer.

original: smon lam btab pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “From the will” means from the mere will, or from the mere utterance of the prayer.

original: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phral du zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Immediate” means in this life.

original: don du na lus dang ngag gi sgo nas las su byas pa med par tshe 'dir yang smon lam btab pa tsam gyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du na lus dang ngag gi sgo nas las su byas pa med par tshe 'dir yang smon lam btab pa tsam gyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In fact, it means that without any action through body and speech, one accomplishes the aims of oneself and others in this very life, merely by the power of a vow.

original: ma 'ongs don rnams 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ma 'ongs don rnams 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish future aims,

original: sems tsam las ni 'grub par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems tsam las ni 'grub par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one is successful through mind alone.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni tshe phyi ma la @129b bya ste ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni tshe phyi ma la @129b bya ste ;
translated: Here, the future is the next life.

original: lus dang ngag gi sgo nas g-yos pa med la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sgo nas g-yos pa med la /
translated: Without any movement through body and speech,

original: sems tsam gyis bsams pa'am /
analyzed: sems tsam gyis bsams pa'am /
translated: merely by the power of mind,

original: smon lam btab pa tsam gyis tshe phyi mar yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don kun sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa tsam gyis tshe phyi mar yang bdag dang gzhan gyi don kun sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: merely by the power of a vow, one accomplishes all the aims of oneself and others in the next life.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba la mos pas spyod pa'i dus kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba la mos pas spyod pa'i dus kyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
translated: The vow of the bodhisattvas on the stage of action through faith is called “diverse” because it is not one thing.

original: de'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid mi rtogs pas /
analyzed: de'i dus na chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid mi rtogs pas /
translated: At that time, one does not realize the characteristic of the all-pervading Dharma-element.

original: 'di dang 'di lta bur gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa yang tha dad pa ni mi mthun par 'debs pas sna tshogs zhes bya'o //🔽chen po zhes bya ba la /🔽sa dang por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bur gyur cig ces smon lam 'debs pa yang tha dad pa ni mi mthun par 'debs pas sna tshogs zhes bya'o // chen po zhes bya ba la / sa dang por zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The various aspirations are those that are different, i.e., not in common with others, such as May I become like this or that one!

original: smon lam chen po bcu mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam dag gong ma gong ma'i sa rnams la //🔽byang chub bar du sems pa rnams //
analyzed: smon lam chen po bcu mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro // rnam dag gong ma gong ma'i sa rnams la // byang chub bar du sems pa rnams //
translated: The great aspirations are those of the bodhisattvas who have entered the first stage, because they accomplish the ten great aspirations.🔽The pure aspirations are those of the bodhisattvas from the second stage up to the seventh, because they are purified by the path of superior morality, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽sa gnyis nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / sa gnyis nas brtsams te /
translated: The very pure aspirations are those of the bodhisattvas on the three pure stages, because they are purified by the path of superior wisdom.🔽The very pure, pure, great, and various aspirations are the aspirations of the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ma thug gi bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /🔽ji lta zhe na sa 'og ma 'og ma la ltos nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ma thug gi bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste / ji lta zhe na sa 'og ma 'og ma la ltos nas /
translated: The pure aspirations are those of the bodhisattvas from the second stage up to the seventh, because they are purified by the path of superior morality, etc.

original: sa gong ma gong ma rnams kyi smon lam 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa gong ma gong ma rnams kyi smon lam 'phags shing khyad zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The very pure aspirations are those of the bodhisattvas on the three pure stages, because they are purified by the path of superior wisdom.

original: 'dis ni smod lam gyi rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni smod lam gyi rab tu dbye ba bstan to //
translated: This shows the classification of aspiration.

original: bdag dang gzhan don rab tu sgrub //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan don rab tu sgrub //
translated: It accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyis ni bdag gi don yang sgrub par byed //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyis ni bdag gi don yang sgrub par byed //
translated: the bodhisattva's vow accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed de /
translated: It accomplishes the aims of others.

original: de ni las so //🔽smon lam gyi mthus bsod nams kyi stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni las so // smon lam gyi mthus bsod nams kyi stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This is its action.🔽The power of merit is the strength of the bodhisattva who has accumulated the equipment of merit.🔽By the power of his vow, the bodhisattvas accomplish the aims of self and other with immeasurable bodies, immeasurable light rays, and immeasurable miracles.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi stobs dang ldan pas smon lam btab pa'i mthus byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus dpag tu med pa dang / 'od zer dpag tu med pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dpag tu med pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa ni tshig gis brjod par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las gsung pas na /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi stobs dang ldan pas smon lam btab pa'i mthus byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus dpag tu med pa dang / 'od zer dpag tu med pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dpag tu med pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa ni tshig gis brjod par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las gsung pas na /
translated: This is not easily expressed in words.🔽Since this is stated in the sutra,

original: smon lam gyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par mngon no //
analyzed: smon lam gyis bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub par mngon no //
translated: it is evident that the vow accomplishes the aims of self and other.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la /🔽smon lam gyi 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gsum @130a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la / smon lam gyi 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gsum @130a * //
translated: Three verses on the analysis of the three samadhis.

original: bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the samadhis and the retention and the prayer?

original: de ltar gzungs dang smon lam du ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum la sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar gzungs dang smon lam du ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum la sgom par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with retention and prayer cultivates the three samadhis in order to eliminate all obscurations.

original: de gsum la bsgoms na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phyin ci ma log pa rnams spong bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de gsum la bsgoms na bdag dang gzhan gyi don phyin ci ma log pa rnams spong bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: And when he cultivates those three, he eliminates all errors in the performance of his own and others aims.

original: smon lam gyi 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gsum rnam par dbye ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to //🔽yang na smon lam dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus kyi las sam /🔽ngag gi las sam /
analyzed: smon lam gyi 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gsum rnam par dbye ba'i skabs bshad par 'brel to // yang na smon lam dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams lus kyi las sam / ngag gi las sam /
translated: Therefore, the three samadhis are explained immediately after the prayer.

original: yid kyi las gang sgrub par bsams pa de dang de dag thams cad de bzhin du sgrub ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las gang sgrub par bsams pa de dang de dag thams cad de bzhin du sgrub ste /
translated: Or else, whatever physical, verbal, or mental action the bodhisattva who is endowed with the prayer intends to perform for the sake of beings, all that he intends comes about just as he wishes.

original: las gsum la yang sems kyi las ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa gtso bo yin pas na /
analyzed: las gsum la yang sems kyi las ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa gtso bo yin pas na /
translated: Also, among the three actions, the mental action of accomplishing meditative stabilization is primary.

original: smon lam gyi 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: smon lam gyi 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi skabs bshad par 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, it is related that the section on meditative stabilization is explained after the section on aspiration.

original: bdag med gnyis po dag dang ni //
analyzed: bdag med gnyis po dag dang ni //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness

original: bdag 'dzin gnas su shes par bya //🔽de dag rtag tu nye bar zhi //
analyzed: bdag 'dzin gnas su shes par bya // de dag rtag tu nye bar zhi //
translated: and the two kinds of self-grasping should be known as the domain🔽of the three meditative stabilizations,

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi spyod yul lo //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi spyod yul lo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: which are always peaceful.

original: spyod yul ni dmigs pa'i yul la bya ste /🔽de la kun du brtags pa'i gang zag la bdag med pa dang / kun du brtags pa'i chos la bdag med pa gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: spyod yul ni dmigs pa'i yul la bya ste / de la kun du brtags pa'i gang zag la bdag med pa dang / kun du brtags pa'i chos la bdag med pa gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul te /
translated: The domain should be understood as the objective domain.🔽The two kinds of selflessness—the selflessness of the imputed person and the selflessness of the imputed phenomena—are the domain of the meditative stabilization of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis ni kun brtags kyi gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis ni kun brtags kyi gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meditative stabilization of emptiness focuses on the emptiness that is the selflessness of the imputed person and phenomena.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'i gnas dang rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa dang chos la bdag med pa'i gnas dang rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: The basis or support of the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs nas gang zag dang chos yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs nas gang zag dang chos yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes the existence of persons and phenomena by objectifying the five appropriated aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs te /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are objectified by the concentration of wishlessness.

original: de ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: How are they objectified?🔽The five appropriated aggregates are the basis or support for the occurrence of the error of self and phenomena, and they are endowed with the various sufferings of birth, aging, and so on.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag ni bdag dang chos su 'khrul pa med par 'byung ba'i gnas dang rten yin zhing skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin pas smon par bya ba ma yin🔽no zhes bya bar dmigs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag ni bdag dang chos su 'khrul pa med par 'byung ba'i gnas dang rten yin zhing skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa yin pas smon par bya ba ma yin🔽no zhes bya bar dmigs so //
translated: They are objectified as not being objects of aspiration.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos snye bar zhi zhing spangs pa dang / de gnyis kyi gzhi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nye bar zhi zhing @130b spangs pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs te /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos snye bar zhi zhing spangs pa dang / de gnyis kyi gzhi nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nye bar zhi zhing @130b spangs pa'i 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis dmigs te /
translated: The reality of cessation, which is the complete elimination and abandonment of the imputed person and imputed phenomena, and the basis of those two, the five appropriated aggregates, is focused on by the concentration of absence of expectancy.

original: ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: How is it focused on?

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba yin no zhes dmigs so ;
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba yin no zhes dmigs so ;
translated: The reality of cessation is focused on as being free from all signs of eyes, forms, and so on.

original: / ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum po ni /🔽gzung 'dzin dngos por shes par bya //
analyzed: / ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum po ni / gzung 'dzin dngos por shes par bya //
translated: The three kinds of concentration

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: are to be understood as the knowledge of the apprehended and apprehender as entities.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na stong pa nyid dang / smon lam med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo lta bur gyur par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na stong pa nyid dang / smon lam med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo lta bur gyur par shes par bya ste /
translated: As explained above, the three concentrations on emptiness, absence of expectancy and absence of attributes are to be understood as the knowledge of the apprehended and apprehender as entities.

original: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis pa dang / de'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / de dag nye bar zhi ba yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzung ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis pa dang / de'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / de dag nye bar zhi ba yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzung ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness, the five appropriating aggregates which are the basis of that, and the pacification of those, the characteristic of the perfected nature, are like the objective apprehended entity.

original: stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni 'dzin pa'i dngos po lta bur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni 'dzin pa'i dngos po lta bur shes par bya'o //
translated: The three concentrations on emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness should be understood as like the subjective apprehending entity.🔽The three objective spheres are the two kinds of selflessness, the five appropriating aggregates which are the basis of that, and the pacification of those, the characteristic of the perfected nature.

original: gzung ba'i spyod yul gsum la 'dzin pa ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzung ba'i spyod yul gsum la 'dzin pa ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The three concentrations on emptiness and so on are the objective sphere of those.

original: yul du gyur pa bdag med pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas su gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / de dag nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
analyzed: yul du gyur pa bdag med pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas su gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang / de dag nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ste /
translated: The three objective spheres are the two kinds of selflessness, the five appropriating aggregates which are the basis of that, and the pacification of those, the characteristic of the perfected nature. The objective sphere of those is the three concentrations on emptiness and so on.

original: de bas na bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa ni gzung bar gzhag / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum ni 'dzin par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis la sogs pa ni gzung bar gzhag / stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum ni 'dzin par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, the two kinds of selflessness, etc. are to be posited as the objective, and the three samadhis of emptiness, etc. are to be posited as the subjective.

original: bdag med pa gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are the objective domain of the samadhi of emptiness.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi gnas ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis kyi gnas ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul lo //
translated: The basis of the two graspings is the objective domain of the samadhi of wishlessness.

original: de dag nye bar zhi ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: de dag nye bar zhi ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul te /
translated: The pacification of those is the objective domain of the samadhi of signlessness.

original: tshig de dag gis ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi spyod yul gang yin pa bstan to //🔽rnam mi rtog dang rgyab kyis phyogs //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi spyod yul gang yin pa bstan to // rnam mi rtog dang rgyab kyis phyogs //
translated: By these words the objective domains of the three samadhis are taught.🔽The samadhi of emptiness is without discrimination,

original: dga' ba dang ni rtag tu ldan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ni rtag tu ldan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and is always associated with joy.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gsum ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The three samadhis of emptiness, etc. are characterized by nondiscrimination.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin des kun brtags kyi chos dang / kun brtags kyi gang zag la yod par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin des kun brtags kyi chos dang / kun brtags kyi gang zag la yod par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration of emptiness has the characteristic of non-apprehension, because it does not apprehend the existence of the imagined reality and the imagined individual.

original: smon pa'i med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rgyab kyis phyogs @131a * //🔽pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: smon pa'i med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rgyab kyis phyogs @131a * // pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The concentration of wishlessness has the characteristic of turning away,

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang chos rnams byung ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rten du gyur par khong du chud pas chags pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang chos rnams byung ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rten du gyur par khong du chud pas chags pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it turns away from the five aggregates as objects of clinging, which are the cause of the arising of the imagined individual and phenomena, and the basis of various kinds of suffering.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rtag tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rtag tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The concentration of signlessness has the characteristic of constant delight,🔽because it delights in the peacefulness of the imagined individual and phenomena.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / chos su la 'khrul pa spangs pa dang / de dag gi gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la rtag tu sems dga' ba skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / chos su la 'khrul pa spangs pa dang / de dag gi gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la rtag tu sems dga' ba skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: The characteristic of the perfected is the abandonment of the imagined person and phenomena, and the abandonment of the five appropriated aggregates which are the basis of those two, and the attainment of nirvana.

original: tshig de dag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: These words indicate the characteristic of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum du ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum du ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the concentrations explained as three?🔽Therefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / yongs su shes dang spang ba dang / mngon sum du ni bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yongs su shes dang spang ba dang / mngon sum du ni bya ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of complete understanding, abandonment, and realization,

original: rnam pa gsum du rab tu bshad //🔽ces smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du rab tu bshad // ces smos te /
translated: they are explained as three kinds.

original: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum bshad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gsum bshad do //
translated: The three concentrations on emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness are explained as three concentrations for the sake of complete understanding, abandonment, and realization.

original: de la kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i stong pa shes par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin pa bshad de /
analyzed: de la kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i stong pa shes par bya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin pa bshad de /
translated: The concentration of emptiness is explained in order to understand the emptiness of the selflessness of persons and phenomena that are imagined.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis ni kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag gi stong pa khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis ni kun brtags kyi chos dang gang zag gi stong pa khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the concentration of emptiness comprehends the emptiness of the imagined person and phenomena.

original: de'i gnas su gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad do //
analyzed: de'i gnas su gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga spang bar bya ba'i phyir ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad do //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness is explained in order to abandon the five appropriated aggregates, which are the basis of suffering.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can yin par shes nas spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can yin par shes nas spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the concentration of wishlessness, having understood that the five appropriated aggregates have the nature of suffering, abandons them.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / chos su brtags pa dang yang bral //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / chos su brtags pa dang yang bral //
translated: It is free from the imagined person and the imagined phenomena.

original: de'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga spangs pa'i yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad do ;
analyzed: de'i gnas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga spangs pa'i yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bshad do ;
translated: The concentration of signlessness is explained for the purpose of manifesting the perfected nature, which is the abandonment of the five appropriated aggregates that are its basis.

original: / mya ngan las 'das pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mya ngan las 'das pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana is manifested by the concentration of signlessness.

original: mdo sde rgyan bam po drug pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan bam po drug pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the sixth chapter of the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras is completed.

original: // / chos kyi mdo rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / chos kyi mdo rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two verses that begin “The Dharma is explained through four summaries” are as follows.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi 'og tu chos @131b kyi mdo bzhis bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi 'og tu chos @131b kyi mdo bzhis bshad par 'brel pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the connection between the three concentrations and the explanation through the four summaries?

original: gong du ting nge 'dzin gyi yul dang / mtshan nyid la sogs pa bshad na /
analyzed: gong du ting nge 'dzin gyi yul dang / mtshan nyid la sogs pa bshad na /
translated: If the objects of the concentrations, their characteristics, and so on, were explained above,

original: chos gang la bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma bstan te /
analyzed: chos gang la bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma bstan te /
translated: the cause of accomplishing the three concentrations through meditation on any Dharma was not taught.

original: de bas na chos kyi mdo bzhi la bsgoms na ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rgyu chos kyi mdo bzhi yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi mdo bzhi la bsgoms na ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rgyu chos kyi mdo bzhi yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that the four summaries of the Dharma are the cause of the three meditative concentrations,🔽the four summaries of the Dharma are explained after meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu chos kyi mdo bzhi bshad par 'brel to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu chos kyi mdo bzhi bshad par 'brel to //
translated: The four summaries of the Dharma

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu yi phyir //🔽chos kyi mdo ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu yi phyir // chos kyi mdo ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: are the cause of meditative concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bshad pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bshad pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas explain

original: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum du mngon du bya ba'i rgyur byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs phyir // zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum du mngon du bya ba'i rgyur byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: in order to benefit sentient beings.🔽In order to actualize the three meditative concentrations of emptiness,🔽wishlessness and signlessness, the bodhisattvas explain the four summaries of the Dharma: all conditioned things are impermanent, all conditioned things are suffering,

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar chos kyi mdo bzhi bshad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar chos kyi mdo bzhi bshad de /
translated: all phenomena are selfless and peace is nirvana.

original: su la bshad ce na /
analyzed: su la bshad ce na /
translated: To whom are they explained?

original: sems can rnams la bshad do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bshad do //
translated: It is taught to sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it taught?

original: sems can rnams phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i phyir bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is taught for the sake of benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: de la 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Among them, all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All conditioned things are suffering, and so on.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gnyis ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du bya ba'i rgyu'i dngos por bshad de /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gnyis ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du bya ba'i rgyu'i dngos por bshad de /
translated: The Dharma instruction of “All conditioned things are impermanent” and the Dharma instruction of “All conditioned things are suffering” are explained as the basis for the cause of actualizing the concentration of wishlessness.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes rnam pa gnyis ltar bsgoms na sog le'i so dang 'dra ba'i 'dus byas rnams la chags shing smon lam mi 'debs pas smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes rnam pa gnyis ltar bsgoms na sog le'i so dang 'dra ba'i 'dus byas rnams la chags shing smon lam mi 'debs pas smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'grub ste /
translated: If one meditates in the two aspects, “all conditioned things are impermanent” and “all conditioned things are suffering,” one does not crave or pray for conditioned things which are like the edge of a razor, so one accomplishes the concentration of wishlessness.

original: de bas na chos kyi mdo gnyis ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi mdo gnyis ni smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the two Dharma instructions are explained as the things that are the cause of the concentration of wishlessness.

original: chos thams cad bdag med ces bya ba la ni stong pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med ces bya ba la ni stong pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “All phenomena are selfless” is the one of emptiness.

original: chos thams cad bdag med ces bya ba'i chos kyi mdo ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad de /🔽kun brtags @132a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med ces bya ba'i chos kyi mdo ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad de / kun brtags @132a * //
translated: The Dharma instruction of “all phenomena are selfless” is explained as the thing that is the cause of the concentration of emptiness.

original: kyi gang zag la bdag med pa dang / kun brtags kyi chos la bdag med par bsgoms na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin 'grub ste /
analyzed: kyi gang zag la bdag med pa dang / kun brtags kyi chos la bdag med par bsgoms na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin 'grub ste /
translated: If one meditates on the selflessness of the imputed person and the selflessness of the imputed phenomena, one accomplishes the concentration of emptiness.

original: de bas na chos kyi mdo gsum pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi mdo gsum pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the third Dharma-point is explained as the basis for the cause of the meditative stabilization of emptiness.

original: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Peace” is nirvana, etc.

original: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad de /
analyzed: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad de /
translated: The Dharma-point that “peace is nirvana” is explained as the basis for the cause of the meditative stabilization of signlessness.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni dbang po dang yul la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa thams cad las 'das pa'i rnam par bsgoms na mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'grub ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni dbang po dang yul la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa thams cad las 'das pa'i rnam par bsgoms na mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'grub ste /
translated: If one meditates on nirvana, which is free from all signs of the faculties, objects, etc., and beyond all discursive thought and investigation, then the meditative stabilization of signlessness is accomplished.

original: de bas na chos kyi mdo bzhi pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi mdo bzhi pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu'i dngos por bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the fourth Dharma-point is explained as the basis for the cause of the meditative stabilization of signlessness.

original: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtag pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How is the meaning of impermanence, etc.?

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi mdo bzhi bshad pa la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi mdo bzhi bshad pa la /
translated: The four noble truths are the subject matter of the four noble truths.

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni ji lta bu sdug bsngal ba'i don ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni ji lta bu sdug bsngal ba'i don ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is the meaning of impermanence? What is the meaning of suffering?

original: bdag med pa'i don ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is the meaning of selflessness?

original: zhi ba'i don ni ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba'i don ni ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of peace?

original: med pa'i don dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa'i don dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of non-existence,

original: mi rtag ces bya ba'i sgra /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba'i sgra /
translated: The word impermanent

original: rgya gar skad du /🔽aa ni ta ta zhes bya ba 'byung ste ;
analyzed: rgya gar skad du / aa ni ta ta zhes bya ba 'byung ste ;
translated: In Sanskrit,🔽comes from the word anitya.

original: aa ni med pa'i don to //
analyzed: aa ni med pa'i don to //
translated: A means non-existence.

original: ni ta ta ni rtag pa'i don te /
analyzed: ni ta ta ni rtag pa'i don te /
translated: Nitya means permanent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of birth and destruction for bodhisattvas is not the meaning of impermanence.

original: gang du rtag tu med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang du rtag tu med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of permanent non-existence is the meaning of impermanence.

original: rtag tu med pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtag tu med pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is permanent non-existence?

original: 'dus byas rnams la kun du brtags pa'i gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos rnams ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du med de kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rtag tu med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams la kun du brtags pa'i gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos rnams ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du med de kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rtag tu med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: The person imagined in the compounded, and the imagined phenomena, are like the horns of a rabbit, because the characteristic of the imagined is always non-existent. The meaning of non-existence is the meaning of impermanence.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, in the noble Aksayamatinirdesa it is said:

original: de la mi rtag pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meaning of impermanence?

original: med pa'i don dang mi rtag pa'i don te /
analyzed: med pa'i don dang mi rtag pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of non-existence and the meaning of impermanence.

original: dngos po 'jig pa'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the meaning of the destruction of things.

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni chos la bdag med pa ste /
translated: The meaning of impermanence is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa gang yang med /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa gang yang med /
translated: Since it is devoid of intrinsic reality, there is no destruction in it.

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: This is the meaning of impermanence.”

original: de ni 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan @132b to ;
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan @132b to ;
translated: This is the teaching of the meaning of the Dharma-discourse “All compounded things are impermanent.”

original: / rnam rtog don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rnam rtog don zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of conceptualization.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun du rtog pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i don ni sdug bsngal ba'i don te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par kun du rtog pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i don ni sdug bsngal ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the reality of suffering is the dependent reality, which is the mind and mental factors that conceive of the duality of subject and object.

original: ji tsam du gzhan gyi dbang gis gzung ba dang / 'dzin par kun tu rtog par byed pa'i de tsam du 'khor ba na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji tsam du gzhan gyi dbang gis gzung ba dang / 'dzin par kun tu rtog par byed pa'i de tsam du 'khor ba na sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: As long as one conceives of the duality of subject and object in the dependent reality, one suffers in samsara.

original: de bas na gzhan dbang phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i don ni sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan dbang phyin ci log tu rtog pa'i don ni sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the dependent reality as the conception of the unreal is the meaning of suffering.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamatinirdesa states:

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of suffering?

original: dga' ba med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the absence of joy is the meaning of suffering.

original: dga' ba zad pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba zad pa ni sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the exhaustion of joy is the meaning of suffering.

original: smon pa med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the absence of wishes is the meaning of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sgra rab tu bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sgra rab tu bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the teaching of the word suffering is the meaning of suffering.

original: 'dis ni 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan to /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan to /
translated: This shows the meaning of the Dharma-Discourse called “All Formations are Impermanent.”

original: yongs su rtogs don de bzhin te //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs don de bzhin te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “complete understanding” is just like that.

original: de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni nges par yod de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni nges par yod de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Just like that” means “definitely.”

original: kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang kun brtags pa'i chos la ni bdag dang rang bzhin med kyi /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gang zag dang kun brtags pa'i chos la ni bdag dang rang bzhin med kyi /
translated: The imagined person and the imagined thing do not have self or intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar kun du rtog par byed pa'i gzhan dbang med pa ma yin pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar kun du rtog par byed pa'i gzhan dbang med pa ma yin pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don te /
translated: But the meaning of “selflessness” is not that the other-dependent, which is the basis of that imagination, does not exist.

original: don du na kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / chos la rang bzhin med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to //
analyzed: don du na kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / chos la rang bzhin med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to //
translated: In fact, the meaning of “selflessness” is that the imagined person and thing do not have intrinsic nature.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
