translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamati Sūtra says,

original: de la bdag med pa'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag med pa'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meaning of selflessness?

original: bdag ni shin tu bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ni shin tu bdag med pa ste /
translated: The self is utterly selfless.

original: gang bdag med pa'i don de ni gsob po //
analyzed: gang bdag med pa'i don de ni gsob po //
translated: The meaning of selflessness is that it is a void,

original: gsog go / rang lus pa'o //
analyzed: gsog go / rang lus pa'o //
translated: a void, a mere thing,

original: stong pa'o // stong pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don te /
analyzed: stong pa'o // stong pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of emptiness is the meaning of selflessness.

original: 'di ni bdag med pa'i don zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag med pa'i don zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called the meaning of selflessness.

original: 'dis ni chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the Dharma instruction called The Selflessness of All Phenomena.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhi ba'i don zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhi ba'i don zhes bya ba la //
translated: The meaning of pacifying conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa sems dang sems las byang ba gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos su rtog pa dang bral te /🔽gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma spangs nas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gang yin pa zhi ba mya ngan las @133a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sems dang sems las byang ba gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos su rtog pa dang bral te / gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma spangs nas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gang yin pa zhi ba mya ngan las @133a * //
translated: Conceptualization is the characteristic of the dependent nature, which is mind and mental factors. It is free from the conceptualization of the imputed person and imputed phenomena.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don kyang de yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don kyang de yin no //
translated: Having abandoned the stains of apprehended object and apprehending subject, it is the meaning of the thoroughly established nature. That is also the meaning of nirvana, called “peace.”

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the noble Aksayamati Sūtra says,

original: de la bzhi ba'i don gang zhe na /🔽zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bzhi ba'i don gang zhe na / zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: “What is the meaning of the fourth?🔽Peace is not pacified.

original: zhi ba nyid zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace itself is peace.

original: ma zhi ba yang zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma zhi ba yang zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The pacification of what is not tranquil is not pacification.

original: gang zhi ba'i don de ni mtshan ma thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhi ba'i don de ni mtshan ma thams cad nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: The meaning of pacification is the pacification of all signs.

original: 'di ni zhi ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is called pacification.

original: 'dis ni zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the Dharma-discourse called “Tranquility is Nirvana.”

original: de dag bzhi ni bstan pa yi //
analyzed: de dag bzhi ni bstan pa yi //
translated: These four are taught

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the verse:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi mdo bzhi'i don ni gong du bshad pa de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi mdo bzhi'i don ni gong du bshad pa de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the four Dharma-discourses of the bodhisattvas is as explained above.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of non-existence for the bodhisattvas is the meaning of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa'i don la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of meaning of impermanence:

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i don dang med pa'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i don dang med pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of arising and ceasing and the meaning of non-existence.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i don ni nyan thos la sogs pa lta bu skye ba dang 'jig pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mi rtag pa'i don ni nyan thos la sogs pa lta bu skye ba dang 'jig pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of impermanence for bodhisattvas is not the meaning of impermanence as the arising and passing away of the śrāvakas, etc.

original: gang med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don du 'dod do //
analyzed: gang med pa'i don ni mi rtag pa'i don du 'dod do //
translated: The meaning of non-existence is accepted as the meaning of impermanence.

original: gang rtag tu med pa de ni mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang rtag tu med pa de ni mi rtag pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is always non-existent is impermanent.

original: de bas na gang rtag tu med pa de la mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang rtag tu med pa de la mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is always non-existent is called impermanent.

original: rtag tu med pa de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtag tu med pa de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that which is always non-existent?

original: kun du brtags pa'i gang zag dang / kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i gang zag dang / kun du brtags pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The imagined person and imagined phenomena.

original: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du rtag tu med de /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid thams cad ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du rtag tu med de /
translated: All characteristics of the imagined are always non-existent like the horn of a rabbit.

original: kun brtags rtag tu med pa nyid la mi rtag pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags rtag tu med pa nyid la mi rtag pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The always non-existence of the imagined is called impermanence.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la rtog pa'i don ni sdug bsngal ba'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la rtog pa'i don ni sdug bsngal ba'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of false imagination is the meaning of suffering.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos la yod par rtog pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i don la sdug bsngal ba'i don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang / kun brtags kyi chos la yod par rtog pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i don la sdug bsngal ba'i don zhes bya ste /
translated: The meaning of suffering is the mind and mental factors that conceive of the existence of the imagined person and the imagined entity.

original: don du gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don du gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la sdug bsngal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In reality, the meaning of suffering is the dependent reality.

original: de ni mdor na 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mdor na 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: In brief, this is what is being taught:

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams med pa'i gang zag dang chos la yod par phyin ci log tu rtog ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams med pa'i gang zag dang chos la yod par phyin ci log tu rtog ste /
translated: The mind and mental factors that are associated with error conceive of the existence of the person and the entity as existing in a way that is contrary to reality.

original: ji tsam du phyin ci log par yod pa de srid du skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung zhing bslad pa'i bdag nyid yin pas sdug bsngal @133b ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du phyin ci log par yod pa de srid du skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung zhing bslad pa'i bdag nyid yin pas sdug bsngal @133b ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: As long as there is existence in a way that is contrary to reality, suffering arises, such as birth, old age, etc. And because it is a nature that is affected by error, it is called “suffering.”

original: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas rnams skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: yang na zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung bas rnams skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can te /
translated: Alternatively, the mind and mental factors that are associated with the error of being subject to contamination arise and perish.

original: gang skye zhing 'jig par 'gyur pa'i don de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang skye zhing 'jig par 'gyur pa'i don de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of impermanent is that which arises and passes away.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal te /
translated: That which is impermanent is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba de nyid sdug bsngal ba'i don te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba de nyid sdug bsngal ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of suffering is that which is suffering.

original: des 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gnyis kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: des 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba dang / 'dus byas thams cad sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo gnyis kyi don bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the two Dharma sūtras: “All conditioned things are impermanent” and “All conditioned things are suffering.”

original: yongs su rtog pa tsam gyi don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa tsam gyi don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of mere conceptualization is the meaning of selflessness.

original: yongs su rtog pa gzhan dbang tsam ni yod kyi /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa gzhan dbang tsam ni yod kyi /
translated: Conceptualization is mere dependent nature.

original: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang chos med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi gang zag dang chos med pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of selflessness is the meaning of the nonexistence of the imputed person and phenomena.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to teach that very meaning, the phrase “the word ‘just’ is for the sake of exclusion” means

original: ka ri k'a las /
analyzed: ka ri k'a las /
translated: in the Kārikā:

original: de bzhin te zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba nges par yod pa'i don du drangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin te zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba nges par yod pa'i don du drangs te /
translated: The word “thus” is to be interpreted as having the meaning of “certainly.”

original: yongs su brtags pa'i gang zag dang / yongs su brtags pa'i chos ni med kyi /🔽de la kun du rtog par byed pa'i gzhan dbang gi sems tsam ni yod pa'i don la /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i gang zag dang / yongs su brtags pa'i chos ni med kyi / de la kun du rtog par byed pa'i gzhan dbang gi sems tsam ni yod pa'i don la /
translated: The imputed person and the imputed phenomena do not exist.

original: bdag med pa'i don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i don zhes bya ste /
translated: The meaning of “selflessness” is that the mind only, which is the dependent that imagines them, exists.

original: kun brtags kyi chos dang / gang zag la rang bzhin med pa nyid bdag med pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun brtags kyi chos dang / gang zag la rang bzhin med pa nyid bdag med pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “selflessness” is that the imputed phenomena and the person have no intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nye bar zhi ba'i don ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of “the pacification of all conceptualization” and so on is as follows.

original: rnam gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: rnam gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la /
translated: The dependent characteristic

original: kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid kun du brtags pa'i chos dang bral nas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i don la zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid kun du brtags pa'i chos dang bral nas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba'i don la zhi ba mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o//
translated: is said to be “nirvana,” which is the meaning of “pacification,” because it becomes the perfected characteristic after being freed from the imputed reality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni mtshan nyid skad cig tu 'jig pa'i don kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni mtshan nyid skad cig tu 'jig pa'i don kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The other-dependent characteristic also has the meaning of momentary destruction.

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i don la yang mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i don la yang mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Also, impermanence is said to have the meaning of arising and ceasing.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gag / phyi ma mi skye ste /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gag / phyi ma mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, the previous moment of the other-dependent characteristic ceases, and the subsequent moment does not arise.

original: skad cig ma'i don la yang mi rtag pa'i don du blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i don la yang mi rtag pa'i don du blta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of momentariness should be seen as having the meaning of impermanence. This is the meaning.

original: de bas na de sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na de sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, in order to establish that, it is said.

original: de ltar gzhan dbang rnams skad cig ma yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dbang rnams skad cig ma yin pas na /
translated: Thus, since the other-dependent is momentary,

original: ji ltar skad cig ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bcus skad cig ma yin pa'i rgyu dang gtan tshigs ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig ma yin pa bsgrub pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa bcus skad cig ma yin pa'i rgyu dang gtan tshigs ston to //
translated: in order to establish momentariness, ten verses are taught as the causes and reasons for momentariness.

original: mi rigs rgyu las byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mi rigs rgyu las byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of arising from an improper cause,

original: @134a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: @134a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po rnams tshad mas bsgrub pa la ni rnam pa gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams tshad mas bsgrub pa la ni rnam pa gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In establishing things by valid cognition, there are three ways of establishing them.

original: dam bca' ba dang / rgyu dang dpe'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba dang / rgyu dang dpe'o //
translated: The thesis, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na / dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med //
analyzed: dper na / dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med //
translated: For example, “All things are essenceless.”

original: ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: This is the thesis.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: “ Because they are devoid of the nature of being one or many” is the reason.

original: gzugs brnyan bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: “ Like a reflection” is the example.

original: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang tshigs bcad bcu'i mjug nas 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dam bca' ba ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar 'dir yang tshigs bcad bcu'i mjug nas 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig ni dam bca' ba ste /
translated: Similarly, here, the words “All conditioned phenomena are impermanent” at the end of the ten verses is the thesis.

original: ji ltar dam bca' zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dam bca' zhe na /
translated: How is it a thesis?

original: phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jug pas na /
analyzed: phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jug pas na /
translated: Because outer and inner conditioned phenomena engage in momentariness,

original: mi rtag pa yin par dam bcas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin par dam bcas so //
translated: it is a thesis that they are impermanent.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: mi rigs rgyu las byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mi rigs rgyu las byung ba'i phyir //
translated: because they arise from causes,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni phyi nang gi dngos po gnyi ga bsdus nas mi rtag pa yin par gtan tshigs kyis ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni phyi nang gi dngos po gnyi ga bsdus nas mi rtag pa yin par gtan tshigs kyis ston te /
translated: and so on. In these two verses, having subsumed both outer and inner things, it teaches the reason that they are impermanent.

original: de la gtan tshigs ni mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu las byung ba'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid nges pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs ni mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu las byung ba'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid nges pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The reasonings are: because it is illogical, because it arises from causes, because it is contradictory, because it does not endure by itself, because it is nonexistent, because its characteristics are ascertained, because it is subsequent,

original: 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur ba nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i phyir dang / zin pa'i phyir dang / dbang gi phyir dang / dag pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams mi rtag go zhes dam bca' ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur ba nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i phyir dang / zin pa'i phyir dang / dbang gi phyir dang / dag pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams mi rtag go zhes dam bca' ste /
translated: because it is cessation, because change is observed, because of cause and effect, because it is grasped, because of power, because of purity, because it follows sentient beings, and because internal and external compounded phenomena are impermanent.

original: mi rigs pa la sogs pa mi rtag par sgrub pa'i rgyu dang gtan tshigs yin no//
analyzed: mi rigs pa la sogs pa mi rtag par sgrub pa'i rgyu dang gtan tshigs yin no//
translated: These are the reasons and proofs that establish impermanence, such as illogicality.

original: de yang ji ltar 'grub ce na zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams mi rtag pa dang / skad cig ma yin par rgyu gang dang / gtan tshigs gang dang / tshad ma gang gis 'grub ce na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar 'grub ce na zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams mi rtag pa dang / skad cig ma yin par rgyu gang dang / gtan tshigs gang dang / tshad ma gang gis 'grub ce na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means by what cause, what reason, and what valid cognition are internal and external conditioned phenomena established as impermanent and momentary?

original: skad cig ma med par 'dus byas rnams 'jug par mi rigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: skad cig ma med par 'dus byas rnams 'jug par mi rigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la ;
translated: Because it is illogical for conditioned phenomena to engage without momentary cessation.

original: phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma snga ma 'gags shing phyi ma skye ba'i tshul du rgyun ma chad par 'byung zhing 'jug par ri rigs te /
analyzed: phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma snga ma 'gags shing phyi ma skye ba'i tshul du rgyun ma chad par 'byung zhing 'jug par ri rigs te /
translated: It is illogical for internal and external conditioned phenomena to arise and engage in an uninterrupted continuum in the manner of the cessation of a previous moment and the arising of a later moment.

original: 'dus byas rnams te rgyun du 'byung bas na skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams te rgyun du 'byung bas na skad cig ma yin no //
translated: Because conditioned phenomena arise continuously, they are momentary.

original: 'jug pa mi rigs zhes smras ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa mi rigs zhes smras ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the meaning of the statement engagement is illogical,

original: 'jug pa @134b ni rgyun du 'byung bas na 'jug pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jug pa @134b ni rgyun du 'byung bas na 'jug pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says engagement is called continuous arising.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don ni breng ma chad pa'am /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don ni breng ma chad pa'am /
translated: The meaning of engagement is uninterrupted,🔽unbroken,

original: 'dab chags sam /
analyzed: 'dab chags sam /
translated: or birds,🔽🔽

original: snga phyi'i rgyun 'brel par skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gags /
analyzed: snga phyi'i rgyun 'brel par skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gags /
translated: The continuum of earlier and later moments is connected.🔽The earlier moment ceases and the later moment arises.🔽The way in which they occur without interruption is like the flow of a river.

original: phyi ma ni skye ba'i tshul du chu'i rgyun bzhin du breng ma chad par 'byung ba la 'jug pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: phyi ma ni skye ba'i tshul du chu'i rgyun bzhin du breng ma chad par 'byung ba la 'jug pa zhes bya'o//
translated: This is called engagement.

original: breng ma chad pa la 'jug pa zhes bya bar gyur kyang de skad du smras pa dang / des ci zhig bsgrub pa yin snyam pa la de'i phyir /
analyzed: breng ma chad pa la 'jug pa zhes bya bar gyur kyang de skad du smras pa dang / des ci zhig bsgrub pa yin snyam pa la de'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is called engagement without interruption, what is accomplished by saying that?

original: de yang skad cig ma re re la skye ba dang / 'gag pa med par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /🔽de ltar rgyun du 'jug pa de yang skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gags /
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma re re la skye ba dang / 'gag pa med par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te / de ltar rgyun du 'jug pa de yang skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gags /
translated: Therefore it is said that it is not tenable that it arises and ceases in every moment.

original: phyi ma skye ba'i tshul du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa rgyun du 'jug par mi rung ste /
analyzed: phyi ma skye ba'i tshul du skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa rgyun du 'jug par mi rung ste /
translated: That engagement in a continuum is not tenable without arising and ceasing in the manner of the earlier moment ceasing and the later moment arising.

original: dper na chu'i skad cig ma'i rgyun 'bab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu'i skad cig ma'i rgyun 'bab pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the flow of the momentary stream of a river.

original: de ste yang dus gzhan du 'jug cing snga ma dang phyi ma 'gog pa dang / skye ba'i rgyun gyis 'jug par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ste yang dus gzhan du 'jug cing snga ma dang phyi ma 'gog pa dang / skye ba'i rgyun gyis 'jug par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: If you assert that it engages in activity at another time, having ceased previously and subsequently, and that it engages in activity through the continuum of arising, then that is also illogical.

original: skad cig ma dang po de rgyus skyes nas de ma thag tu mi 'gag gi / lo'am zhag gam zla ba'i bar du ma 'gags par 'dug nas /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po de rgyus skyes nas de ma thag tu mi 'gag gi / lo'am zhag gam zla ba'i bar du ma 'gags par 'dug nas /
translated: If others think that the first moment arises from a cause and does not cease immediately, but remains without ceasing for a year, a day, or a month,

original: de nas yang de 'gags te /
analyzed: de nas yang de 'gags te /
translated: and then it ceases,

original: skad cig ma gzhan rgyus bskyed nas rgyus bskyed pa'i skad cig ma de yang lo'am zla ba'am zhag 'gags te ;
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan rgyus bskyed nas rgyus bskyed pa'i skad cig ma de yang lo'am zla ba'am zhag 'gags te ;
translated: and another moment is generated by a cause, and that moment generated by a cause also remains for a year, a month, or a day and then ceases,

original: yang gzhan skye ba'i tshul du rgyun du 'jug par rung ngo snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yang gzhan skye ba'i tshul du rgyun du 'jug par rung ngo snyam du sems pa la /
translated: and another arises in the same way, it is suitable that it engages in activity through a continuum.

original: de yang mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: de yang mi rung bar ston to //
translated: This is also illogical.

original: ji ltar mi rung bar rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung bar rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the logic of that,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir de ma thag tu 'byung ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir de ma thag tu 'byung ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “Because it would be without a cause, it would not arise immediately.”

original: gal te skad cig ma dang po rgyus bskyed nas /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma dang po rgyus bskyed nas /
translated: If the first moment is generated by a cause,

original: de'i bar du lo'am zla bar skye 'gag med par gnas na de lta na ni bar der skye 'gag gi rgyun chad de rgyun du 'jug pa med pas na dngos po rnams de'i bar na de ma thag tu rgyun du 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bar du lo'am zla bar skye 'gag med par gnas na de lta na ni bar der skye 'gag gi rgyun chad de rgyun du 'jug pa med pas na dngos po rnams de'i bar na de ma thag tu rgyun du 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to endure for a year or a month without arising or ceasing in the interim, then in that case, the continuum of arising and ceasing would be interrupted in the interim. Since there would be no engagement in a continuum, things would not arise in a continuum immediately after that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dang po'i skad cig ma rgyus bskyed nas thag gi zad cig tu rgyun med par gnas par 'dod de /
analyzed: dang po'i skad cig ma rgyus bskyed nas thag gi zad cig tu rgyun med par gnas par 'dod de /
translated: After it is generated by the cause of the first moment, it is asserted that it endures without a continuum for a while.

original: de ltar na bar na gnas pa'i tshe na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na bar na gnas pa'i tshe na yang /
translated: In that case, when it endures in the interim,

original: rgyu gang gis gnas pa'i tshe yang brjod dgos la /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis gnas pa'i tshe yang brjod dgos la /
translated: one must say by what cause it endures.

original: de 'gags nas phyis skad cig ma gzhan skye ba yang rgyu gang gis bskyed pa'i rgyu yang smra dgos te /🔽'di yang chad kyis mi rigs pa zhes bya ba'i @135a * //
analyzed: de 'gags nas phyis skad cig ma gzhan skye ba yang rgyu gang gis bskyed pa'i rgyu yang smra dgos te / 'di yang chad kyis mi rigs pa zhes bya ba'i @135a * //
translated: Also, after it ceases, one must say by what cause the subsequent moment is generated, since it is generated by a cause.

original: don bshad do //
analyzed: don bshad do //
translated: This is explained to have the meaning of “it is not tenable that it is interrupted.”

original: skyes nas dus rgyun med par dngos po dus gzhan du gnas par mi rung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyes nas dus rgyun med par dngos po dus gzhan du gnas par mi rung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not suitable for a thing to endure at another time without a continuum after it arises.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma dang po rgyus bskyed nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma dang po rgyus bskyed nas /
translated: Moreover, the first moment is generated by a cause.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad ma 'gags kyi bar de na yang /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad ma 'gags kyi bar de na yang /
translated: And as long as the second moment and so on are not stopped,

original: skad cig ma skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba med par ni dngos po rnams dus gzhan du snang zhing rgyun du 'byung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul du rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba med par ni dngos po rnams dus gzhan du snang zhing rgyun du 'byung bar mi rung ste /
translated: it is not tenable that things appear at another time and arise in a continuum without the occurrence of a continuum that is the process of the arising and ceasing of moments.

original: dper na chu skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyu cha 'bab pa yod na ni chu'i bred rgyun du snang la skad cig ma rgyun du 'bab pa chad nas chu 'bab par mi snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyu cha 'bab pa yod na ni chu'i bred rgyun du snang la skad cig ma rgyun du 'bab pa chad nas chu 'bab par mi snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, if there is a flow of water that is the continuum of moments, the continuum of the water appears to flow. If the flow of the continuum of moments is interrupted, the flow of the water does not appear.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it arises from a cause.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun med par dngos po rnams dus gzhan du snang bar ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun med par dngos po rnams dus gzhan du snang bar ci'i phyir mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable that things appear at another time without the continuum of moments?

original: ji ltar dngos po rnams ni rgyu las skyes te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po rnams ni rgyu las skyes te /
translated: Because things arise from causes.

original: skad cig ma dang po ji ltar rgyus bskyed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po ji ltar rgyus bskyed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the first moment is generated by a cause,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad pa ma 'gags kyi bar du gnas par 'dod na /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad pa ma 'gags kyi bar du gnas par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that it endures until the second moment without ceasing,

original: de'i bar na gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i bar na gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yang mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not tenable that it endures in between because

original: gnas par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa smra bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa smra bar bya dgos so //
translated: you must state the cause of its endurance.

original: yang dngos po gang dus gzhan du yang skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par gnas shing rtag tu yang snang ba'i dngos po de dag ni rgyu las skyes te /
analyzed: yang dngos po gang dus gzhan du yang skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun mi 'chad par gnas shing rtag tu yang snang ba'i dngos po de dag ni rgyu las skyes te /
translated: Moreover, any thing that endures without interruption by the stream of moments at another time and that is always seen arises from causes.

original: dper na mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a lamp.

original: ji ltar mar me rgyu las skyes pas skad cig ma'i rgyun du rgyun mi 'chad par snang la /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me rgyu las skyes pas skad cig ma'i rgyun du rgyun mi 'chad par snang la /
translated: Just as a lamp arises from causes and is seen without interruption by the stream of moments,

original: ras dad mar me la sogs pa'i rgyu zad de med par gyur na ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du dngos po 'di dag kyang rgyun du snang bar 'dod na ni rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: ras dad mar me la sogs pa'i rgyu zad de med par gyur na ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba bzhin du dngos po 'di dag kyang rgyun du snang bar 'dod na ni rgyu las skyes pa yin te /
translated: if the causes of a cloth, a lamp, and so on are exhausted and cease, they are not seen. Similarly, if you assert that these things are seen in a stream, they arise from causes.

original: nam rgyu zad dam med par gyur na rgyun du snang ba yang chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam rgyu zad dam med par gyur na rgyun du snang ba yang chad par 'gyur te /
translated: When the causes are exhausted or cease, the stream of appearances will be severed.

original: de bas na bar du rgyun du sdang bar byed pa'i phyir rgyu 'gag med du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na bar du rgyun du sdang bar byed pa'i phyir rgyu 'gag med du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because it is hostile to the continuum in the middle, a cause is not suitable as unceasing.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni rgyu las skyes te 'gyur ba'i don to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni rgyu las skyes te 'gyur ba'i don to zhes bya ba la /
translated: All conditioned things are born from causes, and the meaning is that they change.

original: phyi dang nang gi 'dus byas thams cad ni rgyu rkyen las skyes te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi 'dus byas thams cad ni rgyu rkyen las skyes te /
translated: All internal and external conditioned things are born from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu rkyen las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “born from causes and conditions”?

original: rgyu rkyen las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that they arise from causes and conditions.

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa de dag ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa de dag ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is that whatever is born from causes and conditions is not of the nature of permanence,

original: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but is of the nature of momentariness.

original: de gal te byung @135b nas phyis kyang 'byung na ni de la nges par rgyu yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gal te byung @135b nas phyis kyang 'byung na ni de la nges par rgyu yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were to arise after having arisen, then it would definitely have a cause.

original: skad cig ma dang po rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed de /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed de /
translated: The first moment is generated by causes and conditions.

original: byung nas skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yang 'byung zhing skye bar 'dod na ni ji skad cig ma dang pos rgyus bskyed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: byung nas skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yang 'byung zhing skye bar 'dod na ni ji skad cig ma dang pos rgyus bskyed pa bzhin du /
translated: If you assert that it arises and is produced in the second moment and so on,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang skyed par byed pa'i rgyu dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then just as it is produced by a cause in the first moment, it must also be produced by a cause in the second moment and so on.

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: If others think,

original: skad cig ma dang po la ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yod mod kyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la ni skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yod mod kyi /
translated: “Indeed, there is a cause that produces it in the first moment,

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med par rang 'jig go snyam na /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med par rang 'jig go snyam na /
translated: but in the second moment, it disintegrates without a cause that produces it,”🔽this is illogical.

original: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain why this is illogical, it says,

original: rgyu med na ni thog ma nas med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyu med na ni thog ma nas med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “If it lacks a cause, it would not exist from the outset.”

original: ji ltar skad cig ma phyi ma la skyed par byed par rgyu med na ni skad cig ma de thog ma nas med cing thog ma nas mi skye la mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig ma phyi ma la skyed par byed par rgyu med na ni skad cig ma de thog ma nas med cing thog ma nas mi skye la mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it lacks a cause that produces it in the second moment and so on, then that moment would not exist from the outset. It would not arise from the outset and would not appear.

original: de la gang dang gang rgyu yod pa de dag ni skyes te /
analyzed: de la gang dang gang rgyu yod pa de dag ni skyes te /
translated: Whatever has a cause arises,

original: dper na myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu bzhin no //
translated: like a sprout, for example.

original: gang dang gang rgyu med pa ni de mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang rgyu med pa ni de mi skye ste /
translated: Whatever has no cause does not arise,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: like a sky flower, for example.

original: yang skad cig ma phyi ma skyes pa la rgyu med na ni skad cig ma snga ma skyes pa la yang rgyu med par 'gyur te /🔽skad cig ma'i rang bzhin du 'dra bas skad cig ma la la la ni rgyu yod /
analyzed: yang skad cig ma phyi ma skyes pa la rgyu med na ni skad cig ma snga ma skyes pa la yang rgyu med par 'gyur te / skad cig ma'i rang bzhin du 'dra bas skad cig ma la la la ni rgyu yod /
translated: Moreover, if the later arising moment has no cause, then the earlier arising moment would also have no cause,🔽because they are similar in being moments.

original: la la la ni rgyu med par mi rigs so //🔽la la dag skad cig ma dang po skyed pa rgyu de nyid kyis /
analyzed: la la la ni rgyu med par mi rigs so // la la dag skad cig ma dang po skyed pa rgyu de nyid kyis /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical that some moments have causes and some moments have no causes.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma yang rgyu de nyid kyis bskyed do snyam na /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma yang rgyu de nyid kyis bskyed do snyam na /
translated: Some think that the cause that generates the first moment also generates the later moments.

original: mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rgyu de nyid kyis 'byung bar mi 'os te /
analyzed: mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir / rgyu de nyid kyis 'byung bar mi 'os te /
translated: To demonstrate that this is illogical,🔽it is said, “It is not suitable that it arises from that cause alone.”

original: de'i rgyus dgos par spyad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus dgos par spyad zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the need for a cause has already been satisfied by that cause.

original: skad cig ma snga ma skyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma skyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis /
translated: The cause that generates the earlier moment

original: phyi ma de nyid kyang bskyed par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: phyi ma de nyid kyang bskyed par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that the latter is generated by that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skad cig ma snga ma skyed pa'i rgyu des /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma skyed pa'i rgyu des /
translated: The cause that generates the former moment

original: rang gi 'bras bu bskyed nas 'gags zin pas 'gags pa des phyi ma bskyed mi nus so //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu bskyed nas 'gags zin pas 'gags pa des phyi ma bskyed mi nus so //
translated: having generated its effect, ceases. That which has ceased is unable to generate the latter.

original: rgyu gang gis 'bras bu gang bskyed de 'gags pa des gzhan mi skyed pa ni sa bon bzhin te /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis 'bras bu gang bskyed de 'gags pa des gzhan mi skyed pa ni sa bon bzhin te /
translated: The cause that generates a certain effect and ceases does not generate another. It is like a seed.

original: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu bskyed nas 'gags pa'i sa bon des sdong bu phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu bskyed nas 'gags pa'i sa bon des sdong bu phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a seed that has ceased having generated a sprout does not act as the cause that generates the subsequent stem.

original: dogs pa spyad zin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bsgrubs nas 'gags zin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dogs pa spyad zin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu bsgrubs nas 'gags zin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having already produced doubt” means having already produced its effect and ceased.

original: gal te gzhan @136a * //
analyzed: gal te gzhan @136a * //
translated: If others think,

original: dag 'di snyam du skad cig ma snga ma skyed pa'i rgyu des ni rang gi 'bras bu bskyed nas 'gags zin pas na des skad cig ma phyi ma mi skyed kyi /
analyzed: dag 'di snyam du skad cig ma snga ma skyed pa'i rgyu des ni rang gi 'bras bu bskyed nas 'gags zin pas na des skad cig ma phyi ma mi skyed kyi /
translated: “The cause that generates the former moment, having generated its effect, ceases. Therefore, it does not generate the latter moment.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma de rgyu gzhan gyis bskyed do zhe na yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma de rgyu gzhan gyis bskyed do zhe na yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the subsequent moment is produced by another cause, it is illogical.🔽To demonstrate this, it says:

original: rgyu gzhan yang mi dmigs te ;
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yang mi dmigs te ;
translated: Another cause is not observed.

original: de bas na nges par sngon gyi rgyu las gzhan 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bas na nges par sngon gyi rgyu las gzhan 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that it definitely arises from a previous cause.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma de la /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma de la /
translated: In the subsequent moment,

original: rgyu gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan yod par yang ma mthong ste /🔽de bas na skad cig ma snga ma ni rgyu /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan yod par yang ma mthong ste / de bas na skad cig ma snga ma ni rgyu /
translated: another cause that produces it is not seen.

original: phyi ma ni 'bras bu lta bur rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'bras bu lta bur rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the previous moment is like a cause and the subsequent moment is like an effect, arising in an uninterrupted continuum.

original: gong du bshad pa'i don rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i don rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize the points explained above, it says:

original: de ltar rgyun du med par dus gzhan na yod par mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du med par dus gzhan na yod par mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: Thus, without a continuum, it is not possible for it to exist at another time.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na /
translated: As explained above,

original: skad cig ma snga ma snga ma ni rgyu /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma snga ma ni rgyu /
translated: the previous moment is like a cause and

original: phyi ma phyi ma ni 'bras bu'i tshul du chu'i breng bzhin du rgyun ma chad par 'byung ba med par dngos po rnams dus thag gi zad cig tu snang zhing yod par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma ni 'bras bu'i tshul du chu'i breng bzhin du rgyun ma chad par 'byung ba med par dngos po rnams dus thag gi zad cig tu snang zhing yod par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The latter is the result, and it is not tenable that things appear and exist for a period of time without a continuum of causes occurring like a stream of water.

original: tshig de dag gis ni rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of those words is “because of arising from causes.”

original: ji ste 'di ltar gang gis rgyu dgos pa skyes zin pa ni mi skye'i /
analyzed: ji ste 'di ltar gang gis rgyu dgos pa skyes zin pa ni mi skye'i /
translated: If you assert that it is like this, that which is produced by causes does not arise again once it has arisen.

original: skyes nas kyang dus gzhan la phyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang dus gzhan la phyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Having arisen, it ceases later at another time,🔽not immediately after arising.

original: skyes ma thag tu ma yin par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu ma yin par 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: If you assert that it is like this, then if others think,

original: dngos po dang po skyes la rgyud dgos pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dngos po dang po skyes la rgyud dgos pa bzhin du /
translated: “Just as the first thing that arises has a cause,

original: skad cig ma phyi ma skyes pa la yang rgyu dgos so zhes smras pa /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma skyes pa la yang rgyu dgos so zhes smras pa /
translated: the later arising of the second moment also has a cause,”

original: gal te dngos po dang dngos po skyes pa bzhin du ;
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang dngos po skyes pa bzhin du ;
translated: if you say, “It is like this, that which is produced by causes does not arise again once it has arisen,”🔽then it follows that the arising of the second moment of a thing is causeless.

original: de'i 'og tu yang dngos po de dag skye na ni rgyu dgos pa bden na rgyu dang rkyen gyi dang por dngos po gcig bskyed nas skyes zin pa'i 'og tu dang po des phyis yang mi skyes te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang dngos po de dag skye na ni rgyu dgos pa bden na rgyu dang rkyen gyi dang por dngos po gcig bskyed nas skyes zin pa'i 'og tu dang po des phyis yang mi skyes te /
translated: If things arise after that, it is true that they require a cause, but the first of causes and conditions generates a single thing, and after it has arisen, the first one does not generate it again later.

original: skyes nas lo'am zla ba'am zhag la sogs par dus thag gi zad cig gnas nas /
analyzed: skyes nas lo'am zla ba'am zhag la sogs par dus thag gi zad cig gnas nas /
translated: Having arisen, it endures for a period of time, such as a year, a month, or a day, and so on.

original: de nas gdod phyis bdag gi skyes ma thag tu mi 'gag ste /
analyzed: de nas gdod phyis bdag gi skyes ma thag tu mi 'gag ste /
translated: After that, it does not cease immediately after it arises.

original: de bas na bar du skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu mi dgos so snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de bas na bar du skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyu mi dgos so snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, since there is no arising in the interim, it does not require a cause.”

original: de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is also illogical, it is said:

original: yang de rgyu gang gis 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang de rgyu gang gis 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “By what cause does it cease?”

original: dngos po dang po rgyus bskyed nas /
analyzed: dngos po dang po rgyus bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the first thing with a cause,

original: tha @136b gi zad cig gnas te /
analyzed: tha @136b gi zad cig gnas te /
translated: it endures for a period of time,🔽and later it ceases.

original: phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de'i dngos po gnas pa'i rang bzhin zhig pa las phyis 'gag par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba de'i dngos po gnas pa'i rang bzhin zhig pa las phyis 'gag par 'gyur ram /
translated: Does that thing cease later from the disintegration of its enduring nature?

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin zhig pa las 'gag par 'gyur bar brtag dgos so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin zhig pa las 'gag par 'gyur bar brtag dgos so //
translated: It must be analyzed whether it ceases due to the intrinsic reality of cessation.

original: gal te dngos po'i gnas pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin na gnas pa'i rang bzhin la 'jig pa'i rang bzhin med pas na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i gnas pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin na gnas pa'i rang bzhin la 'jig pa'i rang bzhin med pas na /
translated: If it is the intrinsic reality of enduring, then since the intrinsic reality of enduring is not the intrinsic reality of cessation,

original: dngos po de rnams kyang mi 'jig ste /
analyzed: dngos po de rnams kyang mi 'jig ste /
translated: those things would not cease.

original: phyis kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not cease later either.

original: rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They would endure forever.

original: gal te dngos po de 'jig pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la rtag pa dang gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pas dang po nas 'jig par 'gyur gyi bar du gnas par mi srid de /🔽dper na nam mkha' med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas dang po med pa bzhin du phyis kyang med pa kho nar gnas kyi /
analyzed: gal te dngos po de 'jig pa'i rang bzhin zhig yin na ni 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la rtag pa dang gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pas dang po nas 'jig par 'gyur gyi bar du gnas par mi srid de / dper na nam mkha' med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas dang po med pa bzhin du phyis kyang med pa kho nar gnas kyi /
translated: If it is the intrinsic reality of cessation, then since the intrinsic reality of cessation is not the intrinsic reality of enduring, it would cease from the beginning. It is impossible for it to endure in the interim.

original: dang po ni med pa la /
analyzed: dang po ni med pa la /
translated: For example, since the intrinsic reality of space is nonexistence, it is nonexistent from the beginning and it remains nonexistent later.

original: phyis yod pa lta bur mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phyis yod pa lta bur mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is not as if it were nonexistent in the beginning🔽and existent later.

original: gzhan yang dngos po de skyes nas tha gi zad cig gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po de skyes nas tha gi zad cig gnas te /
translated: Moreover, if that thing endures after it has arisen,

original: phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba rgyu gang gis 'gag par 'gyur ba'i 'gag pa'i rgyu bstan dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba rgyu gang gis 'gag par 'gyur ba'i 'gag pa'i rgyu bstan dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Later, it would cease. It is necessary to demonstrate the cause of cessation by which it ceases.

original: skyes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the very cause of arising is the cause of cessation,

original: de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: then that is also not tenable.

original: gal te gzhan dag na re dngos po de phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba ni dang po skyed skyed pa'i rgyud de nyid kyis phyis 'gag go zhe na yang de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag na re dngos po de phyis 'gag par 'gyur ba ni dang po skyed skyed pa'i rgyud de nyid kyis phyis 'gag go zhe na yang de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: If others say that later the cessation of that thing is due to the very cause that previously gave rise to it, then that is not tenable.

original: ji ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate why that is not tenable,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: skye ba dang 'gag par 'gal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dang po skye ba'i rgyu des /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag par 'gal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba smos te / dang po skye ba'i rgyu des /
translated: He says, because arising and ceasing are contradictory.🔽How is it not tenable that the very cause that gives rise to it

original: mjug tu 'gag pa'i rgyu yang byas par ji ltar mi rigs she na /🔽ji ltar skye ba ni dngos po yod pa yin la /
analyzed: mjug tu 'gag pa'i rgyu yang byas par ji ltar mi rigs she na / ji ltar skye ba ni dngos po yod pa yin la /
translated: initially also acts as the cause of its cessation later?🔽Because arising is an existent thing and ceasing is a nonexistent thing.

original: 'gag pa ni dngos po med pa yin pas gang na skye ba yod pa de na 'gag pa med pa la /
analyzed: 'gag pa ni dngos po med pa yin pas gang na skye ba yod pa de na 'gag pa med pa la /
translated: Where there is arising, there is no cessation.

original: gang na 'gag pa yod pa de na skye ba med de /
analyzed: gang na 'gag pa yod pa de na skye ba med de /
translated: Where there is cessation, there is no arising.

original: de bas na skyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'gag pa'i rgyu byed par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na skyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'gag pa'i rgyu byed par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the cause of arising is also the cause of cessation.

original: smras pa / skye ba 'gag pa gnyis 'gal du zin kyang /
analyzed: smras pa / skye ba 'gag pa gnyis 'gal du zin kyang /
translated: Objection: Although arising and cessation are contradictory,

original: skye ba'i rgyus 'gog pa byas kyang 'gal ba med do snyam pa la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyus 'gog pa byas kyang 'gal ba med do snyam pa la /
translated: it is not contradictory that the cause of arising is also the cause of cessation.

original: mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is illogical, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: 'gal ba gnyis rgyu 'dra ba las mi dmigs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis rgyu 'dra ba las mi dmigs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Two contradictory things do not arise from a single cause.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis @137a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis @137a * //
translated: Arising and cessation

original: ni 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: ni 'gal ba yin la /
translated: are contradictory.

original: 'gal ba'i chos gnyis rgyu gcig las skye bar ni mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gnyis rgyu gcig las skye bar ni mi mthong ste /
translated: Two contradictory things are not seen arising from a single cause.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyus ni dngos po yod cing skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyus ni dngos po yod cing skyed par byed kyi /
translated: A cause that is a producer produces an existent thing.

original: dngos po med cing 'gag par mi byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med cing 'gag par mi byed do //
translated: It does not produce a nonexistent thing and cause it to cease.

original: gal te skyed pa'i rgyu des 'gag par byed na ni de skyed pa'i rgyur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te skyed pa'i rgyu des 'gag par byed na ni de skyed pa'i rgyur mi rung ngo //
translated: If the cause of arising were also the cause of cessation, it would not be tenable that it is the cause of arising.

original: 'gag pa'i rgyus kyang dngos po med cing 'gag par byed kyi dngos po yod cing skye bar mi byed de /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i rgyus kyang dngos po med cing 'gag par byed kyi dngos po yod cing skye bar mi byed de /
translated: Also, a cause of cessation does not cause a thing to not exist and to cease, nor does it cause an existent thing to not arise.

original: gal te 'gag pa'i rgyus dngos po skyed par byed na ni de 'gag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gag pa'i rgyus dngos po skyed par byed na ni de 'gag pa ma yin te /
translated: If a cause of cessation causes a thing to arise, then it does not cease.

original: de bas na skyed pa'i rgyu des 'gog par byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na skyed pa'i rgyu des 'gog par byed par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable that a cause of arising would cause cessation.

original: 'gal ba'i chos gnyis rgyu gcig la mi skye ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gnyis rgyu gcig la mi skye ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that two contradictory phenomena do not arise from a single cause, he says,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: nyi ma dang / grang ba dang / dro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / grang ba dang / dro ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: like the sun and cold.

original: de la grib ma ni gang la nyi ma'i 'od med cing mi gsal ba'i phyogs te /
analyzed: de la grib ma ni gang la nyi ma'i 'od med cing mi gsal ba'i phyogs te /
translated: In this regard, shade is the side that is not illuminated by the light of the sun.

original: de'i rgyu ni thog g-yogs pa la sogs pa'i skyabs yod pa'o //🔽nyi ma ni gang du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis bab cing /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni thog g-yogs pa la sogs pa'i skyabs yod pa'o // nyi ma ni gang du nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis bab cing /
translated: Its cause is a shelter such as a roof.

original: gsal ba'i phyogs te /
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyogs te /
translated: The sun is the side that is illuminated by the light of the sun.

original: de'i rgyu ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Its cause is the orb of the sun.

original: 'di ltar grib ma'i rgyu skyabs can gyis kyang nyi ma'i 'od zer yang 'byin par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar grib ma'i rgyu skyabs can gyis kyang nyi ma'i 'od zer yang 'byin par byed /
translated: In the same way, the sun’s rays, which are the cause of shade, also emit the light of the sun.

original: grib ma lta bu mi gsal ba yang 'byin par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis byed par ni ma mthong ngo ;
analyzed: grib ma lta bu mi gsal ba yang 'byin par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis byed par ni ma mthong ngo ;
translated: But we do not see a cause that emits both the light of the sun and shade, which is the absence of light.

original: / de bzhin du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis kyang nyi ma'i 'od zer snang ba'i rang bzhin yang 'byin par byed grib ma dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin yang 'byin par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis byed pa ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: / de bzhin du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis kyang nyi ma'i 'od zer snang ba'i rang bzhin yang 'byin par byed grib ma dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin yang 'byin par byed pa'i rgyu gnyis byed pa ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the orb of the sun emits both the light of the sun, which is of the nature of light, and shade, which is of the nature of the absence of light. But we do not see a cause that emits both.

original: 'di ltar yang grang ba dang dro ba gnyis kyang phan tshun 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang grang ba dang dro ba gnyis kyang phan tshun 'gal ba ste /
translated: In the same way, cold and heat are mutually exclusive.

original: gang na grang ba yod pa de na dro ba med la /
analyzed: gang na grang ba yod pa de na dro ba med la /
translated: Where there is cold, there is no heat.

original: gang na dro ba yod pa de na grang ba med de /
analyzed: gang na dro ba yod pa de na grang ba med de /
translated: Where there is heat, there is no cold.

original: de la grang ba ni so thams cad pa dang spu ldang ba la sogs pa dro ba ni rdul zag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la grang ba ni so thams cad pa dang spu ldang ba la sogs pa dro ba ni rdul zag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Cold is the sensation of shivering and the standing on end of the body hairs, etc. Heat is the sensation of perspiration and the melting of snow, etc.

original: de la grang ba'i rgyu ni ba mo dang kha ba la sogs pa ste /🔽ba mo dang kha ba la sogs pa grang ba yang skyed par byed /
analyzed: de la grang ba'i rgyu ni ba mo dang kha ba la sogs pa ste / ba mo dang kha ba la sogs pa grang ba yang skyed par byed /
translated: The cause of cold is snow, frost, etc.

original: dro ba yang skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dro ba yang skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: Snow, frost, etc. are seen to generate cold and also to generate heat.

original: dro ba'i rgyu ni me dang nyi ma'i 'od la sogs pa ste /🔽des ni grang ba yang skyed par byed /
analyzed: dro ba'i rgyu ni me dang nyi ma'i 'od la sogs pa ste / des ni grang ba yang skyed par byed /
translated: The cause of heat is fire, sunlight, etc.

original: dro ba yang skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dro ba yang skyed par byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: They are seen to generate cold and also to generate heat.

original: tshig de dag gis rgyu las byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis rgyu las byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
translated: By these words, the meaning of the words “arisen from a cause” is taught.

original: yang na dus gzhan 'gags so zhes bya bar @137b yang 'gal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na dus gzhan 'gags so zhes bya bar @137b yang 'gal ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, because of the contradiction of the statement “it ceases at another time,”

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang phyi dang ngang gi 'du byed rnams skyes ma thag tu mi 'gag gi / dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang phyi dang ngang gi 'du byed rnams skyes ma thag tu mi 'gag gi / dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas /
translated: in another way, also external and internal formations do not cease immediately after arising, but having endured for a while,

original: phyis 'gog go zhes bya ba nga yang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis 'gog go zhes bya ba nga yang 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they cease later. This is what is meant by the statement “it ceases at another time” is contradictory.

original: ci dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what is contradictory, he says:

original: ci dang 'gal zhe na ;
analyzed: ci dang 'gal zhe na ;
translated: What is contradictory?

original: lung dang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lung dang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is: “The scriptures and reasonings.”

original: 'gal zhes smras pa de 'gal ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'gal zhes smras pa de 'gal ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The contradiction is of two kinds:

original: lung dang 'gal ba dang / rigs pa dang 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba dang / rigs pa dang 'gal ba'o //
translated: contradiction with scripture and contradiction with reason.

original: de la gal te dngos po rnams skyes nas tha gi zad cig gnas te 'gag go zhes smras na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po rnams skyes nas tha gi zad cig gnas te 'gag go zhes smras na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says that things, having arisen, endure for a while and then cease, one contradicts the scriptures of the Bhagavat.

original: bka' lung dang ji ltar 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bka' lung dang ji ltar 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how one contradicts the scriptures, he says:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “The Bhagavat said . . . ”

original: 'du byed dag ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Conditioned things are like illusions.”

original: ji ltar sgyu ma rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las skye ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las skye ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as an illusion arises through the power of causes and conditions,

original: phyi nang gi 'du byed kyang rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las skyes pas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi 'du byed kyang rgyu rkyen gyi mthu las skyes pas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: so too external and internal conditioned things arise through the power of causes and conditions. Therefore, they are like illusions.

original: skye zhing 'gag pa'i chos can yin pas na 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye zhing 'gag pa'i chos can yin pas na 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they have the property of arising and ceasing, they are called “destructible.”

original: skyes nas skad cig ma gcig las ring du mi gnas pas na /
analyzed: skyes nas skad cig ma gcig las ring du mi gnas pas na /
translated: Having arisen, they do not endure for more than an instant.

original: re zhig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “for a while.”

original: skad cig ma re re skyes ma thag tu 'jig pas na /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re skyes ma thag tu 'jig pas na /
translated: Because they are destroyed immediately upon being born,

original: yun thung du gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yun thung du gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: they are called “lasting for a short time.”

original: dngos po rnams dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas na ni de skad du 'byung ba'i lung dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas na ni de skad du 'byung ba'i lung dang 'gal lo //
translated: If things lasted for a period of time, this would contradict the scriptures that say this.

original: yang lung dang 'gal zhing rigs pa dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rnal 'byor pa yid la byed pas kyang /
analyzed: yang lung dang 'gal zhing rigs pa dang 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir / rnal 'byor pa yid la byed pas kyang /
translated: In order to show that this contradicts both scripture and reasoning,

original: 'du byed de dag skye ba dang / 'jig par yid la byed pa na skad cig ma re re la 'gag par mthong ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag skye ba dang / 'jig par yid la byed pa na skad cig ma re re la 'gag par mthong ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, “The yogis and yoginīs who attend to the arising and passing away of those formations see them cease in every moment.”

original: rnal 'byor pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom zhing byed la byed pas kyang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi sgom zhing byed la byed pas kyang /
translated: The yogis and yoginīs who meditate on and attend to the four noble truths

original: phyi nang gi 'du byed rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du yid la byed pas na /
analyzed: phyi nang gi 'du byed rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du yid la byed pas na /
translated: attend to the arising and passing away of internal and external formations.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig cing 'gag par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig cing 'gag par mthong ste /
translated: They see formations cease and be destroyed in every moment.

original: de ltar mthong bas na 'du byed rnams las skyo ba skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong bas na 'du byed rnams las skyo ba skye'o //
translated: Since one sees this, one becomes disenchanted with compounded phenomena.

original: skyo ba skyes nas 'dod chags dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyo ba skyes nas 'dod chags dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become disenchanted, one becomes free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral nas /
translated: Having become free from attachment,

original: grol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one is liberated and attains nirvana.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de dag la yang skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / grol ba rnams @138a * //🔽med par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de dag la yang skyo ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / grol ba rnams @138a * // med par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Otherwise, they would not have disenchantment, freedom from attachment, and liberation.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams skad cig ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams skad cig ma ma yin te /
translated: If compounded phenomena were not momentary,

original: rtag par gnas par gyur na ni rnal 'byor pa yid la byed pa rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: rtag par gnas par gyur na ni rnal 'byor pa yid la byed pa rnams kyis kyang /
translated: but remained permanently, then even the contemplations of the yogis

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re 'gag pa yin par mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re 'gag pa yin par mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would not see that compounded phenomena cease moment by moment.

original: de ltar ma mthong na skyo bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽skyo bar ma gyur na ni 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma mthong na skyo bar mi 'gyur ro // skyo bar ma gyur na ni 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one did not see this, one would not become disenchanted.🔽If one did not become disenchanted, one would not become free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags pa dang ma bral na grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags pa dang ma bral na grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one did not become free from attachment, one would not be liberated.

original: de ltar na ni ma yin gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis skad cig mar 'gag par mthong bas na phyir grol ba'i bar du 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de ltar na ni ma yin gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis skad cig mar 'gag par mthong bas na phyir grol ba'i bar du 'gyur te ;
translated: That is not so, because yogis see them as momentary and ceasing, and therefore they are liberated.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'o //
translated: Therefore, conditioned states are momentary.

original: 'gal ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach an example of contradiction, he says:

original: dper na gzhan dag 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa na 'gag par mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dper na gzhan dag 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa na 'gag par mthong ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For example, it is like seeing the cessation of other sentient beings at the time of death and so on.

original: dper na sems can gzhan dag 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig par mi mthong gi / nam srog gi dbang po chad de shi bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na sems can gzhan dag 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig par mi mthong gi / nam srog gi dbang po chad de shi bar gyur pa na /
translated: For example, other sentient beings do not see conditioned states disintegrating moment by moment, but when the faculty of life force is severed and they die,

original: 'gag cing mi rtag par mthong ba de dag nam ma shi'i bar du ni skyo ba mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'gag cing mi rtag par mthong ba de dag nam ma shi'i bar du ni skyo ba mi skye'o //
translated: they see them as ceasing and impermanent. Until they die, they do not feel revulsion.

original: na ma de 'gag par gyur bar mthong ba la /
analyzed: na ma de 'gag par gyur bar mthong ba la /
translated: When they see that it has ceased,

original: gdod skyo ba skye ba bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang 'du byed rnams rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i tshe na 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig par mthong bas na skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdod skyo ba skye ba bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kyang 'du byed rnams rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i tshe na 'du byed rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig par mthong bas na skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Yogis and yoginis also become disenchanted with compounded phenomena when they see that compounded phenomena are destroyed in each instant while they are cultivating yoga.🔽If yogis and yoginis became disenchanted with compounded phenomena only when they saw the cessation of compounded phenomena at the time of death, as ordinary beings do, then,

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa rnams sems can phal pa bzhin du 'chi khar 'gag pa mthong nas gdod skyo bar gyur na ni ji ltar sems can phal ba 'chi khar skyo bar gyur pas de dag la rnam par grol ba med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa rnams sems can phal pa bzhin du 'chi khar 'gag pa mthong nas gdod skyo bar gyur na ni ji ltar sems can phal ba 'chi khar skyo bar gyur pas de dag la rnam par grol ba med pa bzhin du /
translated: just as ordinary beings are not liberated when they become disenchanted with compounded phenomena at the time of death,

original: rnal 'byor la yang rnam par grol ba med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor la yang rnam par grol ba med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: yogis and yoginis would not be liberated.

original: 'dis ni 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
translated: This explains the meaning of the words “because of contradiction.”

original: gal te 'du byed skyes nas bdag nyid gnas par nus pas dus gzhan du'ang bdag nyid gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed skyes nas bdag nyid gnas par nus pas dus gzhan du'ang bdag nyid gnas pa'am /
translated: If compounded phenomena were able to remain on their own after they have arisen, they would remain on their own at another time.

original: rgyu 'ga' zhig gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu 'ga' zhig gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, they would remain on their own due to some cause.

original: gzhan yang 'di brtag dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di brtag dgos te /
translated: Moreover, this must be investigated:

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig tu 'jig pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig tu 'jig pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Formations do not disintegrate moment by moment.

original: skyes nas lo'am /
analyzed: skyes nas lo'am /
translated: They arise and then endure for a year,

original: bla ba la sogs par dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas 'gag ce na /
analyzed: bla ba la sogs par dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas 'gag ce na /
translated: or for a month, or a day, or an instant, and then they cease.

original: dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas pa de la phyogs @138b rnams la gnyis su brtag go //
analyzed: dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas pa de la phyogs @138b rnams la gnyis su brtag go //
translated: In regard to their enduring for a period of time, the directions are to be analyzed in two ways.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'du byed rnams dus tha gi zad cig mi 'jig par gnas pa de /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dus tha gi zad cig mi 'jig par gnas pa de /
translated: Formations that endure for a period of time without disintegrating

original: 'du byed de bdag nyid gnas pa'i rang bzhin can zhig ste /
analyzed: 'du byed de bdag nyid gnas pa'i rang bzhin can zhig ste /
translated: are formations that have the nature of enduring by themselves.

original: gnas pa'i mthu yod pas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mthu yod pas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas pa'am /
translated: Because they have the power to endure, they endure for a period of time.

original: yang na bdag nyid gnas pa'i mthu ni med kyi gnas par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis grogs byas nas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas te /
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid gnas pa'i mthu ni med kyi gnas par byed pa'i rgyu dang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis grogs byas nas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas te /
translated: Or, they do not have the power to endure by themselves, but they endure for a period of time with the assistance of causes and conditions that make them endure.

original: de gnyis gang ltar yang gnas par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de gnyis gang ltar yang gnas par yang mi rigs so //
translated: In either case, it is illogical that they endure.

original: de la dang po'i phyogs la mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽yang / bdag nyid gnas pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i phyogs la mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir / yang / bdag nyid gnas pa mi rung ste /
translated: To demonstrate the illogicality of the first of those two positions,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: it is said:🔽It is illogical for them to endure by themselves.

original: bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu yod pas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas so zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu yod pas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas so zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not proper to say that it endures for a long time because it has the power to endure by itself.

original: de ltar yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is not proper.

original: ji ltar mi rung snyams la /🔽de'i phyir / bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung snyams la / de'i phyir / bdag nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir te //
translated: How is it not proper?🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it does not endure by itself.🔽How is it that internal and external compounded phenomena do not endure by themselves? Because they have the nature of disintegration.

original: ji ltar phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams bdag nyid mi gnas shing 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu yod pas gnas so zhes bya bar yang mi rung ngo //
