analyzed: ji ltar phyi nang gi 'dus byas rnams bdag nyid mi gnas shing 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu yod pas gnas so zhes bya bar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to say that they endure because they have the power to endure by themselves.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin snyams pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin snyams pa la /
translated: Why do they have the nature of disintegration?🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir / mthar phyin gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mthar phyin gnas par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Because they cannot endure until the end.

original: ji ltar 'dus byas rnams mthar phyin cing med par gyur pas na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas rnams mthar phyin cing med par gyur pas na /
translated: Because compounded phenomena finally cease and are destroyed,

original: bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu med do //
translated: they do not have the power to endure by themselves.

original: gal te bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu yod pa zhig na rtag tu yang gnas pa'i mthu can du 'dug la /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid la gnas pa'i mthu yod pa zhig na rtag tu yang gnas pa'i mthu can du 'dug la /
translated: If it had the power to remain in itself, it would always have the power to remain.

original: mjug tu yang gnas par gal 'gyur te /
analyzed: mjug tu yang gnas par gal 'gyur te /
translated: How could it not remain in the end?

original: dper na nam mkha' rtag pa'i rang bzhin la skye 'jig med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rtag pa'i rang bzhin la skye 'jig med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like space, which has the nature of permanence, it would be without origination and destruction.

original: 'dus byas rnams la ni mthar gnas par mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams la ni mthar gnas par mi rung ste /
translated: But it is not tenable that conditioned phenomena remain in the end.

original: 'jig par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Because they are destroyed.

original: bdag nyid gnas pa'i mthu yang med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas pa'i mthu yang med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that they do not have the power to remain in themselves.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ni mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ni mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the second position is illogical, he says,

original: gnas pa'i rgyur yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyur yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is also illogical that it is the cause of remaining.

original: 'di ltar gnas par byed pa'i rgyu rkyen gyis grogs byas nas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas so zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas par byed pa'i rgyu rkyen gyis grogs byas nas dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas so zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, it is illogical to say that it is the cause of remaining, that is, that it assists through the conditions that cause remaining and it remains for a certain period of time.

original: de ltar yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is also illogical.

original: ji ltar mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate how it is illogical, he says,

original: de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: de lta bu ni gang yang @139a * //
analyzed: de lta bu ni gang yang @139a * //
translated: What is it like?

original: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “It is not observed” is stated.

original: dngos po rnams la bar du gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yang med de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la bar du gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yang med de /
translated: There is no cause that abides in between things.

original: dngos po rnams la gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yod par ma mthong bas gnas par byed pa'i rgyus gnas par byas so zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la gnas par byed pa'i rgyu yod par ma mthong bas gnas par byed pa'i rgyus gnas par byas so zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Since a cause of abiding is not seen in things, it is not tenable to say, “It abides because a cause of abiding makes it abide.”

original: tshig de dag gis ni bdag nyid mi gnas phyir zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni bdag nyid mi gnas phyir zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: Those words indicate the meaning of “because it does not abide by itself.”

original: de ste gang gnas pa'i rgyu med kyang /
analyzed: de ste gang gnas pa'i rgyu med kyang /
translated: If, although there is no cause of abiding,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pas gnas te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu med pas gnas te /
translated: it abides because there is no cause of disintegration,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas phyis 'jig par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas phyis 'jig par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: and later it disintegrates after encountering a cause of disintegration,

original: gal te 'di skad du dngos po nyid kyang gnas pa'i mthu med par gnas par ma nus na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du dngos po nyid kyang gnas pa'i mthu med par gnas par ma nus na /
translated: then if a thing itself is unable to abide without the power of abiding,🔽and although it is not the case that it abides after being sustained by another cause of abiding,🔽and although things do not abide,

original: gnas pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis kyang bstangs shing dngos po rnams gnas par byas pa med du zin kyang dngos po gnas pa'i bar na de 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis kyang bstangs shing dngos po rnams gnas par byas pa med du zin kyang dngos po gnas pa'i bar na de 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu med de /
translated: in the interval of the abiding of things, there is no cause of disintegration.

original: nam 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu rkyen dang ma phrad kyi bar du 'jig par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nam 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu rkyen dang ma phrad kyi bar du 'jig par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Until it encounters the cause and conditions of destruction, it does not disintegrate.

original: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu rkyen dang phrad nas gdod 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu rkyen dang phrad nas gdod 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: But when it encounters the cause and conditions of destruction, it disintegrates.

original: sngar ni mi 'jig par gnas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sngar ni mi 'jig par gnas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Previously, it endures without disintegrating.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example of that, it is said:

original: mes sngon po bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mes sngon po bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like the blueness of fire.

original: dper na lcags kyi kha dog sngon po 'jig par byad pa'i rgyu med pa dang ma phrad pa'i sngon rol na ni kha dog sngon por snang la /
analyzed: dper na lcags kyi kha dog sngon po 'jig par byad pa'i rgyu med pa dang ma phrad pa'i sngon rol na ni kha dog sngon por snang la /
translated: For example, prior to encountering the cause of the destruction of the blueness of iron, the blueness appears.

original: phyis de 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu med dang phrad nas mes sngon po bshig ste /
analyzed: phyis de 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu med dang phrad nas mes sngon po bshig ste /
translated: Later, when it encounters the cause of its destruction, fire destroys the blueness and a red color arises.

original: kha dog dmar por 'gyur ba dang / dper na bum pa 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu tho ba la sogs pa dang ma phrad pa'i dus na ni bum pa mi 'jig la /
analyzed: kha dog dmar por 'gyur ba dang / dper na bum pa 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu tho ba la sogs pa dang ma phrad pa'i dus na ni bum pa mi 'jig la /
translated: For example, a pot does not disintegrate at the time when it does not encounter the cause of its destruction, such as a hammer.

original: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu tho ba la sogs pa dang phrad nas /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu tho ba la sogs pa dang phrad nas /
translated: But when it encounters the cause of its destruction, such as a hammer,

original: gdod 'jig par 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gdod 'jig par 'gyur ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is just like the destruction of something that is already destroyed.

original: de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is also illogical, he says:

original: yang de med pa'i phyir de ltar mi rungs te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang de med pa'i phyir de ltar mi rungs te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is illogical that it is like that because it does not exist.

original: ji ltar dngos po rnams la skyed pa'i rgyu ni yod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po rnams la skyed pa'i rgyu ni yod kyi /
translated: Just as there is a cause for the arising of things,

original: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ni med de /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ni med de /
translated: there is no cause for their destruction.

original: dper na rdo gnam du bor ba la gnam du 'dor ba'i rgyu lag pa la sogs pa ni yod kyi /
analyzed: dper na rdo gnam du bor ba la gnam du 'dor ba'i rgyu lag pa la sogs pa ni yod kyi /
translated: For example, when a stone is thrown into the sky, there is a cause for its being thrown into the sky, such as the hand,

original: sa la lhung bar byed pa'i rgyu med de rang ltung ba bzhin no //🔽de dang 'dra bar dngos po rnams la rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa la lhung bar byed pa'i rgyu med de rang ltung ba bzhin no // de dang 'dra bar dngos po rnams la rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: but there is no cause for it falling to the ground, because it falls by itself.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar du gnas so zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar du gnas so zhes bya bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Similarly, it is illogical to say that things endure until they come into contact with a cause of destruction because they have no cause.

original: @139b ji ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @139b ji ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate how this is illogical, he says:

original: smras pa / 'jig pa'i rgyu ni phyis kyang gang yang med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig pa'i rgyu ni phyis kyang gang yang med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: There is no cause of destruction whatsoever even later.

original: ji ltar mes lcags kyi sngon po bshig go zhes smras pa yang ji ltar me dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol na lcags kyi sngon po 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gang yang med de /
analyzed: ji ltar mes lcags kyi sngon po bshig go zhes smras pa yang ji ltar me dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol na lcags kyi sngon po 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gang yang med de /
translated: Just as it is said that fire destroys the blueness of iron, so too, prior to contact with fire, there is no cause for the destruction of the blueness of iron.

original: sngon por rang gis 'jig pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sngon por rang gis 'jig pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as blueness is destroyed by itself,

original: me dang phrad pa'i dus na yang mes sngon po bshig ste /
analyzed: me dang phrad pa'i dus na yang mes sngon po bshig ste /
translated: so too, at the time of contact with fire, fire does not destroy blueness.

original: sngon po 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu mes ma byas kyi sngon po ni rang gi ngang gis zhig go //
analyzed: sngon po 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu mes ma byas kyi sngon po ni rang gi ngang gis zhig go //
translated: Fire does not act as the cause for the destruction of blueness, but blueness is destroyed by its own nature.

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du /
translated: If others say,

original: gal te rang gi ngang gis zhig ste /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngang gis zhig ste /
translated: “If blueness is destroyed by itself

original: mes bshig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mes bshig pa ma yin na /
translated: and is not destroyed by fire,

original: me dang ma phrad pa'i sngon rol nas sngon po mi snang bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: me dang ma phrad pa'i sngon rol nas sngon po mi snang bar ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why does blueness not disappear prior to contact with fire?”

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The response to that is,

original: mes kyang sngon po 'jig par 'gyur ba ni ma grub kyi /
analyzed: mes kyang sngon po 'jig par 'gyur ba ni ma grub kyi /
translated: “It is not established that fire destroys blueness,

original: mi 'dra bar skyes bar nus par 'grub po zhes smos te /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar skyes bar nus par 'grub po zhes smos te /
translated: but it is established that it is able to produce a different color.”

original: mes lcags kyi sngon po 'jig par byas pa ni ma grub kyi sngon po ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig la /
analyzed: mes lcags kyi sngon po 'jig par byas pa ni ma grub kyi sngon po ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig la /
translated: The blue color of iron is not destroyed by fire, but the blue color is destroyed by nature.

original: mes ni gzhan ba skyed de /
analyzed: mes ni gzhan ba skyed de /
translated: Fire generates another color.

original: gang bskyed ce na /
analyzed: gang bskyed ce na /
translated: What is generated?

original: lcags kyi kha dog dmar por bskyed do //
analyzed: lcags kyi kha dog dmar por bskyed do //
translated: The red color of iron is generated.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point,

original: 'di ltar de dang phrad pa'i phyir sngon po'i rgyu mi 'dra bar snang ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang phrad pa'i phyir sngon po'i rgyu mi 'dra bar snang ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “because it is contacted by that, the cause of blue appears different.”

original: 'di ltar mes ni sngon po bshig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes ni sngon po bshig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: In that case, fire does not destroy blue.

original: sngon po ni rang zhig la /
analyzed: sngon po ni rang zhig la /
translated: Blue is destroyed by itself.

original: me dang phrad pas ni kha dog dmar por bskyed do //
analyzed: me dang phrad pas ni kha dog dmar por bskyed do //
translated: Because it is contacted by fire, the color red is generated.

original: rnam par thams cad du mi 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par thams cad du mi 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not that it is not destroyed in every respect.

original: gal te mes sngon po thams cad nas thams cad du bshig ste med par byas na ni phyis grangs pa'i dus na yang sngon por 'gyur bar mi rigs na /
analyzed: gal te mes sngon po thams cad nas thams cad du bshig ste med par byas na ni phyis grangs pa'i dus na yang sngon por 'gyur bar mi rigs na /
translated: If fire completely destroyed blue and made it nonexistent, then later, at the time of counting, it would not be reasonable for blue to appear.

original: phyis grangs pa'i tshe sngon por snang bas na /
analyzed: phyis grangs pa'i tshe sngon por snang bas na /
translated: But later, at the time of counting, blue appears.

original: mes sngon po bshig ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mes sngon po bshig ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that fire destroys blue.

original: me'i snga rol gyi sngon po ni rang zhig la /
analyzed: me'i snga rol gyi sngon po ni rang zhig la /
translated: Blue that existed prior to fire is destroyed by itself.

original: mes ni dmar po bskyed par grub po //
analyzed: mes ni dmar po bskyed par grub po //
translated: It is established that fire produces red.

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du chu yang me dang phrad nas bskol ba dang / gdod phyis med par snang gi / me dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol nas med par mi snang ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du chu yang me dang phrad nas bskol ba dang / gdod phyis med par snang gi / me dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol nas med par mi snang ste /
translated: If others say, “When water encounters fire and is heated, it later appears to be gone, but it does not appear to be gone prior to encountering fire.

original: de ltar me dang phrad nas mi snang bar gyur pas na /
analyzed: de ltar me dang phrad nas mi snang bar gyur pas na /
translated: Since it appears to be gone after encountering fire,

original: chu 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu me yin pa bzhin du dngos po rnams la yang 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu yod de /🔽dper na bum pa lta bu dbyig @140a * //
analyzed: chu 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu me yin pa bzhin du dngos po rnams la yang 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu yod de / dper na bum pa lta bu dbyig @140a * //
translated: fire is the cause of the destruction of water. In the same way, there is a cause of the destruction of things.

original: pa la sogs pa dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol na ni chag par mi snang la dbyig pa la sogs pa dang phrad nas gdod chag par snang bas na /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa dang ma phrad pa'i snga rol na ni chag par mi snang la dbyig pa la sogs pa dang phrad nas gdod chag par snang bas na /
translated: For example, a vase does not appear to be broken prior to encountering a hammer, but it appears to be broken after encountering a hammer.

original: dngos po rnams la 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu yod do zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu yod do zhes zer ba la /
translated: Since it appears to be broken after encountering a hammer, there is a cause of the destruction of things.”

original: me dang dbyig pa la sogs pa la chu dang bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: me dang dbyig pa la sogs pa la chu dang bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that fire and so on are not the cause of the disintegration of water and so on,🔽it is said:

original: chu yang bskol nas me dang phrad pa dang / je nyung je nyung du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu yang bskol nas me dang phrad pa dang / je nyung je nyung du 'gyur te /
translated: Even water, when boiled by fire, becomes less and less.

original: shin tu nyung ba las mthar mi skye bar snang gi lan cig me dang phrad pas de med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shin tu nyung ba las mthar mi skye bar snang gi lan cig me dang phrad pas de med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When it is extremely small, it finally appears to be nonexistent, but it is not that it becomes nonexistent by merely coming into contact with fire.

original: 'di ltar chu yang me dang phrad nas bskol ba dang je snyung je nyung du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chu yang me dang phrad nas bskol ba dang je snyung je nyung du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, even water, when boiled by fire, becomes less and less.

original: khad kyis shin tu nyung ba las tha mar med par snang gi me dang phrad ma thag tu ni chu ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: khad kyis shin tu nyung ba las tha mar med par snang gi me dang phrad ma thag tu ni chu ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na /
translated: When it is extremely small, it finally appears to be nonexistent, but it does not become nonexistent by merely coming into contact with fire.

original: mes chu med pa'i rgyu ma byas kyi /
analyzed: mes chu med pa'i rgyu ma byas kyi /
translated: Therefore, fire does not act as the cause of the nonexistence of water.

original: chu ni rang gi ngang gis skad cig ma gcig gi rgyun gyis rang zhig go //
analyzed: chu ni rang gi ngang gis skad cig ma gcig gi rgyun gyis rang zhig go //
translated: Water itself naturally disintegrates by the continuum of momentary existence.

original: mes ni de na je nyung je nyung du gyur pa bskyed par zad kyi me ni chu 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu mi byed do //
analyzed: mes ni de na je nyung je nyung du gyur pa bskyed par zad kyi me ni chu 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu mi byed do //
translated: Fire merely produces the gradual decrease of water, but fire does not act as the cause of the destruction of water.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gal te mes chu skyed pa'i rgyu byas kyi chu 'jig pa'i rgyu ma byas na /
analyzed: gal te mes chu skyed pa'i rgyu byas kyi chu 'jig pa'i rgyu ma byas na /
translated: If fire acts as the cause of the generation of water but does not act as the cause of the destruction of water,

original: mes chu bskyed pas na mjug tu chu snang ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: mes chu bskyed pas na mjug tu chu snang ba'i rigs na /
translated: then since fire generates water, it is logical that water would appear in the end.

original: ci'i phyir mi snang bar 'gyur zhes rgol na yang /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi snang bar 'gyur zhes rgol na yang /
translated: Why does it not appear?

original: lan du chu byis mi snang bar gyur pa ni chu zad pa'i skad cig ma snga ma ni mjug thug ste phrad /
analyzed: lan du chu byis mi snang bar gyur pa ni chu zad pa'i skad cig ma snga ma ni mjug thug ste phrad /
translated: The response is that the disappearance of water is due to the prior moment of the exhaustion of water coming into contact with the final moment of water.

original: chu'i skad cig ma phyi ma skyed par byed pa'i grogs rgyu rkyen gzhan med de /
analyzed: chu'i skad cig ma phyi ma skyed par byed pa'i grogs rgyu rkyen gzhan med de /
translated: There are no other causes and conditions that assist in the generation of the subsequent moment of water.

original: rgyu rkyen dang mi ldan pas na chu ma bskyed de /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen dang mi ldan pas na chu ma bskyed de /
translated: Since it is devoid of causes and conditions, water is not generated.

original: de bas na chu phyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de bas na chu phyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore water does not appear later.

original: / gal te mes chu med par byed pa yin na ni me dang phrad ma thag tu chu med pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: / gal te mes chu med par byed pa yin na ni me dang phrad ma thag tu chu med pa'i rigs na /
translated: If fire acts to make water disappear, then it is logical that water would disappear immediately upon coming into contact with fire.

original: med pa phrad ma thag tu chu med par ma gyur pas na mes chu 'jig pa'i rgyu ma byas so //
analyzed: med pa phrad ma thag tu chu med par ma gyur pas na mes chu 'jig pa'i rgyu ma byas so //
translated: Since the water does not become nonexistent immediately upon contact with the fire, fire does not act as the cause of the destruction of water.

original: gzhan yang 'di dpyad bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di dpyad bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be analyzed:

original: mes chu 'jig pa'i rgyu byas na chu de mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can las mes 'jig par byas sam /
analyzed: mes chu 'jig pa'i rgyu byas na chu de mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can las mes 'jig par byas sam /
translated: If fire acts as the cause of the destruction of water, does fire cause the destruction of water that is not intrinsically subject to destruction?

original: chu de 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can las mes 'jig par byas /
analyzed: chu de 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can las mes 'jig par byas /
translated: Or does fire cause the destruction of water that is intrinsically subject to destruction?

original: gal te chu de mes mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can yin na ni mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can la /
analyzed: gal te chu de mes mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can yin na ni mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can la /
translated: If water is not intrinsically subject to destruction by fire, then it is not suitable to be destroyed

original: 'jig par byar mi rung bas rgyu gang gis kyang 'jig par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'jig par byar mi rung bas rgyu gang gis kyang 'jig par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: by fire, because it cannot be destroyed by any cause whatsoever.

original: dper @140b na nam mkha' 'jig pa med pa la rgyu rkyen gyis 'jig par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper @140b na nam mkha' 'jig pa med pa la rgyu rkyen gyis 'jig par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as space, which is not subject to destruction, cannot be destroyed by causes and conditions.

original: gal te chu de 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni chu rang 'jig pas de la 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis mi 'jig go //
analyzed: gal te chu de 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni chu rang 'jig pas de la 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis mi 'jig go //
translated: If water is intrinsically subject to destruction, then since water would be destroyed by itself, it would not be destroyed by another cause of destruction.

original: gzhan yang bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu thob la sogs pas byas so zhes smras pa de yag mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa la sogs pa 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu thob la sogs pas byas so zhes smras pa de yag mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical to say that a cause such as a hammer produces the destruction of a pot and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: tho bas bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu byed na /
analyzed: tho bas bum pa 'jig pa'i rgyu byed na /
translated: If a hammer is the cause that destroys a pot,

original: tho ba des bum pa 'jig par byed pa'i dus na ni bum pa nyid byas sam /
analyzed: tho ba des bum pa 'jig par byed pa'i dus na ni bum pa nyid byas sam /
translated: at the time that hammer destroys the pot, does it produce the pot itself?

original: bum pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig byas /
analyzed: bum pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan zhig byas /
translated: Or does it produce something other than the pot?

original: gal te tho bas bum pa nyid byas na ni tho bas bum pa byas kyi /
analyzed: gal te tho bas bum pa nyid byas na ni tho bas bum pa byas kyi /
translated: If the hammer produces the pot itself, then the hammer produces the pot.

original: bum pa'i 'jig pa ma byas pa na /
analyzed: bum pa'i 'jig pa ma byas pa na /
translated: Since it does not produce the destruction of the pot,

original: tho bas bum pa gzhig pa'i rgyu byas so zhes smras pa yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: tho bas bum pa gzhig pa'i rgyu byas so zhes smras pa yang 'gal lo //
translated: it is contradictory to say that the hammer is the cause that destroys the pot.

original: gal te tho bas bum pa ma yin pa zhig byas na ni tho bas gzhan byas pas bum pa la ci yang ma byas pa'i phyir thob bas bum pa bshig par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te tho bas bum pa ma yin pa zhig byas na ni tho bas gzhan byas pas bum pa la ci yang ma byas pa'i phyir thob bas bum pa bshig par mi rung ste /
translated: If the hammer produces something that is not a pot, then since the hammer produces something else, it does not produce the pot at all. Therefore it is not tenable that the hammer destroys the pot.

original: dper na mchod sbyin la bde ba dang / mi bde ba byas pa de lha sbyin la ci yang byas pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin la bde ba dang / mi bde ba byas pa de lha sbyin la ci yang byas pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the production of pleasure and pain in Yajña does not produce anything in Devadatta at all.

original: gzhan yang the bas bum pa bshig na bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin pa las tho bas bum pa bshig gam /
analyzed: gzhan yang the bas bum pa bshig na bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin pa las tho bas bum pa bshig gam /
translated: Moreover, if a hammer destroys a pot, is the pot destroyed by a hammer that has the nature of destroying a pot?🔽Or is the pot destroyed by a hammer that does not have the nature of destroying a pot?

original: bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa las tho bas bshig / gal te bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni kho rang gzhig pas na /
analyzed: bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin pa las tho bas bshig / gal te bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can zhig yin na ni kho rang gzhig pas na /
translated: If the pot has the nature of being destroyed, then it is destroyed by itself.

original: de la tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis gzhig mi dgos so //
analyzed: de la tho ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis gzhig mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it does not need to be destroyed by another cause, such as a hammer.

original: gal te bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin na ni de 'jig tu mi btub pas na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin na ni de 'jig tu mi btub pas na /
translated: If the pot does not have the nature of being destroyed, then it cannot be destroyed.

original: rgyu gang gis kyang gzhig tu mi btub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis kyang gzhig tu mi btub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it cannot be destroyed by any cause.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du brtag na tho bas ni gyo mo bskyed kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du brtag na tho bas ni gyo mo bskyed kyi /
translated: If one analyzes in this way, a hammer produces a shard.🔽The pot is destroyed by itself.

original: bum pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin no de mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can bstan to //
analyzed: bum pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin no de mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can bstan to //
translated: It is shown that the pot does not have the nature of not being destroyed.

original: mtshan nyid gcig tu ngas pa'i phyir skyes pas gang yang gnas par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig tu ngas pa'i phyir skyes pas gang yang gnas par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since the characteristics are stated to be the same, it is not tenable that anything that has arisen endures.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med kyi /
translated: The characteristic of all conditioned phenomena is not the two characteristics called “permanent” and “impermanent.”

original: 'dus byas thams can ni mtshan nyid gcig kho nar nges so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams can ni mtshan nyid gcig kho nar nges so //
translated: All conditioned phenomena are definitely ascertained as having only one characteristic.

original: gang zhe na /🔽mi rtag pa dang / skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid @141a * //
analyzed: gang zhe na / mi rtag pa dang / skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid @141a * //
translated: What is that?

original: du nges so //
analyzed: du nges so //
translated: It is definitely ascertained as having the characteristic of impermanence and momentariness.

original: de ltar 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid du nges pas na 'dus byas rnams dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas phyis 'jig par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma'i mtshan nyid du nges pas na 'dus byas rnams dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas phyis 'jig par mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, since conditioned phenomena are definitely ascertained as having the characteristic of momentariness, it is not reasonable that conditioned phenomena endure for a while and then later disintegrate.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gcig tu nges par cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gcig tu nges par cis mngon zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “How is it known that the characteristic of conditioned phenomena is definitely ascertained as one?”

original: lung gi gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu nges pa 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung gi gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gcig tu nges pa 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to teach the logical argument of scripture,

original: 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, “This definite ascertainment of the characteristic of conditioned phenomena as one was also stated by the Bhagavān, who said, ‘Conditioned phenomena are impermanent.’”

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa kho nar nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa kho nar nges pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Lord has stated that the characteristic of conditioned states is definitely only impermanence.

original: ji skad gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs she na /
translated: How has he stated this?

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de gal te skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na ni yun cung zad cig gi bar du mi rtag la med par mi 'gyur bas mi rtag par mtshan nyid gcig tu ma nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs so // de gal te skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na ni yun cung zad cig gi bar du mi rtag la med par mi 'gyur bas mi rtag par mtshan nyid gcig tu ma nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: He has stated that all conditioned states are impermanent.🔽If they did not disintegrate immediately after arising, then for a little while they would not be impermanent and would not be nonexistent.

original: gal te dngos po skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig gi / dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas nas gdod phyis 'jig par 'gyur na ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gcig tu nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig gi / dus tha gi zad cig tu gnas nas gdod phyis 'jig par 'gyur na ni mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gcig tu nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a thing did not disintegrate immediately after arising, but remained for a little while and then later disintegrated, then the characteristic of impermanence would not be ascertained as being the same.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma zhig gi bar du dus tha gi zad cig tu rtag par gnas pas na rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma zhig gi bar du dus tha gi zad cig tu rtag par gnas pas na rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: Because until it disintegrates, it would remain for a little while and be permanent.

original: de nas 'jig par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de nas 'jig par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Then, because it would disintegrate,

original: mi rtag par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag par yang 'gyur te /
translated: it would be impermanent.

original: 'dus byas la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis su gzhag na ni mtshan nyid gcig tu nges pa med cing lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyis su gzhag na ni mtshan nyid gcig tu nges pa med cing lung dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If conditioned phenomena are posited as both permanent and impermanent, then they would not definitely have a single characteristic and that would contradict scripture.

original: tshig de dag gis ni mtshan nyid nges zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni mtshan nyid nges zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
translated: Those words explain the meaning of the words “characteristics are ascertained.”

original: de skad cig ma re re la snga ma med pa skyes zin na /
analyzed: de skad cig ma re re la snga ma med pa skyes zin na /
translated: If each moment is produced without the previous moment,

original: de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: then it would be impossible to say, “This is it.”

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du zer te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du zer te /
translated: If others say this,

original: skad cig ma re re la dngos po rnams 'gags nas snga ma dang phyi ma 'dra bar skad cig ma gzhan skye'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la dngos po rnams 'gags nas snga ma dang phyi ma 'dra bar skad cig ma gzhan skye'o zhes zer na /
translated: then they say that after each moment of things ceases, another moment that is similar to the previous and later moments is produced.

original: de lta na ni snga ma mthong ba'i dngos po dag phyis mthong ba'i dus na de dag bdag gis mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo dang sems skye bar mi rigs na /
analyzed: de lta na ni snga ma mthong ba'i dngos po dag phyis mthong ba'i dus na de dag bdag gis mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo dang sems skye bar mi rigs na /
translated: If that were the case, then it would be illogical for the mind and mental factors to arise with the thought “I see those things that were seen previously” when they are seen later.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: sngar mthong ba'i dngos po dag phyir mthong ba'i tshe de nyid bdag gis mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skyes pas ni /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i dngos po dag phyir mthong ba'i tshe de nyid bdag gis mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skyes pas ni /
translated: When one sees things that were seen before, the thought arises, “I see that very thing.”

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re la mi 'jig gi @141b dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas phyis 'jig go zhes zer ro //🔽de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir 'dra ba rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re la mi 'jig gi @141b dus tha gi zad cig gnas nas phyis 'jig go zhes zer ro // de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir 'dra ba rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, things do not disintegrate moment by moment, but remain for a while and then disintegrate.🔽To demonstrate that this is also illogical, the text says:

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the continuity of the similar.🔽The thought arises, “I see that very thing,” when one sees things after having seen them before.

original: dngos po rnams mthong ba las phyis mthong ba'i dus na bdag gis de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye ba yang skad cig ma snga ma'i tshe dngos po rnams kyi kha dog dang bong tshod ci 'dra bar byung ba skad cig ma phyi ma'i tshe na yang
analyzed: dngos po rnams mthong ba las phyis mthong ba'i dus na bdag gis de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye ba yang skad cig ma snga ma'i tshe dngos po rnams kyi kha dog dang bong tshod ci 'dra bar byung ba skad cig ma phyi ma'i tshe na yang
translated: The color and size of things that occurred in the previous moment also occur in the subsequent moment.

original: skad cig ma de dang 'dra ba'i kha dog dang bong tshong skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma de dang 'dra ba'i kha dog dang bong tshong skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The color and size of that moment arise in the subsequent moment.

original: phyi ma'i tshe yang 'dra ba byung na de nyid mthong ba'i blo skyes te nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyi ma'i tshe yang 'dra ba byung na de nyid mthong ba'i blo skyes te nyes pa med do //
translated: If the same thing occurs in the future, the mind perceives it as the same thing, and there is no fault.

original: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To illustrate this, he says:

original: mig 'phrul can gyis rde'u bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /🔽dper na mig 'phrul can gyis pho long brgya tsam gnam du bor na /
analyzed: mig 'phrul can gyis rde'u bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te / dper na mig 'phrul can gyis pho long brgya tsam gnam du bor na /
translated: It is like a conjurer’s trick.

original: 'dor ba la gor myur bas du ma byung ngo snyam pa mi skye'i /
analyzed: 'dor ba la gor myur bas du ma byung ngo snyam pa mi skye'i /
translated: For example, when a conjurer throws up a ball and catches it, many do not appear to be thrown up and caught.

original: gcig cig mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: gcig cig mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye'o //
translated: But the mind perceives that one ball is thrown up and caught.

original: de dang 'dra bar dngos po rnams skye ba na yang de skad cig ma 'dab chags su myur bar skye la /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar dngos po rnams skye ba na yang de skad cig ma 'dab chags su myur bar skye la /
translated: In the same way, when things arise, they arise in a continuous series of instants.

original: snga phyi 'dra ba sha stag skye bas na de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye ba'o //
analyzed: snga phyi 'dra ba sha stag skye bas na de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye ba'o //
translated: Since only similar things arise before and after, the mind perceives them as the same thing.

original: dper na chu bo la sogs pa 'bab pa na yang skad cig ma re re la yang 'gags shing skye mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na chu bo la sogs pa 'bab pa na yang skad cig ma re re la yang 'gags shing skye mod kyi /
translated: For example, when a river flows, it ceases and arises in every instant.

original: phyi ma rnams kyang snga ma dang 'dra ba sha stag skyes pas na ;
analyzed: phyi ma rnams kyang snga ma dang 'dra ba sha stag skyes pas na ;
translated: But since only similar things arise before and after,

original: chu de dag mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chu de dag mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the thought that arises, “I see those waters.”

original: tshig de dag gis ni rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: By those words, the meaning of “following” is taught.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir de'i blor 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir de'i blor 'gyur te /
translated: Because of similarity, the thought of that arises,🔽but how is it known that it is not because of the thing itself?

original: de'i dngos po'i phyir ni ma yin par ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan dag yang 'di skad du rgol te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i phyir ni ma yin par ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan dag yang 'di skad du rgol te /
translated: If others argue in this way,

original: gang sngar mthong pa'i dngos po phyis mthong bas na /
analyzed: gang sngar mthong pa'i dngos po phyis mthong bas na /
translated: because the thing that was seen before is seen later,

original: snga ma de nyid kyi dngos po ma zhig par mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma de nyid kyi dngos po ma zhig par mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not that the thing of the former is seen as not disintegrated.

original: skad cig ma snga ma 'gags pa dang 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan sha stag skyes pas 'dra ba skyes pa'i phyir snga ma nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blor 'gyur bar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma 'gags pa dang 'dra ba'i skad cig ma gzhan sha stag skyes pas 'dra ba skyes pa'i phyir snga ma nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blor 'gyur bar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the thought arises, “The former is seen,” because another moment arises that is similar to the former moment that has ceased, and because of the arising of similarity?

original: ma 'gags par dngos po sngar mthong ba nyid phyis mthong ngam /
analyzed: ma 'gags par dngos po sngar mthong ba nyid phyis mthong ngam /
translated: Is the thing that was seen before without ceasing seen later?

original: sus shes snyam rgol lo //
analyzed: sus shes snyam rgol lo //
translated: Who knows?

original: de ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that this is illogical,

original: 'gog pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Because they cease.

original: dngos po rnams mjug tu 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams mjug tu 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because things finally cease,

original: dngos po snga ma nyid phyis mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po snga ma nyid phyis mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: the prior thing itself is not seen later.

original: skad cig snga ma 'gags @142a * //
analyzed: skad cig snga ma 'gags @142a * //
translated: The prior moment ceases🔽and the subsequent moment arises in a similar way.

original: nas phyi ma de 'dra ba skyes pa mthong ba las de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas phyi ma de 'dra ba skyes pa mthong ba las de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is seen, the mind thinks, “I see that very thing.”🔽In order to demonstrate that very point,

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: de bzhin gnas pa la ni mthar 'gas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gnas pa la ni mthar 'gas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it endures, it will not finally cease,

original: thog ma'i skad cig ma dang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thog ma'i skad cig ma dang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because it would be without difference from the initial moment.

original: gal te dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re la 'gag pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams skad cig ma re re la 'gag pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If things do not cease moment by moment,

original: brtan por gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni dngos po de mjug tu 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtan por gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni dngos po de mjug tu 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: if they are by nature stable and enduring, then those things will not finally cease.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ji ltar thog ma'i skad cig ma 'gag pa med de gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar thog ma'i skad cig ma 'gag pa med de gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because just as the initial moment does not cease, since it is by nature enduring,

original: phyi ma'i skad cig ma na yang gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po de nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i skad cig ma na yang gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po de nyid yin te /
translated: Also, in the subsequent moment, it is that very entity which has the nature of enduring.

original: de las dngos po ma brjes pas na /
analyzed: de las dngos po ma brjes pas na /
translated: Because that entity does not change,

original: phyis kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not cease later.

original: don de dag gis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /🔽de bas na de nyid yin par mi rigs so /
analyzed: don de dag gis mjug bsdu ba'i phyir / de bas na de nyid yin par mi rigs so /
translated: In order to summarize those topics,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, Therefore, it is not reasonable that it is that very thing.

original: gong du bshad pa'i rigs pa ltar na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i rigs pa ltar na /
translated: As explained above,

original: mjug tu dngos po rnams 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po sngar mthong ba gang yin pa phyis kyang de nyid mthong bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: mjug tu dngos po rnams 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po sngar mthong ba gang yin pa phyis kyang de nyid mthong bar mi rigs so //
translated: because entities cease in the end, it is not reasonable that one sees that very thing later which one saw previously.

original: tshig de dag gis ni 'gog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni 'gog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don bstan to //
translated: Those words indicate the meaning of the words “because of cessation.”

original: tha mar 'gyur ba nye bar dmigs pa'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha mar 'gyur ba nye bar dmigs pa'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, because of the observation of change in the end.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang nang gi dngos po rnams la mjug tu gnyer ma can dang / skra dkar la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po mthong la phyi'i dngos po rnams la yang ka ba la sogs pa khong rul ba la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong bas na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang nang gi dngos po rnams la mjug tu gnyer ma can dang / skra dkar la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po mthong la phyi'i dngos po rnams la yang ka ba la sogs pa khong rul ba la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong bas na /
translated: And one sees that external things change into other things, such as pillars and so on, which become rotten and so on.

original: skad cig dngos po rnams skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig dngos po rnams skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that things are momentary.

original: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ci yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ci yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what “change” means, he says:

original: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yin la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Change” means “becoming other.”

original: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don ni nang gi dngos po la yang snga ma snga ma dang mi 'dra bar phyi ma'i dus na skra dkar la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don ni nang gi dngos po la yang snga ma snga ma dang mi 'dra bar phyi ma'i dus na skra dkar la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “change” is that internal things become other, such as when one’s hair turns gray and so on, which is different from the previous state.

original: phyi'i dngos po la yang ka ba la sogs pa snga ma dang mi 'dra bar rul ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba la 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po la yang ka ba la sogs pa snga ma dang mi 'dra bar rul ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba la 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Also, with regard to external things, such as a pillar, etc., the characteristic of decay is seen, which is different from the previous.

original: de gal te thog ma nas ma brtsams su zin na ni phyi nang gi dngos po rnams tha mar yongs su 'gyur ba yang mi dmigs @142b la zhig nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gal te thog ma nas ma brtsams su zin na ni phyi nang gi dngos po rnams tha mar yongs su 'gyur ba yang mi dmigs @142b la zhig nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were not begun from the beginning, the final transformation of internal and external things would not be observed.

original: gal te dngos po rnams thog ma nas skad cig ma re re la rga ba dang / 'drul ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du brtsams su zin na ni nang gi dngos po la yang tha mar skra dkar la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams thog ma nas skad cig ma re re la rga ba dang / 'drul ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du brtsams su zin na ni nang gi dngos po la yang tha mar skra dkar la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba mi 'gyur la /
translated: If things were begun from the beginning with the characteristic of aging and decay, etc., in each moment, then the transformation into another state, with the characteristic of gray hair, etc., would not be seen in internal things at the end.

original: phyi'i dngos po la yang rul pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du tha mar gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po la yang rul pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du tha mar gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the transformation into another state with the characteristic of decay, etc., would not be seen at the end in external things.

original: de lta bas na thog ma nyid nas gzhan du 'gyur ba brtsams te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lta bas na thog ma nyid nas gzhan du 'gyur ba brtsams te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If it were not begun from the beginning with transformation.”

original: gong du bshad pa ltar phyi nang gi dngos po rnams tha mar sngon dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar phyi nang gi dngos po rnams tha mar sngon dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: As explained above, external and internal things eventually change into something else, having a different character than before.

original: dngos po rnams dang po nyid nas gang gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur ba skad cig ma re re brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams dang po nyid nas gang gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur ba skad cig ma re re brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that things are produced in each instant, changing from one thing to another.

original: gzhan gyis brgal ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brgal ba /
translated: An opponent might argue as follows:

original: gal te skad cig ma re re la rga ba dang rul pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma re re la rga ba dang rul pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams na /
translated: If things are produced in each instant, changing from one thing to another through aging and decay,

original: ci'i phyir na phyis mthong ba'i tshe bdag gis sngon mthong ba'i dngos po de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skyes zer ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na phyis mthong ba'i tshe bdag gis sngon mthong ba'i dngos po de nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skyes zer ba la /
translated: why is it that when we see something later, we think, “I saw that thing before”?

original: gang mthar gyis skye ba ni tha mar snang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang mthar gyis skye ba ni tha mar snang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to this is that what is gradually produced appears in the end.

original: skad cig ma dang po nas snga ma dang phyi ma 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur la skyes shing brtsams pas na /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po nas snga ma dang phyi ma 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur la skyes shing brtsams pas na /
translated: From the first instant onward, things are produced and arise with a nature that is similar to what comes before and after.

original: mjug tu skra dkar la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rul pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ste /
analyzed: mjug tu skra dkar la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rul pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ste /
translated: Finally, it appears to have the characteristics of white hair and so on, and the characteristics of decay and so on.

original: de bas na dang po nas gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur ba brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dang po nas gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur ba brtsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, from the beginning, it is engaged in changing from one state to another.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'o ma las zho'i gnas bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir 'o ma las zho'i gnas bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To demonstrate the example of that, it is said, “like milk becoming curd.”

original: dper na'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba yang dang po nas skad cig ma re re la je ska je skar 'gyur bar brtsams pas na /
analyzed: dper na'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba yang dang po nas skad cig ma re re la je ska je skar 'gyur bar brtsams pas na /
translated: For example, milk becomes curd, and from the beginning, it is engaged in becoming thicker and thicker in each instant.

original: mjug tu ska ba'i rang bzhin zhor 'gyur bas na snang zhing mngon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mjug tu ska ba'i rang bzhin zhor 'gyur bas na snang zhing mngon pa bzhin no //
translated: Finally, it appears and becomes manifest as curd, which is by nature thick.

original: yang gzhan gyis brgal ba gal te skad cig ma re re la yang gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyis brgal ba gal te skad cig ma re re la yang gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams /
translated: Again, another opponent argues, “If it is engaged in changing from one state to another in each instant,

original: ci'i phyir gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams pa ma tshor zhes brgal ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams pa ma tshor zhes brgal ba la /
translated: why is it not noticed that it is engaged in changing from one state to another?”

original: lan du ji srid du de gzhan du 'gyur ba phra bas yongs su mi rigs pa de bzhin du de dang 'dra ba rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lan du ji srid du de gzhan du 'gyur ba phra bas yongs su mi rigs pa de bzhin du de dang 'dra ba rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir te /
translated: In response, as long as it is not suitable to be transformed into something else due to subtle transformation, it is similar to that because it follows.

original: de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes @143a * //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes @143a * //
translated: That is this.

original: shes par bya ba grub po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba grub po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is established that it is known.

original: dper na 'o ma dang po nas gzhan nas gzhan du skad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bar brtsams nas /
analyzed: dper na 'o ma dang po nas gzhan nas gzhan du skad pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bar brtsams nas /
translated: For example, beginning with the nature of milk changing from one thing to another,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba rtsom pa phra bas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi rigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba rtsom pa phra bas ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi rigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: it is not suitable to change from one thing to another due to subtle transformation.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po gzhan dang yang rga ba dang 'drul ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams pa phra bas na /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po gzhan dang yang rga ba dang 'drul ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur bar brtsams pa phra bas na /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the nature of external and internal things changing from one thing to another due to the characteristics of aging, decay, and so on,

original: de'i tshe rig par ma gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig par ma gyur gyi /
translated: at that time it is not known.

original: mjug tu rga ba dang rul pa gsal bar snang bar gyur ba dang / gdod rgas pa dang rul bar rig go //
analyzed: mjug tu rga ba dang rul pa gsal bar snang bar gyur ba dang / gdod rgas pa dang rul bar rig go //
translated: In the end, when aging and decay clearly appear, then aging and decay are known.

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams 'dab chags su bred ma chad par skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra bar phyi ma skyes pas na /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams 'dab chags su bred ma chad par skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra bar phyi ma skyes pas na /
translated: Therefore, since compounded phenomena arise in a continuous series without a break, and the later moment arises in a manner similar to the earlier moment,

original: bdag gis skad cig ma snga ma nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye'o //
analyzed: bdag gis skad cig ma snga ma nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo skye'o //
translated: the thought arises, “I see the very same thing that I saw before.”

original: don de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize those points,

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir skad cig ma grub bo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir skad cig ma grub bo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “Therefore, because of changing in every moment, momentariness is established.”

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na /
translated: As explained above,

original: phyi nang gi 'du byed rnams mjug tu gzhan du 'gyur bar snang bas na /
analyzed: phyi nang gi 'du byed rnams mjug tu gzhan du 'gyur bar snang bas na /
translated: outer and inner compounded phenomena appear to change in the end.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar snang bas na /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar snang bas na /
translated: Therefore, because all compounded phenomena appear to change in every moment,

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma yin par grub ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma yin par grub ste /
translated: all compounded phenomena are established as being momentary.

original: tshig de dag gis 'gyur ba nye bar dmigs zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis 'gyur ba nye bar dmigs zhes bya ba'i don bstan to //
translated: Those words indicate the meaning of “change is perceived.”

original: ji ltar grub ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar grub ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it established?

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig mar grub bo zhes bshad na gtan tshigs gang gis skad cig ma grub ce na zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig mar grub bo zhes bshad na gtan tshigs gang gis skad cig ma grub ce na zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: If it is explained that compounded phenomena are established as momentary, by what reasoning are they established as momentary?

original: de'i gtan tshigs smras pa /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs smras pa /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: from its cause and effect.

original: tshig gi don de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gi don de'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that statement,

original: skad cig ma'i rgyu dang skad cig ma'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don to /🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyu dang skad cig ma'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i don to / zhes smos te /
translated: the meaning of “momentary cause” and “momentary effect” is stated.

original: rgyu skad cig ma yin pas na /
analyzed: rgyu skad cig ma yin pas na /
translated: Because the cause is momentary,

original: de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu yang skad cig ma yin par brtag la /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i 'bras bu yang skad cig ma yin par brtag la /
translated: the effect that arises from it is also to be regarded as momentary.

original: 'bras bu skad cig ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'bras bu skad cig ma yin pas na /
translated: Because the effect is momentary,

original: de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yang skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu yang skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the cause that produces it is also to be understood as momentary.

original: rgyu skad cig ma yin pas 'bras bu skad cig ma yin par 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu skad cig ma yin pas 'bras bu skad cig ma yin par 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the cause is momentary, the effect is established as momentary.

original: sems ni skad cig mar grags pas mig dang gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan las gyur pas de dag kyang skad cig mar @143b 'grub ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems ni skad cig mar grags pas mig dang gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan las gyur pas de dag kyang skad cig mar @143b 'grub ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since mind is renowned as momentary, other compounded phenomena such as eye and form are also established as momentary because they are transformed from it.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa thams cad ni skad cig ma yin par sangs rgyas pa dang mu stegs pa thams cad la yang grangs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa thams cad ni skad cig ma yin par sangs rgyas pa dang mu stegs pa thams cad la yang grangs so //
translated: Thus all consciousnesses such as eye consciousness are momentary, renowned to all Buddhists and tīrthikas.

original: de ltar sems skad cig mar grags pas na /
analyzed: de ltar sems skad cig mar grags pas na /
translated: Since mind is renowned as momentary,

original: sems de'i rgyu ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems de'i rgyu ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
translated: its cause is eye and form, etc.

original: mdo las kyang mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las kyang mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: A sūtra also says: Eye consciousness arises in dependence on eye and form.

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu sems skad cig mar grub pas na de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig mar grub po ;
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu sems skad cig mar grub pas na de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig mar grub po ;
translated: Therefore, since the result, mind, is established as momentary, the causes that produce it, compounded phenomena, are also established as momentary.

original: / gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du 'du byed rtag pas sems skad cig mar skyed de /
analyzed: / gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du 'du byed rtag pas sems skad cig mar skyed de /
translated: If others say that because formations are permanent, the mind is produced in a moment,

original: de bas na 'du byed ni rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed ni rtag pa yin la /
translated: then formations are permanent,

original: de las skyes pa'i sems ni skad cig ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i sems ni skad cig ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: and the mind produced from them is momentary.

original: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that that is unreasonable,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa las ni skad cig mar 'byung bar mi 'os so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa las ni skad cig mar 'byung bar mi 'os so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that it is not suitable for a momentary thing to arise from a non-momentary thing.

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin zhing rtag pa las 'bras bu skad cig ma'i rang bzhin gyi sems 'byung bar ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin zhing rtag pa las 'bras bu skad cig ma'i rang bzhin gyi sems 'byung bar ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not reasonable for a momentary mind, the result, to arise from the non-momentary, permanent eye, form, and so on.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa'i phyir // 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to show an example of that,

original: rtag pa las mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtag pa las mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, For example, like the impermanent arising from the permanent.

original: rtag pa las ni mi rtag pa 'byung bar mi srid de /
analyzed: rtag pa las ni mi rtag pa 'byung bar mi srid de /
translated: It is not possible for the impermanent to arise from the permanent.

original: dper na nam mkha' rtag pa las bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mi rtag pa'i dngos po mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rtag pa las bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa mi rtag pa'i dngos po mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, impermanent things such as pots and cloth do not arise from the permanent space.

original: rgyu skad cig ma yin pas 'bras bu skad cig mar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu skad cig ma yin pas 'bras bu skad cig mar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is momentary, the effect is established as momentary.

original: yang 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyi 'bras bu ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: yang 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyi 'bras bu ste zhes smos te /
translated: Moreover, all formations are the effect of mind.

original: gzhan yang mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Moreover, all formations such as eye and form are the effect of mind.

original: 'du byed rnams ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Formations are the effect of mind,

original: sems ni de dag gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sems ni de dag gi rgyu yin no //
translated: and mind is their cause.

original: de ltar na sems skad cig ma yin pas na de'i 'bras bu 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems skad cig ma yin pas na de'i 'bras bu 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, because mind is momentary, its effect, the formations, should be understood as momentary.

original: ji ltar rig ce na zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par yang ci mngon la sems skad cig ma yin par 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig ma yin par ci mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rig ce na zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par yang ci mngon la sems skad cig ma yin par 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig ma yin par ci mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is it known? This means: How is it known that formations are the effect of mind, and that because mind is momentary, formations are momentary?

original: @144a * // de'i lan du zin pa dang / dbang ba dang / dag pa dang / sems can gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @144a * // de'i lan du zin pa dang / dbang ba dang / dag pa dang / sems can gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer to that is: because they are conjoined with the mind, because they are controlled by the mind, because they follow the purification of the mind, and because they follow the mind of sentient beings.

original: 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par ni sems kyi 'du byed rnams zin pa dang / sems kyi 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa dang ; sems dag pa'i rjes su 'du byed rnams 'brang ba dang / sems can gyi sems kyi rjes su 'du byed rnams 'brang bas na 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par mngon no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par ni sems kyi 'du byed rnams zin pa dang / sems kyi 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa dang ; sems dag pa'i rjes su 'du byed rnams 'brang ba dang / sems can gyi sems kyi rjes su 'du byed rnams 'brang bas na 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par mngon no //
translated: It is evident that formations are the result of the mind because mental formations are conjoined with the mind, because mental formations are controlled by the mind, because formations follow the purification of the mind, and because formations follow the mind of sentient beings.

original: sems kyi 'du byed zin pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed zin pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of conjoined with the mind,

original: sems kyi mig la sogs pa la gnas dang bcas pa zin pa ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: sems kyi mig la sogs pa la gnas dang bcas pa zin pa ste zhes smos te /
translated: it says: the conjoined mind is together with the eye and so on, along with their bases.

original: gnas ni lus la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ni lus la bya'o //
translated: The base refers to the body.

original: sems ni 'dis mig gi dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kun du bzung ste /
analyzed: sems ni 'dis mig gi dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kun du bzung ste /
translated: The mind is the one that holds the body together with the eye faculty and so on.

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that formations are the result of the mind.

original: sems kyis ji ltar lus zin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyis ji ltar lus zin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain how the mind seizes the body, the root text says:

original: lhan cig tu brgyal ba dang / bde bar zin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig tu brgyal ba dang / bde bar zin pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is simultaneously unconscious and because it is subsequently conscious of being well seized.

original: 'di ltar ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs nas brgyal bar gyur pa dang / gdod pha ma'i mig tsang ba las nur nur po dang mer mer po la sogs pa lus kyi dngos por 'grub kyi /🔽ji srid du rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs nas brgyal bar ma gyur pa de srid du pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las nur nur po dang mer mer po la sogs pa mi 'gyur bas ni lus na sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir sems kyis
analyzed: 'di ltar ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs nas brgyal bar gyur pa dang / gdod pha ma'i mig tsang ba las nur nur po dang mer mer po la sogs pa lus kyi dngos por 'grub kyi / ji srid du rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du zhugs nas brgyal bar ma gyur pa de srid du pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las nur nur po dang mer mer po la sogs pa mi 'gyur bas ni lus na sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir sems kyis
translated: Thus, when consciousness enters the mother’s womb, it becomes unconscious and then, through the mother’s eating and drinking, the body develops from the kalala stage, the arbuda stage, and so on.🔽As long as consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb and become unconscious, the kalala stage, the arbuda stage, and so on will not develop from the parents’ unclean substances.

original: lus yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: lus yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, because the body is conscious and follows the mind, the body is seized by the mind.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: A sutra also states:

original: dga' bo gal te ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa brgyal bar ma gyur na pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las nur nur po la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dga' bo gal te ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa brgyal bar ma gyur na pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las nur nur po la sogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Nanda, if the consciousness does not enter the mother’s womb, the kalala, etc., do not come to be from the impure elements of the father and mother.

original: gzhan yang sems la gnod par gyur na lus la yang gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems la gnod par gyur na lus la yang gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if the mind is harmed, the body is harmed.

original: sems bde bar gyur na lus kyang dge bar 'gyur bas sems kyi rjes su lus 'brang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bde bar gyur na lus kyang dge bar 'gyur bas sems kyi rjes su lus 'brang ba'i phyir /
translated: If the mind is happy, the body is happy. Therefore, the body follows the mind.

original: sems kyis lus zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyis lus zin pa'i phyir /
translated: The body is seized by the mind.

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no //🔽'du byed rnams la sems dbang ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no // 'du byed rnams la sems dbang ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, the body is the result of the formative forces.🔽In order to demonstrate the meaning of the mind’s control over the formative forces, he says:

original: sems ni 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: sems ni 'du byed rnams la dbang byed pa ste zhes smos te /
translated: The mind controls the formative forces.

original: sems 'di ni 'du byed rnams @144b la dbang byed de /
analyzed: sems 'di ni 'du byed rnams @144b la dbang byed de /
translated: This mind controls the formative forces.

original: de bas na 'du byed ni sems kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed ni sems kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Therefore, the formative forces are the result of the mind.

original: ji ltar dbang byed pa lung gi gtan tshigs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang byed pa lung gi gtan tshigs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of control by means of scriptural authority, he says:

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: As has been stated by the Lord:

original: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni sems kyis khrid do //
translated: This world is led by mind.

original: sems kyis drangs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems kyis drangs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is drawn by mind.

original: sems kyis gang du bsams par lus kyang de'i rjes su 'brang bas na sems kyis khrid pa dang drangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyis gang du bsams par lus kyang de'i rjes su 'brang bas na sems kyis khrid pa dang drangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the body follows wherever the mind goes, it is said to be led and drawn by mind.

original: sems skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mind arises and occurs.

original: sems la 'dod chags zhig skyes nas lus kyang de'i rjes su 'brang nas spyod pa zed zer po dang / bzhin 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems la 'dod chags zhig skyes nas lus kyang de'i rjes su 'brang nas spyod pa zed zer po dang / bzhin 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: When desire arises in the mind, the body follows it and its characteristics change, such as the body becoming restless and the face breaking into a smile.

original: gal te sems las zhe sdang zhig skyes na ni khu tshur 'chang ba dang / bzhin khro gnyer bsdus pa la sogs par gzhan du 'gyur bas na 'du byed rnams la sems dbang ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems las zhe sdang zhig skyes na ni khu tshur 'chang ba dang / bzhin khro gnyer bsdus pa la sogs par gzhan du 'gyur bas na 'du byed rnams la sems dbang ngo //
translated: If anger arises in the mind, the body becomes clenched into a fist and the face becomes contorted with anger. Thus, the formative forces are controlled by the mind.

original: lung gi gtan tshigs gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lung gi gtan tshigs gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second scriptural quotation,

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la gsungs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba la gsungs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: So too, it is said, “Conditioned by consciousness, name and form come to be.”

original: de bzhin du mdo gzhan dag las rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis ming dang gzugs 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo gzhan dag las rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis ming dang gzugs 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: So too, in other sūtras it is said, “Name and form arise due to the power of consciousness.”

original: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed rnams ni sems kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Therefore formations are the result of mind.

original: dag pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain the meaning of “following a pure mind,”

original: dag pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brangs zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems dag pa yin te /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brangs zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems dag pa yin te /
translated: it says, “following a pure mind” means the mind of a yogin.

original: de dag la ni 'du byed rnams de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes smos te /🔽dag pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba la /
