analyzed: de dag la ni 'du byed rnams de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes smos te / dag pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya ba la /
translated: For them, formations are like that.🔽Following a pure mind means

original: dag pa'i sems ni rnal 'byor ba rnams ki sems la bya ba ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems ni rnal 'byor ba rnams ki sems la bya ba ste /
translated: the mind of yogins.

original: 'du byed rnams rnal 'bor ba'i sems kyis ji lta ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du 'gyur bas nas 'du byed rnams la sems dbang byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rnal 'bor ba'i sems kyis ji lta ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du 'gyur bas nas 'du byed rnams la sems dbang byed do //
translated: because the formations occur just as the yogi’s mind intends them to be.

original: rnal 'byor pas ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du 'gyur bar ci mngon zhe na /🔽lung gi gtan tshigs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ji ltar bsams pa de bzhin du 'gyur bar ci mngon zhe na / lung gi gtan tshigs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: How do you know that the formations occur just as the yogi intends them to be?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: To show this by means of scriptural authority, he says,

original: dge slong bsam gtan thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge slong bsam gtan thob pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: “For example, a monk who has attained the meditative absorptions…”

original: sems can gyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir sems can rjes su 'brang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir sems can rjes su 'brang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show the meaning of “following the mind of sentient beings,” he says, “because they follow sentient beings…”

original: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams ni @145a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams ni @145a * //
translated: Thus, the formations

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: follow the mind.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar sdig pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi dbang gis lo tog la sogs pa yang kha dog dang / dri dang ro la sogs pa rnams mthu chung bar 'gyur zhing gser la sogs pa'i dngos po yang sol ba la sogs par snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdig pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems kyi dbang gis lo tog la sogs pa yang kha dog dang / dri dang ro la sogs pa rnams mthu chung bar 'gyur zhing gser la sogs pa'i dngos po yang sol ba la sogs par snang la /
translated: Thus, by the power of the minds of sentient beings who commit evil deeds, crops and so on have little color, smell, taste, and so on, and things such as gold appear as charcoal, and so on.

original: bsod nams byed pa rnams kyi sems kyi dbang gis 'bru la sogs pa kha dog dang dri phun sum tshogs par snang la dngos po ngan pa rnams kyang rin po che la sogs par snang bas na /
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa rnams kyi sems kyi dbang gis 'bru la sogs pa kha dog dang dri phun sum tshogs par snang la dngos po ngan pa rnams kyang rin po che la sogs par snang bas na /
translated: By the power of the minds of those who commit meritorious actions, grains and so on appear to have perfect color and smell, and bad things appear as jewels and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par mngon no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin par mngon no //
translated: Therefore it is evident that formations are the effects of the mind.

original: tshig de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: To summarize those words,

original: de bas na de dag skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, “Therefore they are momentary.”

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na 'du byed rnams sems kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: As explained above, because formations are the effects of the mind, formations should be understood to be momentary.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that very point,🔽it says,

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir skad cig ma las 'bras bu skad cig ma med par mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir skad cig ma las 'bras bu skad cig ma med par mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: Because it follows that, an effect cannot be different from its cause, it is said that an effect cannot occur without a cause.

original: 'bras bu thams cad ni rgyu'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad ni rgyu'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: All effects follow their causes.

original: rgyu ci 'dra bar btab pa 'bras bu yang de 'dra bar skye'o //
analyzed: rgyu ci 'dra bar btab pa 'bras bu yang de 'dra bar skye'o //
translated: Whatever the cause is planted, the effect will be similar to that.

original: de yang dper na rgyu 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon btab na 'bras bu yang 'bras s'a lu'i 'bras bu nyid smin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de yang dper na rgyu 'bras s'a lu'i sa bon btab na 'bras bu yang 'bras s'a lu'i 'bras bu nyid smin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, if the cause, rice seed, is planted, the effect will be the ripening of the fruit of rice.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu sems skad cig ma yin pas na de'i 'bras bu 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu sems skad cig ma yin pas na de'i 'bras bu 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, since the cause of formations is momentary mind, their effect, formations, should be recognized as momentary.

original: sems ni skad cig ma yin la /
analyzed: sems ni skad cig ma yin la /
translated: Mind is momentary.

original: de'i 'bras bu 'du byed rnams skad cig ma ma yin pa brtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar ni mi rigs so ;
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu 'du byed rnams skad cig ma ma yin pa brtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar ni mi rigs so ;
translated: It is illogical that its effect, formations, would be permanent, having a character that does not change.

original: / de ltar 'du byed rnams re zhig bye brag med par skad cig mar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bsgrubs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de ltar 'du byed rnams re zhig bye brag med par skad cig mar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bsgrubs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in two verses, formations are established as momentary without distinction.

original: 'di yan chad du phyi nang gi 'du byed rnams so sor ma phye bar gcig tu bsdus nas skad cig ma yin par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to /
analyzed: 'di yan chad du phyi nang gi 'du byed rnams so sor ma phye bar gcig tu bsdus nas skad cig ma yin par tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan to /
translated: Up to this point, external and internal formations have been included together without distinction and shown to be momentary in two verses.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang nang gi rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rnams su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang nang gi rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa rnams su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, the verses should be understood for the sake of establishing the internal.

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa lnga zhig gis nag gi 'du byed sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig mar sgrub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa lnga zhig gis nag gi 'du byed sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig mar sgrub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Now, in five verses, the internal formations of mind and mental factors are established as momentary. This is the meaning.

original: thog ma je bas je @145b tshe dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thog ma je bas je @145b tshe dang ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Beginning with “gradually, from the beginning,”

original: nang gi 'du byed skye ba la rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed skye ba la rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de /
translated: there are fourteen aspects to the arising of internal formations.

original: thog mar skye ba dang / je bas je cher skye ba dang / sogs pa skye ba dang gnas kyi dngos por skye ba dang / 'gyur bar skye ba dang / smin par skye ba dang / tha ma'i skye ba dang / de bzhin du mchog gi skye ba dang /🔽'od gsal bar skye ba dang / 'od mi gsal bar skye ba dang / yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i skye ba dang / sa bon can gyi skye ba dang / sa bon med pa'i skye ba dang / gzugs brnyan du skye ba ste /
analyzed: thog mar skye ba dang / je bas je cher skye ba dang / sogs pa skye ba dang gnas kyi dngos por skye ba dang / 'gyur bar skye ba dang / smin par skye ba dang / tha ma'i skye ba dang / de bzhin du mchog gi skye ba dang / 'od gsal bar skye ba dang / 'od mi gsal bar skye ba dang / yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i skye ba dang / sa bon can gyi skye ba dang / sa bon med pa'i skye ba dang / gzugs brnyan du skye ba ste /
translated: The fourteen types of arising are:🔽arising in the beginning, arising in the middle, arising in the end, arising in the final limit, arising in the present, arising in the past, arising in the future, arising in the present moment, arising in the present moment of the present, arising in the present moment of the future, arising in the present moment of the past, arising in the present moment of the present moment, arising in the present moment of the future moment, and arising in the present moment of the past moment.🔽The fourteen types of arising are: arising in the beginning, arising in the middle, arising in the end, arising in the final limit, arising in the present, arising in the past, arising in the future, arising in the present moment, arising in the present moment of the present, arising in the present moment of the future, arising in the present moment of the past, arising in the present moment of the present moment, arising in the present moment of the future moment, and arising in the present moment of the past moment.

original: skye ba rnams pa bcu bzhi yod pa la ni rnam pa bcu bzhi po de skad cig mar sgrub pa'i rgyu dang tshad ma ni /🔽rgyu dang tshad kyi bye brag dang / zhes bya ba nas sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba nas /🔽'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: skye ba rnams pa bcu bzhi yod pa la ni rnam pa bcu bzhi po de skad cig mar sgrub pa'i rgyu dang tshad ma ni / rgyu dang tshad kyi bye brag dang / zhes bya ba nas sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba nas / 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: The fourteen types of arising are: arising in the beginning, arising in the middle, arising in the end, arising in the final limit, arising in the present, arising in the past, arising in the future, arising in the present moment, arising in the present moment of the present, arising in the present moment of the future, arising in the present moment of the past, arising in the present moment of the present moment, arising in the present moment of the future moment, and arising in the present moment of the past moment.🔽The fourteen types of arising are: arising in the beginning, arising in the middle, arising in the end, arising in the final limit, arising in the present, arising in the past, arising in the future, arising in the present moment, arising in the present moment of the present, arising in the present moment of the future, arising in the present moment of the past, arising in the present moment of the present moment, arising in the present moment of the future moment, and arising in the present moment of the past moment.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar dag gis bstan to //
translated: The fourteen types of arising are: arising in the beginning, arising in the middle, arising in the end, arising in the final limit, arising in the present, arising in the past, arising in the future, arising in the present moment, arising in the present moment of the present, arising in the present moment of the future, arising in the present moment of the past, arising in

original: je bas je che zhes bya ba nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: je bas je che zhes bya ba nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this:

original: thog mar je che je che dang // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: thog mar je che je che dang // zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: First, from “increasing more and more” up to

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma'o //
translated: “all conditioned things are momentary.”🔽The meaning of the verse is this:

original: zhes bya ba'i bar dag gi tshigs su bcad pa lngas nang gi 'du byed rnams skad cig mar sgrub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar dag gi tshigs su bcad pa lngas nang gi 'du byed rnams skad cig mar sgrub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five verses from “increasing more and more” up to “all conditioned things are momentary” prove that internal formations are momentary.

original: de dag gis ji ltar skad cig ma 'grub ce na zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa lnga po de dag gis nang gi 'du byed rnams ji ltar skad cig mar 'grub ce na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar skad cig ma 'grub ce na zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa lnga po de dag gis nang gi 'du byed rnams ji ltar skad cig mar 'grub ce na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How are they momentary? The meaning of the verse is this: How are internal formations proved to be momentary by those five verses?

original: thog mar skye ba ni dang por lus mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thog mar skye ba ni dang por lus mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: First, birth is the initial establishment of the body.

original: nang gi 'du byed sna la skye ba bcu bzhi yod pa'i mtshan nyid de je bstan nas /
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed sna la skye ba bcu bzhi yod pa'i mtshan nyid de je bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the fourteen characteristics of birth in the internal formations,

original: de dag ji ltar skad cig ma yin pa ni gtan tshigs kyis phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar skad cig ma yin pa ni gtan tshigs kyis phyis 'chad do //
translated: later, by reason, it will be explained how they are momentary.

original: de la thog ma skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags nas ma'i mngal du skad cig ma dang po la rnam par shes pa zhugs te brgyal nas skye ba'i nyid mtshams sbyar ba gang yin pa la /
analyzed: de la thog ma skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags nas ma'i mngal du skad cig ma dang po la rnam par shes pa zhugs te brgyal nas skye ba'i nyid mtshams sbyar ba gang yin pa la /
translated: Birth is the first moment of consciousness entering the mother's womb, which is the link to birth, after the consciousness belonging to the death state has ceased.

original: thog ma skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called birth.

original: gal te rtag pa zhig yin na ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes pa 'gags nas skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes pa 'byung mi srid de /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa zhig yin na ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes pa 'gags nas skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes pa 'byung mi srid de /
translated: If it were permanent, it would be impossible for the consciousness belonging to the death state to cease and for the consciousness belonging to the birth state to arise.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /🔽'chi ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes pa 'gags nas skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes @146a * //
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te / 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes pa 'gags nas skye ba'i char gtogs pa rnam par shes @146a * //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: pa 'byung ba na /
analyzed: pa 'byung ba na /
translated: When the consciousness belonging to the death state ceases and the consciousness belonging to the birth state arises,

original: skad cig mar rig par bya'o //🔽je bas je che ba ni dang po skyes pa'i skad cig ma phan chad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skad cig mar rig par bya'o // je bas je che ba ni dang po skyes pa'i skad cig ma phan chad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: it should be understood as momentary.🔽Growth is from the second moment onward.

original: je bas je cher skye ba ni skad cig ma dang po la /
analyzed: je bas je cher skye ba ni skad cig ma dang po la /
translated: Growth is from the second moment of the first stage of embryonic development onward.

original: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs pa skad cig ma ma rtogs pa skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad nur nur po dang mer mer po dang ltar ltar po la sogs pa skyes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs pa skad cig ma ma rtogs pa skad cig ma gnyis pa phan chad nur nur po dang mer mer po dang ltar ltar po la sogs pa skyes pa la bya ste /
translated: The entry of consciousness into the mother's womb is the first moment. The second moment and all subsequent moments are the development of the embryo, the fetus, and so on.

original: gal te skad cig ma ma yin na ni nur nur po'i rang bzhin 'gags nas mer mer po la sogs pa skye mi srid de /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma ma yin na ni nur nur po'i rang bzhin 'gags nas mer mer po la sogs pa skye mi srid de /
translated: If it were not momentary, it would be impossible for the nature of the embryo to cease and for the fetus and so on to arise.

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi nur nur po la sogs pa snga ma 'gags nas mer mer po la sogs pa gzhan skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi nur nur po la sogs pa snga ma 'gags nas mer mer po la sogs pa gzhan skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not the case. The embryo and so on cease and something else, the fetus and so on, arises.

original: de bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood to be momentary.

original: sogs pa ni kha zas dang / nyal ba dang / tshangs par spyod par dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni lus chud zhing rid pa las nyam che zhing brtas par 'gyur bar byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ni kha zas dang / nyal ba dang / tshangs par spyod par dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni lus chud zhing rid pa las nyam che zhing brtas par 'gyur bar byed pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase and so on refers to eating, sleeping, celibacy, meditative absorption, and so on. The meaning of and so on is that it refers to the body becoming emaciated and weak and then becoming strong and healthy again.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni kha zas dang gnyid dang tshangs par spyod pas lus nyam chung ngu las nyam chen po dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni kha zas dang gnyid dang tshangs par spyod pas lus nyam chung ngu las nyam chen po dang ldan par byed do //
translated: In the desire realm, food, sleep, and sexual intercourse make the body stronger when it is weak.

original: gzungs la sogs pa'i khams na ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas lus brtas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzungs la sogs pa'i khams na ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pas lus brtas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the meditative absorptions, the body becomes stronger through the meditative attainment of concentration.

original: gal te dngos po 'di dag rtag pa yin na ni kha zas la sogs pas kyang lus nyam chung ngu las nyam chen por 'gyur mi srid de /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'di dag rtag pa yin na ni kha zas la sogs pas kyang lus nyam chung ngu las nyam chen por 'gyur mi srid de /
translated: If these things were permanent, it would be impossible for the body to become stronger through food, etc.

original: de lta na ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: kha zas la sogs pas lus nyam chung ngu las nyam chen por skyed par byed pas na /
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pas lus nyam chung ngu las nyam chen por skyed par byed pas na /
translated: Since the body becomes stronger through food, etc.,

original: dngos po rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: things should be understood as momentary.

original: gnas kyi dngos po ni gang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i gnas kyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas kyi dngos po ni gang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pa'i gnas kyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The state of being a basis is that which is the basis of eye consciousness, etc., such as the eyes.

original: gnas kyi dngos por skye ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi dngos por skye ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du rnam par shes pa drug ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses, from eye consciousness to mind consciousness, are called the abodes.

original: mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug ni gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du dbang po drug ni gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The six faculties, from the eye faculty to the mind faculty, are called the abodes.

original: gnas par byed pa rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig ma yin par de'i dbang po rnams kyang skad cig ma ma yin du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig ma yin par de'i dbang po rnams kyang skad cig ma ma yin du mi rung ste /
translated: Since the consciousnesses that abide are momentary, it is not tenable that their faculties are not momentary.

original: de bas na skad cig mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are momentary.

original: 'gyur @146b bas na gang 'dod chags la sogs pas kha dog la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur @146b bas na gang 'dod chags la sogs pas kha dog la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Since the faculties change due to attachment and so on, they are momentary.

original: 'gyur ba'i skye ba ni nam sems 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par skyes bas na lus kyang sngon dang mi 'dra bar bzhin 'dzum pa dang / kha dog ma dangs can du 'gyur ba dang ; nam zhe sdang gi rnam par skye ba na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i skye ba ni nam sems 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par skyes bas na lus kyang sngon dang mi 'dra bar bzhin 'dzum pa dang / kha dog ma dangs can du 'gyur ba dang ; nam zhe sdang gi rnam par skye ba na /
translated: When the mind arises in the aspect of attachment and so on, the body also changes, as can be seen in the smile and the clear complexion that are not like before. When it arises in the aspect of anger, the body also changes, as can be seen in the frown and the unclear complexion that are not like before.

original: lus la sogs pa yang khro gnyer bsdus pa dang / so gtsigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yang khro gnyer bsdus pa dang / so gtsigs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: The body, etc. also change into other aspects, such as a frowning face, clenched teeth, etc.

original: de lta bu dag kyang rtag pa'i chos rnams la mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu dag kyang rtag pa'i chos rnams la mi srid kyi /
translated: Such changes are impossible for permanent things.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos rnams la srid de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos rnams la srid de /
translated: But they are possible for impermanent things.

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, conditioned things should be understood as momentary.

original: smin pa ni gang skyes nas dang / byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / dar la bab pa dang / dar byid pa dang / rgas pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smin pa ni gang skyes nas dang / byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / dar la bab pa dang / dar byid pa dang / rgas pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Maturation is the stages of birth, childhood, youth, middle age, old age, and death.

original: dang po ma'i mngal nas byung ma thag pa la ni skyes nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ma'i mngal nas byung ma thag pa la ni skyes nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Immediately after emerging from the mother’s womb, one is called “newborn.”

original: de nas de las 'das la 'gro nus la thug gi bar la ni byis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de las 'das la 'gro nus la thug gi bar la ni byis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, until one can walk, one is called “child.”

original: de nas de las 'das nas rtsed mo nus kyi bar la ni gzhon nu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de las 'das nas rtsed mo nus kyi bar la ni gzhon nu zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, until one can play, one is called “youth.”

original: de nas de las 'das nas sems dang lus kyi mthu rdzogs par 'gyur ba la ni dar la bab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de las 'das nas sems dang lus kyi mthu rdzogs par 'gyur ba la ni dar la bab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, until the power of the mind and body is complete, one is called “middle-aged.”

original: de las 'das la nam che rgas pa la sogs pa 'gyur ba la ni dar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'das la nam che rgas pa la sogs pa 'gyur ba la ni dar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But when it is the opposite of this, when it is the change of something great into something small, etc., it is called “aging.”

original: ru zhom par gyur pa la ni rgas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ru zhom par gyur pa la ni rgas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When it is the change of something young into something old, it is called “aging.”

original: dngos po rtag pa rnams la ni de lta bu gzhan rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba 'byung mi srid de /
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa rnams la ni de lta bu gzhan rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba 'byung mi srid de /
translated: For permanent things, such a change from one state into another is impossible.

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not so for impermanent things.

original: dngos po rnams gzhan nas gzhan du 'byung ba na skad cig mar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan nas gzhan du 'byung ba na skad cig mar rig par bya'o /
translated: Therefore, when things change from one state into another, they are to be understood as momentary.

original: tha ma dang mchog ni gang ngan 'gro dang / bde 'gror skye ba rnams te rim bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha ma dang mchog ni gang ngan 'gro dang / bde 'gror skye ba rnams te rim bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The worst and the best are the rebirths in the evil and good destinies, respectively.

original: tha ma dang mchog gi skye ba ni rim bzhin du ngan 'gro gsum du skyes pa ni tha mar skyes pa /
analyzed: tha ma dang mchog gi skye ba ni rim bzhin du ngan 'gro gsum du skyes pa ni tha mar skyes pa /
translated: The worst rebirth is the rebirth in the three evil destinies.

original: lha dang mi'i nang du skyes pa ni mchog tu skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i nang du skyes pa ni mchog tu skyes pa'o //
translated: The best rebirth is the rebirth among gods and humans.

original: de la rtag pa'i chos rnams la ni ngan song gsum du skyes pa las 'gags nas lha dang mir skye ba dang / lha dang mir skyes pa la 'gags nas /
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i chos rnams la ni ngan song gsum du skyes pa las 'gags nas lha dang mir skye ba dang / lha dang mir skyes pa la 'gags nas /
translated: In regard to that, for those with permanent phenomena, having ceased from birth in the three lower realms, they are born as gods and humans, and having ceased from birth as gods and humans, they are born in the three lower realms.🔽

original: ngan song du skye ba ni mi srid de /
analyzed: ngan song du skye ba ni mi srid de /
translated: In that regard, it is impossible for those with permanent phenomena to cease being born in the three lower realms and be born as a god or human, or to cease being born as a god or human and be born in the lower realms.

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi /
translated: That is not so.

original: ngan song gsum las shi 'phos nas /🔽lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba dang / lha dang @147a * //
analyzed: ngan song gsum las shi 'phos nas / lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba dang / lha dang @147a * //
translated: Having died and transmigrated from the three lower realms,

original: mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas dan song gsum du skyes te /
analyzed: mi'i nang nas shi 'phos nas dan song gsum du skyes te /
translated: one is born among gods and humans, and having died and transmigrated from among gods and humans, one is born in the three lower realms.

original: de bas na mi rtag par rig par bya'i //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag par rig par bya'i //
translated: Therefore, one should know that they are impermanent.

original: 'od gsal ba ni gang 'dod pa'i sprul pa dang / 'dod pa'i gzhan 'phrul dang / gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams sems tsam la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni gang 'dod pa'i sprul pa dang / 'dod pa'i gzhan 'phrul dang / gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams sems tsam la rag las pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the clear light, it is said that because emanations of the desire realm, others’ emanations of the desire realm, and those born in the form and formless realms depend on mind alone, they are clear light.

original: 'od gsal bar skyes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug las 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha ril dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha thams cad la 'od gsal bar skyes pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: 'od gsal bar skyes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug las 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha ril dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha thams cad la 'od gsal bar skyes pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: Those born in the luminous abodes are the gods of the six desire realms, the gods of the five classes of the form realm and all the gods of the formless realm.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de skyes pa'i lha rnams bya ba thams cad rang gi sems pa la rag lus te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de skyes pa'i lha rnams bya ba thams cad rang gi sems pa la rag lus te /
translated: Why are they called luminous?🔽Because the gods born there are luminous,

original: bsams pa tsam gyis don thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis don thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since all their activities depend on their own minds and all their goals are accomplished merely through their wishes.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyang lha'i bu mo gang dang gang 'dod pa kun du spyod pa 'dod pa de na /
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyang lha'i bu mo gang dang gang 'dod pa kun du spyod pa 'dod pa de na /
translated: When the gods of the Nirmanarati realm desire to enjoy any goddess,

original: lha'i bu mo de'i sems dang mthun pa'i lus kyi kha dog dang gos dang rgyan la sogs pa sems kyis sprul na de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu mo de'i sems dang mthun pa'i lus kyi kha dog dang gos dang rgyan la sogs pa sems kyis sprul na de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if they mentally emanate a body, color, clothes, ornaments and so on that accords with the mind of that goddess, it appears just as they wish.

original: lha'i bu mo dag kyang lha'i bu gang 'dod pas kun du spyod par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: lha'i bu mo dag kyang lha'i bu gang 'dod pas kun du spyod par 'gyur ba na /
translated: When the goddesses also desire to enjoy any god,

original: de lta bu'i rkyen dang / lus kyi kha dog dang / gos la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen dang / lus kyi kha dog dang / gos la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Such conditions, the body's color, clothes, and so on, will appear.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams kyang lha gzhan dag dang 'dod pa'i longs spyod myong bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams kyang lha gzhan dag dang 'dod pa'i longs spyod myong bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The gods of the Paranirmitavaśavartin realm, in order to experience the enjoyments of desire with other gods,

original: longs spyod dag sems kyis 'phrul na de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dag sems kyis 'phrul na de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: create enjoyments with their minds and they appear accordingly.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams kyis kyang /
translated: The gods of the form and formless realms,

original: so so'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang la 'jug 'dod pa de bsams pa tsam gyis de dag 'grub par 'gyur zhing mngon sum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: so so'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gang la 'jug 'dod pa de bsams pa tsam gyis de dag 'grub par 'gyur zhing mngon sum du 'gyur te /
translated: whatever meditative stabilization they wish to enter, that is accomplished and appears to them merely by thinking of it.

original: de ltar rtag pa'i dngos po la ni de lta bu 'byung mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rtag pa'i dngos po la ni de lta bu 'byung mi srid kyi /
translated: Such things are impossible for permanent things,

original: mi rtag pa'i dngos pa la srid pas na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i dngos pa la srid pas na /
translated: but are possible for impermanent things.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma'o //
translated: Therefore, all compounded phenomena are momentary.

original: 'od mi gsal ba ni gang de las gzhan du skyes pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la 'od mi gsal bar skyes pa ni gang gong du bshad pa la la ma gtogs pa rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / dga' ldan dang / mtshe ma dang /
analyzed: 'od mi gsal ba ni gang de las gzhan du skyes pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la 'od mi gsal bar skyes pa ni gang gong du bshad pa la la ma gtogs pa rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / dga' ldan dang / mtshe ma dang /
translated: Those born elsewhere have dull radiance.🔽Those born with dull radiance are those born in the four great continents,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / gling bzhi pa'i mi rnams dang / ngan song @147b gsum dag ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / gling bzhi pa'i mi rnams dang / ngan song @147b gsum dag ste /
translated: the Heaven of the Thirty-three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, as well as in the three lower realms.

original: de dag ni bsams pa tsam gyis don thams cad mi 'grub pas na 'od mi gsal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bsams pa tsam gyis don thams cad mi 'grub pas na 'od mi gsal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since they cannot accomplish all their goals merely by thinking of them, they are said to have dull radiance.

original: 'di ltar 'od gsal ba las mi gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'od mi gsal ba las gsal bar 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'od gsal ba las mi gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / 'od mi gsal ba las gsal bar 'gyur ba yang /
translated: Thus, it is possible for those with bright radiance to become dull, and for those with dull radiance to become bright.

original: rtag pa'i chos la mi srid kyi /
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos la mi srid kyi /
translated: But this is impossible for something that is permanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos la srid pas na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos la srid pas na /
translated: Since it is possible for something impermanent,

original: skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the self is momentary.

original: yul gzhan du 'gro ba ni gang yul gzhan du skyes pa 'gags nas yul gzhan du skye ba'o zhes bya ba la yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i skye ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig yul gzhan du phyin cing skye ba de yang sngon yul gzhan na gnas pa de
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro ba ni gang yul gzhan du skyes pa 'gags nas yul gzhan du skye ba'o zhes bya ba la yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i skye ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig yul gzhan du phyin cing skye ba de yang sngon yul gzhan na gnas pa de
translated: Going to another place is the cessation of birth in one place and the birth in another place.🔽Birth going to another place is the arrival and birth of some thing in another place.

original: 'gags nas phyis de ma yin pa'i yul gzhan du 'phos shing skyes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'gags nas phyis de ma yin pa'i yul gzhan du 'phos shing skyes pa la bya ste /
translated: Moreover, that is the cessation of the former state in another place and the subsequent arising and birth in another place that is not that.

original: de lta bu yang skye ba dang 'gags pa'i chos can la srid kyi /
analyzed: de lta bu yang skye ba dang 'gags pa'i chos can la srid kyi /
translated: Such birth and cessation is possible for things that are momentary,🔽but it is impossible for things that are permanent.

original: rtag pa'i chos can la mi srid de de bas na skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos can la mi srid de de bas na skad cig ma'o //
translated: Therefore, they are momentary.

original: sa bon dang bcas pa ni gang dgra bcom pa tha ma'i phung po ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas pa ni gang dgra bcom pa tha ma'i phung po ma gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those that possess seeds are all except for the aggregates of the final arhat.

original: sa bon ni khams gsum du skye bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon ni khams gsum du skye bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags la bya ste /
translated: Seeds are the latent tendencies of affliction that generate birth in the three realms.

original: sa khon dang bcas skye ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spong ba'i dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma ma gtogs pa dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sa khon dang bcas skye ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par spong ba'i dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma ma gtogs pa dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: Those who are born with seeds are those who obtain nirvana with remainder, who abandon all afflictions to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation, and those who are arhats who abandon the remainder of the aggregates, except for the final aggregates of arhats who abandon the remainder of the aggregates without exception.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams ni sa bon dang bcas par skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams ni sa bon dang bcas par skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Nonreturners, once-returners, stream enterers and ordinary beings are said to be born with seeds.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyus tshe gcig nas gcig tu len pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyus tshe gcig nas gcig tu len pas so //
translated: Because they take rebirth from the cause of affliction.

original: de ltar tshe len pa yang rtag pa'i dngos po la ni mi srid kyi /
analyzed: de ltar tshe len pa yang rtag pa'i dngos po la ni mi srid kyi /
translated: Moreover, taking rebirth is not possible for permanent things.

original: mi rtag pa'i dngos po la srid pas na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i dngos po la srid pas na /
translated: But it is possible for impermanent things.

original: 'dus byas rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore conditioned states should be understood to be momentary.

original: sa bon med pa ni gang de dag gi tha ma'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon med pa ni gang de dag gi tha ma'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absence of seeds is the final one.

original: sa bon med pa'i skye ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa'i phung po @148a * //🔽tha ma la bya ste /
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i skye ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa'i phung po @148a * // tha ma la bya ste /
translated: The birth that is without seeds refers to the final aggregates of arhats who enter the realm of nirvāṇa that is, the nirvāṇa in which the remainder of the aggregates has been extinguished and the nirvāṇa in which the remainder of the aggregates has not been extinguished.

original: skad cig ma ma yin na ni sa bon dang bcas pa las phyis sa bon med par skye mi srid kyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin na ni sa bon dang bcas pa las phyis sa bon med par skye mi srid kyi /
translated: If they were not momentary, it would be impossible for them to arise later without seeds, after having been accompanied by seeds.

original: mi rtag pa rnams la sngon sa bon dang bcas pa las phyis sa bon med par 'gyur srid pas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams la sngon sa bon dang bcas pa las phyis sa bon med par 'gyur srid pas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: But it is possible for impermanent things to be without seeds later, after having been accompanied by seeds. Therefore, they are known to be momentary.

original: gzugs brnyan la gang rnam par thar pa la bsgom pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la gang rnam par thar pa la bsgom pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the case of a reflection, it is said that “it is due to the power of concentration of those who are cultivating the liberations.”

original: gzugs brnyan du skye ba ni gang rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsgom pa'i bsam gtan pa'i gang zag gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu thams cad skyed la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan du skye ba ni gang rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsgom pa'i bsam gtan pa'i gang zag gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu thams cad skyed la /
translated: Birth as a reflection is when a person who is a meditator on the eight liberations generates the power of concentration and

translated: If others think that the sense faculties are permanent,

original: de la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni mi rtag pa yin no snyam du sems na de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gnas 'dug pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni mi rtag pa yin no snyam du sems na de ltar yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir / gnas 'dug pa yin la /
translated: and that the consciousnesses that abide in them are impermanent, then to demonstrate that this is also illogical, it says:🔽It is not tenable that what abides

original: de la gnas pa mi 'dug par ni mi rung ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa mi 'dug par ni mi rung ste zhes smos te /
translated: in it does not abide.

original: gal te mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po rnams ni skad cig ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po rnams ni skad cig ma ma yin te /
translated: If the sense faculties such as the eye sense faculty are not momentary,

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dug na /🔽de la gnas shing brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dug na / de la gnas shing brten pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig ma ste /
translated: and they abide with the defining characteristic of permanence,

original: mi rtag pa ma yin par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is not tenable that the consciousnesses that abide and depend on them are not momentary and impermanent.

original: de lta bas na dbang po rtag pa zhig yin na ni rnam par shes pa yang rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po rtag pa zhig yin na ni rnam par shes pa yang rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the sense faculties are permanent, consciousness would also be permanent.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa zhig yin na ni dbang po yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i dpe bstan @150a * //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa zhig yin na ni dbang po yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro // de'i dpe bstan @150a * //
translated: If consciousness is impermanent, the sense faculties would also be impermanent.

original: pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate this example, it says:

original: bzhon pa 'dug pa la zhon pa mi 'dug pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dug pa la zhon pa mi 'dug pa bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is like the case of a rider and a mount.

original: bzhon pa ni rta la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhon pa ni rta la sogs pa'o //
translated: A mount is a horse, etc.

original: zhon pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i mi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhon pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i mi la sogs pa ste /
translated: A rider is a person, etc., who is connected with it.

original: gal te bzhon pa rta gar yang ma song ste gnas gcig na 'dug na ;
analyzed: gal te bzhon pa rta gar yang ma song ste gnas gcig na 'dug na ;
translated: If the mount, the horse, etc., does not go anywhere and remains in one place,

original: de la zhon pa'i mi gnas gzhan du phyin par mi rigs te mi'ang 'dug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhon pa'i mi gnas gzhan du phyin par mi rigs te mi'ang 'dug par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not reasonable that the person who is riding it should go to another place, for the person would also remain.

original: gal te rta la zhon pa'i mi gnas gzhan zhig tu phyin na de khyer bar byed pa'i rtas kyang gdon mi za bar gnas gzhan du phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rta la zhon pa'i mi gnas gzhan zhig tu phyin na de khyer bar byed pa'i rtas kyang gdon mi za bar gnas gzhan du phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the person who is riding the horse goes to another place, then the horse that is carrying him must also without doubt go to another place.

original: gzhan yang ras tshig na ra sa la brten pa'i kha dog sngon po la sogs pa yang gdon mi za bar tshig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang ras tshig na ra sa la brten pa'i kha dog sngon po la sogs pa yang gdon mi za bar tshig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, when a cloth is burned, the blue color, etc., which is based on the cloth must also be burned without doubt.

original: gal te kha dog sngon po ma tshig na ras kyang tshig par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te kha dog sngon po ma tshig na ras kyang tshig par mi rigs so //
translated: If the blue color is not burned, it is not reasonable that the cloth is burned.

original: de ma yin na ni gnas su yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ma yin na ni gnas su yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible for it to remain.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa skad cig ma ma yin /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa skad cig ma ma yin /
translated: If consciousness were not momentary,

original: dbang po rnams skad cig ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams skad cig ma ma yin te /
translated: the sense faculties would not be momentary.

original: rtag pa yin na ni dbang po rnams rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang rten du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa yin na ni dbang po rnams rnam par shes pa'i gnas dang rten du mi rung ngo //
translated: If they were permanent, the sense faculties would not be suitable as the basis and support for consciousness.

original: 'gyur ba dang smin pa skye ba dang gnas pa la mi srid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang smin pa skye ba dang gnas pa la mi srid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Change and maturation would not be possible in what is born and endures.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dbang gis lus kyi mdog gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ba dang / byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas las dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid smin par skyes pa yang skad cig ma ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i dbang gis lus kyi mdog gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ba dang / byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas las dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid smin par skyes pa yang skad cig ma ma yin zhing /
translated: Due to the power of attachment, aversion, and so on, the body's color changes. The characteristics of youth and so on that mature from the stage of infancy and so on would not be momentary.

original: rtag par gnas pa'i dngos po la ni rnam pa de ltar 'gyur mi srid do /
analyzed: rtag par gnas pa'i dngos po la ni rnam pa de ltar 'gyur mi srid do /
translated: Such a transformation would not be possible in a thing that endures permanently.

original: ji ltar mi srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar mi srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate how it is not possible, it says:

original: thog ma nas 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thog ma nas 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it would not disintegrate and change from the beginning.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po rnams ni thog ma'i rang bzhin 'jig cing med par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po rnams ni thog ma'i rang bzhin 'jig cing med par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Permanent things do not have an original nature that is destroyed and becomes nonexistent.

original: sngon dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan len par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon dang mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan len par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor do they take on a different characteristic that is not similar to the previous one.

original: rang bzhin gcig par gnas pa ni rnam pa du mar mi 'gyur bas rtag pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis bdag gi lus dang bzhin la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur mi srid la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig par gnas pa ni rnam pa du mar mi 'gyur bas rtag pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis bdag gi lus dang bzhin la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur mi srid la /
translated: Since that which remains as a single nature does not become many aspects, it is impossible for a permanent thing to change due to the power of attachment and so on.

original: byis pa las dar la bab pa la sogs pa smin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa las dar la bab pa la sogs pa smin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also impossible for a permanent thing to ripen, such as a child becoming a youth.

original: don de nyid zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that meaning in detail,

original: de ltar gnas pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs @150b pas 'gyur bar yang mi 'gyur la gnas gzhan du yang smin par mi 'gyur te zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs @150b pas 'gyur bar yang mi 'gyur la gnas gzhan du yang smin par mi 'gyur te zhes smos te /
translated: it is said, “That which remains does not change due to attachment and so on, nor does it ripen in another place.”

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gnas pa rnams la ni 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa'i dbang gis gzhan gyi kha dog sngon dang mi 'dra ba'i 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phyis gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'byung la /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid gnas pa rnams la ni 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa'i dbang gis gzhan gyi kha dog sngon dang mi 'dra ba'i 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid phyis gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'byung la /
translated: For those with the characteristics of permanence, due to the arising of a desirous mind, the characteristics of a smile and so on, which are different from the previous color, would not later change into something else.

original: byis pa la sogs pa las kyang phyis dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du lus bong chen por smin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byis pa la sogs pa las kyang phyis dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du lus bong chen por smin par mi 'gyur /
translated: Also, the body of a child and so on would not ripen into the great body of a youth and so on later.

original: ro // ji ltar mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ro // ji ltar mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it does not change,

original: thog mar mi 'jig tu zin na /
analyzed: thog mar mi 'jig tu zin na /
translated: it is said, “If it did not disintegrate at the beginning,

original: tha mar yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: tha mar yang 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: it would not change in the end.”

original: 'gyur ba'i skye ba la yang 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i skye ba la yang 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa na /
translated: Also, if arising were to change,

original: dang po sems ma skyes pa'i kha dog la sogs pas ma zhig ma 'gags na ni 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa'i dus na yang bzhin la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur bar mi snang gi 'dod chags 'byung ba'i
analyzed: dang po sems ma skyes pa'i kha dog la sogs pas ma zhig ma 'gags na ni 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa'i dus na yang bzhin la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dzum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur bar mi snang gi 'dod chags 'byung ba'i
translated: If the color and so on of the mind that has not arisen is not destroyed and does not cease, then even when the mind of attachment arises, the color of the face and so on and the characteristics of smiling and so on do not appear to change.

original: dus na yang 'dod chags ma byung ba'i dus kyi bzhin de nyid snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus na yang 'dod chags ma byung ba'i dus kyi bzhin de nyid snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when attachment arises, the face that existed at the time when attachment had not arisen appears.

original: rnam par smin pa mang yang gal te rtag pa zhig yin yang byis pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur nas mi 'jig tu mi btub na ni dar la bab pa'i dus na yang lus kyi bong tshod chen po la sogs par gzhan mi mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mang yang gal te rtag pa zhig yin yang byis pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur nas mi 'jig tu mi btub na ni dar la bab pa'i dus na yang lus kyi bong tshod chen po la sogs par gzhan mi mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If, although there are many ripenings, it is permanent, then the characteristics of a child would not change and would not be able to be destroyed. Even when one is an adult, the size of the body and so on would not change.

original: dus thams cad du yang byis pa'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig tu gnas shing snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yang byis pa'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig tu gnas shing snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At all times, only the nature of a child would remain and appear.

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa na sngon gyi bzhin dang kha dog 'gags nas phyis de ma yin pa'i bzhin dang kha dog gzhan 'byung ba dang / smin pa la yang byis pa la sogs pa'i dus kyi lus kyi bong tshod la sogs pa 'gags nas phyis de ma yin par /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sems skyes pa na sngon gyi bzhin dang kha dog 'gags nas phyis de ma yin pa'i bzhin dang kha dog gzhan 'byung ba dang / smin pa la yang byis pa la sogs pa'i dus kyi lus kyi bong tshod la sogs pa 'gags nas phyis de ma yin par /
translated: When a mind of attachment arises, the former face and complexion cease and a different face and complexion arise that are not those.

original: dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi bong tshod gzhan skyes te /
analyzed: dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi bong tshod gzhan skyes te /
translated: When ripened, the size of the body and so on of a child and so forth cease and later a different size of the body of an adult and so on arises that is not that.

original: de bas na skad cig mar grub bo //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig mar grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is established as momentary.

original: de ltar thog mar mi 'jig pa dang mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis 'gyur ba dang / smin pa'i skye ba gnyis skad cig mar bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de ltar thog mar mi 'jig pa dang mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis 'gyur ba dang / smin pa'i skye ba gnyis skad cig mar bsgrubs so //
translated: Thus first the two, change and ripening, are established as momentary by the reason of not disintegrating and not changing.

original: yang thog mar mi 'jig cing mthar mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs de nyid mchog dang tha ma'i skye ba'i skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i phyir /🔽de bzhin du tha ma @151a * //
analyzed: yang thog mar mi 'jig cing mthar mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs de nyid mchog dang tha ma'i skye ba'i skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i phyir / de bzhin du tha ma @151a * //
translated: Again, in order to establish the momentariness of the arising of the best and the worst by the reason of not disintegrating at first and not changing in the end,

original: dang mchog skye ba la yang skad cig mar rig par bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: dang mchog skye ba la yang skad cig mar rig par bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: it is said, “In the same way, the arising of the worst and the best should be known as momentary.”

original: ji ltar 'gyur ba dang / smin pa skye ba la thog ma nas mi 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig ma bsgrubs pa de bzhin du tha ma dang / mchog tu skyes pa la yang thog ma nas mi 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyis skad cig mar bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur ba dang / smin pa skye ba la thog ma nas mi 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig ma bsgrubs pa de bzhin du tha ma dang / mchog tu skyes pa la yang thog ma nas mi 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyis skad cig mar bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the argument that what is transformed and arises from ripening does not disintegrate and transform from the beginning establishes momentariness, so too should the argument that what is born at the end and is born as the best does not disintegrate and transform from the beginning be understood to establish momentariness.

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyis ji ltar skad cig mar sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyis ji ltar skad cig mar sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate how that very argument establishes momentariness,

original: ji ltar smin pa skye ba bzhin du 'du byed de bzhin gnas pa la yang las kyi bag chags 'jog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar smin pa skye ba bzhin du 'du byed de bzhin gnas pa la yang las kyi bag chags 'jog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that just as ripening arises, so too formations would not deposit the latent tendencies of karma while enduring.

original: ji ltar byis pa las dar la bab pa la sogs par smin par 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa las dar la bab pa la sogs par smin par 'gyur ba la /
translated: Just as ripening occurs from childhood to adulthood and so on,

original: dang po byis pa'i dus mi 'jig cing /🔽dar la bab pa'i dus la yang gzhan du ma gyur na ni rtag tu byis pa 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dang po byis pa'i dus mi 'jig cing /🔽dar la bab pa'i dus la yang gzhan du ma gyur na ni rtag tu byis pa 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: in the beginning, childhood does not disintegrate🔽and in the time of adulthood, it does not transform into something else.

original: dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nams kyang snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du nams kyang snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would never appear as having the characteristics of being young and so on.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed rnams de bzhin du gnas te rtag pa zhig yin na ni sngon lha dang mi la sogs pa'i gnas na dge ba byed byed pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed rnams de bzhin du gnas te rtag pa zhig yin na ni sngon lha dang mi la sogs pa'i gnas na dge ba byed byed pa las /
translated: Likewise, if compounded phenomena were permanent, then the virtuous karma that is created while in the realms of gods, humans, and so on

original: dge ba byed pa'i las 'gags nas mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i bag chags kyis phyis ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu myong bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba byed pa'i las 'gags nas mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i bag chags kyis phyis ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu myong bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: would not cease, and the latent tendencies of the nonvirtuous karma created would not later cause the experience of the results of suffering in the three lower realms.

original: lha dang mi'i gnas su yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sngon ngan song gsum gyi gnas na sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa las dge ba'i las byas pa'i bag chags kyis sngar sdug bsngal myong ba 'gags nas phyis bde ba myong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i gnas su yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / sngon ngan song gsum gyi gnas na sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa las dge ba'i las byas pa'i bag chags kyis sngar sdug bsngal myong ba 'gags nas phyis bde ba myong bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The nature of suffering would also be present in the realms of gods and humans, and the nature of suffering that is present in the three lower realms would not cease due to the latent tendencies of virtuous karma created, and later, happiness would not be experienced.

original: rtag tu sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would always be present as suffering.

original: gang gi phyir ngan 'gror skye ba dang / bzang 'gror skye ba yang rim gyis rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag las ni 'jug pa rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngan 'gror skye ba dang / bzang 'gror skye ba yang rim gyis rgyud yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag las ni 'jug pa rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the continuum is gradually transformed, one obtains birth in lower rebirths and birth in higher rebirths.

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi /🔽sngon ngan song gsum gyi gnas su gnas pa na mi dge ba byed byed pa'i skad cig ma 'gags nas phyis dge ba byas pa'i rgyud bag chags je brtas su 'gyur ba'i bye brag las phyis lha dang mi'i bde 'gror 'bras bu bde @151b ba myong bar 'gyur🔽ba dang / sngon lha dang mi'i nang na gnas pa na las dge ba byed byed pa las sngar las dge ba byas pa 'gags nas phyis las mi dge ba byas pa'i bag chags ji brtas je brtas su gyur pas mjug tu ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi / sngon ngan song gsum gyi gnas su gnas pa na mi dge ba byed byed pa'i skad cig ma 'gags nas phyis dge ba byas pa'i rgyud bag chags je brtas su 'gyur ba'i bye brag las phyis lha dang mi'i bde 'gror 'bras bu bde @151b ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon lha dang mi'i nang na gnas pa na las dge ba byed byed pa las sngar las dge ba byas pa 'gags nas phyis las mi dge ba byas pa'i bag chags ji brtas je brtas su gyur pas mjug tu ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal ba'i 'bras bu
translated: This is not the case.🔽When previously abiding in the three lower rebirths, the instances of nonvirtuous action cease and later, due to the specific enhancement of the latent tendencies of the continuum of virtuous action, one later experiences the result of happiness in the higher rebirths of gods and humans.

original: myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When previously abiding among gods and humans, virtuous action is performed and virtuous action previously performed ceases. Later, due to the specific enhancement of the latent tendencies of nonvirtuous action, in the end one experiences the result of suffering in the three lower rebirths.

original: mi rtag pa la ni de ltar 'gyur gyi /🔽rtag pa zhig na ni yang na rtag tu sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la ni de ltar 'gyur gyi / rtag pa zhig na ni yang na rtag tu sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur /
translated: This is so for the impermanent.🔽But if it were permanent, then either one would always experience only pleasure,

original: yang na rtag tu bde ba 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur gyi /🔽bar 'ga' bde bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na rtag tu bde ba 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur gyi / bar 'ga' bde bar 'gyur //
translated: or one would always experience only suffering,🔽but not that sometimes one experiences pleasure

original: bar 'ga' sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba lta bur rnam pa du mar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar 'ga' sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba lta bur rnam pa du mar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and sometimes one experiences suffering.

original: thog mar ni mi 'jig cing mthar mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs des 'od gsal ba dang / 'od mi gsal ba la yang skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog mar ni mi 'jig cing mthar mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs des 'od gsal ba dang / 'od mi gsal ba la yang skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason that it does not disintegrate at the beginning and does not change at the end is also established as momentary for the luminous and non-luminous.

original: 'od gsal ba dang / 'od mi gsal ba'i skye ba ni /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba dang / 'od mi gsal ba'i skye ba ni /
translated: The arising of the luminous and non-luminous

original: de bzhin du skad cig mar rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig mar rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is also established as momentary.

original: gal te thog ma nas mi 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba med pa /
analyzed: gal te thog ma nas mi 'jig cing mi 'gyur ba med pa /
translated: If it did not disintegrate at the beginning and did not change at the end,

original: dngos po rnams skad cig mar 'gyur na ni sngon 'od gsal ba las phyis 'od mi gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon 'od gsal bas las phyis 'od mi gsal bar rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig mar 'gyur na ni sngon 'od gsal ba las phyis 'od mi gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon 'od gsal bas las phyis 'od mi gsal bar rung ngo //
translated: If things were momentary, then what was previously luminous would later become non-luminous, and what was previously non-luminous would later become luminous.🔽But it is not tenable that what is permanent is previously non-luminous and later luminous.

original: rtag pa las sngon 'od mi gsal ba las phyis 'od gsal ba ni mtshan nyid du mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa las sngon 'od mi gsal ba las phyis 'od gsal ba ni mtshan nyid du mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is not tenable that what is permanent is previously non-luminous and later luminous, he says:

original: 'od gsal ba ni de ltar gnas pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni de ltar gnas pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because that which is luminous does not arise from that which abides in that way.

original: 'byung ba ni sems la rag lus pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni sems la rag lus pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Because arising depends on the mind.🔽That which is imperishable and unchanging, which abides as having the characteristic of permanence, does not give rise to the characteristic of being previously non-luminous and later luminous.

original: mi 'jig cing 'gyur ba med de rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa las ni sngon 'od mi gsal ba las phyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid 'byung mi srid de yang na ni rtag par 'od mi gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mi 'jig cing 'gyur ba med de rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa las ni sngon 'od mi gsal ba las phyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid 'byung mi srid de yang na ni rtag par 'od mi gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: Either it would always be non-luminous,

original: yang na ni rtag par 'od gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na ni rtag par 'od gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: or it would always be luminous.

original: sngon 'od mi gsal ba las phyis 'od gsal bar 'gyur na ni skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon 'od mi gsal ba las phyis 'od gsal bar 'gyur na ni skad cig ma yin no //
translated: If what is previously non-luminous later becomes luminous, then it is momentary.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'phrul dga' la sogs pa'i lha'i ris na 'od mi gsal ba las 'od gsal ba 'byung ba ni sems la rag lus shing sems kyi rgyu las skyes te /
analyzed: 'phrul dga' la sogs pa'i lha'i ris na 'od mi gsal ba las 'od gsal ba 'byung ba ni sems la rag lus shing sems kyi rgyu las skyes te /
translated: Because in the god realms of the Nirmanarati and so on, the arising of bright light from dim light depends on the mind and is born from the cause of the mind.

original: de bas na sems skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na sems skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the mind is momentary,

original: de las skyes pa'i bzhin gyi mdog dang lus la sogs par 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos rnams kyang skad cig @152a * //🔽ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i bzhin gyi mdog dang lus la sogs par 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos rnams kyang skad cig @152a * // ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: the phenomena that are its effects, such as the complexion of the face and the body, are also momentary.

original: 'jig pa med cing mi 'jig pa'i dngos po la /🔽'od gsal ba las 'od mi gsal bar 'gyur pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig pa med cing mi 'jig pa'i dngos po la / 'od gsal ba las 'od mi gsal bar 'gyur pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no destruction and no thing that is destroyed,🔽it is impossible for bright light to become dim light.

original: 'od gsal ba ma yin pa la yang thog ma 'jig pa med par mthar 'gyur ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ma yin pa la yang thog ma 'jig pa med par mthar 'gyur ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said that even in the absence of bright light, it is not possible for there to be an end without a beginning that is destroyed.

original: thog mar 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa las phyis 'od mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yang thog ma nas 'jig pa med cing rtag pa'i dngos po la ni sngon 'od gsal ba las tha mar 'od mi gsal ba lta bur 'gyur bar mi
analyzed: thog mar 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa las phyis 'od mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yang thog ma nas 'jig pa med cing rtag pa'i dngos po la ni sngon 'od gsal ba las tha mar 'od mi gsal ba lta bur 'gyur bar mi
translated: First, it is not tenable that a thing that is permanent and does not disintegrate from the beginning later becomes the nature of non-light.

original: rung ste / de bas na sngon 'od gsal bar gnas pa'i dngos po 'gags nas phyis 'od mi gsal ba'i ngo bo 'byung bas na dngos po rnams skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rung ste / de bas na sngon 'od gsal bar gnas pa'i dngos po 'gags nas phyis 'od mi gsal ba'i ngo bo 'byung bas na dngos po rnams skad cig ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since a thing that previously existed as light ceases and later arises as the nature of non-light, you should understand that things are momentary.

original: yul gzhan du skye ba 'gro ba la yang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul gzhan du skye ba 'gro ba la yang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, going to another place is not going.

original: yul gzhan du skye ba'i 'gro ba la yang 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yul gzhan du skye ba'i 'gro ba la yang 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis na skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
translated: Also, you should understand that things are momentary because the reason that going to another place is not going is as follows.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis yul gcig nas gcig tu 'phos pa ma gtogs par yul gcig nas gcig tu 'pho bar byed pa'i 'gro ba zhes bya ba gang yang med pas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis yul gcig nas gcig tu 'phos pa ma gtogs par yul gcig nas gcig tu 'pho bar byed pa'i 'gro ba zhes bya ba gang yang med pas na /
translated: Thus, apart from things that move from one place to another by the power of momentariness, there is no so-called going that causes movement from one place to another.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, conditioned states should be understood to be momentary.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that very point, it says:

original: 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i byed pa gang yang med de zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i byed pa gang yang med de zhes smos te /
translated: There is no agent called “going” that has the characteristic of conditioned states moving to another place.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gags /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma snga ma ni 'gags /
translated: The previous moment of conditioned states ceases,

original: skad cig ma phyi ma ni skye ba'i tshul gyis yul gzhan du 'pho zhing phyin par zad kyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma ni skye ba'i tshul gyis yul gzhan du 'pho zhing phyin par zad kyi /
translated: and the subsequent moment arises in the manner of moving to and arriving at another place.

original: de la ma gtogs par 'du byed rnams yul gcig nas gcig tu 'pho bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i byed pa po rdzas gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs par 'du byed rnams yul gcig nas gcig tu 'pho bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i byed pa po rdzas gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Apart from that, there is no other substance called “the agent that has the characteristic of causing conditioned states to move from one place to another.”

original: 'du byed skad cig ma las ma gtogs pa'i 'gro ba byed pa po gang yang med par gtan tshigs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed skad cig ma las ma gtogs pa'i 'gro ba byed pa po gang yang med par gtan tshigs kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The treatise states:🔽If going is where one has gone,

original: de'ang 'gro ba skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am yul gzhan du byed grang na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'ang 'gro ba skyes pa'am ma skyes pa'am yul gzhan du byed grang na zhes smos te /
translated: Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,🔽How could there be a goer🔽In any of these three?🔽The treatise states:

original: 'gro ba des 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed na /
analyzed: 'gro ba des 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed na /
translated: If going is where one has gone,🔽Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,🔽How could there be a goer🔽In any of these three?🔽The treatise states:

original: 'du byed gnas pa'i mtshan nyid zhig yin pa las /
analyzed: 'du byed gnas pa'i mtshan nyid zhig yin pa las /
translated: If going is where one has gone,🔽Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,🔽How could there be a goer🔽In any of these three?🔽The treatise states:

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i chos @152b skyes nas gdong 'du byed rnams yul gcig nas gcig tu 'pho bar byed dam /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i chos @152b skyes nas gdong 'du byed rnams yul gcig nas gcig tu 'pho bar byed dam /
translated: If going is where one has gone,🔽Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,🔽How could there be a goer🔽In any of these three?🔽The treatise states:🔽If going is where one has gone,🔽Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,

original: 'on te 'gro ba ma skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan nas gzhan du 'pho bar byed ces bya grang na de gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'gro ba ma skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan nas gzhan du 'pho bar byed ces bya grang na de gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so //
translated: How could there be a goer🔽In any of these three?

original: de la phyogs dang po bstan pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po bstan pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: The treatise states:🔽If going is where one has gone,🔽Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,🔽How could there be a goer🔽In any of these three?🔽The treatise states:🔽If going is where one has gone,🔽Where there is going, or where one is yet to go,🔽How could there be a goer

original: gal te skyes pa yin na ni de'i phyir 'gro ba'i dus na gar yang ma song bas 'dug pa la ni 'gro ba mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: gal te skyes pa yin na ni de'i phyir 'gro ba'i dus na gar yang ma song bas 'dug pa la ni 'gro ba mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: In any of these three?

original: gal te 'gro ba skyes pa zhig gis 'du byed gnas pa yul gzhan du 'pho ba byed ces bya bar yang 'du byed nyid gnas pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba skyes pa zhig gis 'du byed gnas pa yul gzhan du 'pho ba byed ces bya bar yang 'du byed nyid gnas pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: If a person who goes makes formations that endure go to another place, then formations would have the nature of endurance.

original: 'du byed de la 'pho ba'i rang bzhin med pas na /🔽'gro ba skyes pa'i dus na 'du byed gar yang ma song ste 'dug pas na /
analyzed: 'du byed de la 'pho ba'i rang bzhin med pas na / 'gro ba skyes pa'i dus na 'du byed gar yang ma song ste 'dug pas na /
translated: But since formations do not have the nature of going,🔽at the time when a person who goes arises, formations do not go anywhere.

original: 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed yul du gzhan du spos shing 'gro bar byas pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed yul du gzhan du spos shing 'gro bar byas pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that a person who goes makes formations that endure go to another place.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams gnas pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams gnas pa'i rang bzhin can ma yin te /
translated: If formations do not have the nature of endurance,

original: yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i rang bzhin can yin na ni 'du byed nyid yul gzhan du song bas de la ma gtogs pa'i 'gro bar byed pa'i rdzas gzhan yod par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro ba'i rang bzhin can yin na ni 'du byed nyid yul gzhan du song bas de la ma gtogs pa'i 'gro bar byed pa'i rdzas gzhan yod par mi rung ngo //
translated: and they have the nature of going to another place, then since formations themselves go to another place, it is not tenable that there is a substance that goes apart from them.

original: phyogs gnyis pa mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the second position is untenable,

original: de ste ma skyes pa yin na ni de'i phyir 'gro ba med par song ba zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ste ma skyes pa yin na ni de'i phyir 'gro ba med par song ba zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: If it is not arisen, then it is not tenable to say that it goes without going.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba da dung ma skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spos zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
