analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba da dung ma skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spos zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, since going has not yet arisen, it is not tenable to say that it conveys a compounded phenomenon to another place.

original: 'gro ba med pa des 'du byed yul gzhan du spong par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa des 'du byed yul gzhan du spong par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without going, it is not possible to convey a compounded phenomenon to another place.

original: 'du byed de ma gtogs par 'gro bar byed pa rdzas gzhan med par gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang dpyad de /
analyzed: 'du byed de ma gtogs par 'gro bar byed pa rdzas gzhan med par gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang dpyad de /
translated: Apart from that compounded phenomenon, there is no other substance that acts to go. This should be analyzed by other arguments.

original: 'di ltar 'gro bar byed pa des 'du byed yul gzhan du spos na 'gro bar byed pa nyid yul 'di na gnas pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spod par byed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro bar byed pa des 'du byed yul gzhan du spos na 'gro bar byed pa nyid yul 'di na gnas pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spod par byed dam /
translated: If that which goes conveys a compounded phenomenon to another place, does that which goes, abiding in this place, convey the compounded phenomenon to another place?

original: 'on te 'gro bar byed pa yul gzhan la gnas pas 'du byed yul 'di na gnas yul gzhan du spod par byed grang na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gro bar byed pa yul gzhan la gnas pas 'du byed yul 'di na gnas yul gzhan du spod par byed grang na /
translated: Or does that which goes, abiding in another place, convey the compounded phenomenon abiding in this place to another place?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Both are illogical.

original: de la dang po'i phyogs mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dang po'i phyogs mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the first position is illogical,

original: byed pa de yang yul de de na gnas bzhin du 'du byed kyi bya ba byed na /
analyzed: byed pa de yang yul de de na gnas bzhin du 'du byed kyi bya ba byed na /
translated: if the action were to perform the action of formation while abiding in that place,

original: gnas pas yul gzhan du phyin par mi rung ngo zhes smos te /🔽'gro bar byed pa yul 'di na gnas pa des bdag nyid yul de na @153a * //
analyzed: gnas pas yul gzhan du phyin par mi rung ngo zhes smos te / 'gro bar byed pa yul 'di na gnas pa des bdag nyid yul de na @153a * //
translated: then it would not be tenable for abiding to go to another place.

original: gnas pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa bzhin du 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: The one who performs the action of going while abiding in this place would not cause the formations to go to another place, just as he himself does not go to another place.

original: bdag nyid yul de na gnas te yul gzhan du ma song na /
analyzed: bdag nyid yul de na gnas te yul gzhan du ma song na /
translated: If he himself does not go to another place while abiding in this place,

original: 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable that the formations go to another place.

original: dper na rtas mi khyer te /
analyzed: dper na rtas mi khyer te /
translated: For example, a horse does not carry a man.

original: yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa yin na /🔽gal te rta nyid yul de na gnas te /
analyzed: yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa yin na / gal te rta nyid yul de na gnas te /
translated: If it causes him to go to another place,🔽then if the horse itself abides in this place and does not go to another place,

original: yul gzhan du ma phyin na rta de la zhon pa'i mi yul gzhan du phyin cing bskyal to zhes bya bar mi rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan du ma phyin na rta de la zhon pa'i mi yul gzhan du phyin cing bskyal to zhes bya bar mi rung ba bzhin no //
translated: it is not tenable to say that the man mounted on the horse has gone to another place.

original: phyogs gnyis pa mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the second position is illogical,

original: des te yul gzhan du gnas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: des te yul gzhan du gnas pa yin na ni /
translated: If it abides in another place,

original: byed pa med par yul gzhan du mi phyin pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: byed pa med par yul gzhan du mi phyin pa'i phyir mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: it is untenable that it goes to another place without activity.

original: gal te 'gro bar byed pa yul gzhan la gnas pas 'du byed 'di na gnas pa 'pho bar byed do zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar byed pa yul gzhan la gnas par byed pa yin pas 'du byed pa 'di na gnas pa yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed🔽par mi rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'gro bar byed pa yul gzhan la gnas pas 'du byed 'di na gnas pa 'pho bar byed do zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar byed pa yul gzhan la gnas par byed pa yin pas 'du byed pa 'di na gnas pa yul gzhan du 'pho bar byed par mi rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the goer who abides in another place causes the compounded phenomenon that abides here to go, then it is untenable that the goer who abides in another place causes the compounded phenomenon that abides here to go to another place.

original: dper na shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rtas nub phyogs na gnas pa'i mi yul gzhan du bskyal bar mi nus pa bzhin pas de ltar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na shar phyogs na gnas pa'i rtas nub phyogs na gnas pa'i mi yul gzhan du bskyal bar mi nus pa bzhin pas de ltar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: For example, it is just like a horse that abides in the east being unable to carry a person who abides in the west to another place.

original: gzhan yang 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be analyzed:

original: 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par byed na 'du byed sngar skyes la 'gro bar byed pa phyis skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par byed dam /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par byed na 'du byed sngar skyes la 'gro bar byed pa phyis skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par byed dam /
translated: If the goer causes the compounded phenomenon to go to another place, does the goer who arises later cause the compounded phenomenon that arose earlier to go to another place?

original: yang 'du byed sngar skyes pa la /
analyzed: yang 'du byed sngar skyes pa la /
translated: Again, if that which is called going is prior to the compounded phenomena,

original: 'gro bar byed la phyis skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par byed dam /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed la phyis skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin par byed dam /
translated: then that which is called going would cause the compounded phenomena to go to another place.

original: yang 'du byed dang 'gro bar byed pa gnyi ga mgo mnyam du skyes pas 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed spod grang na ;
analyzed: yang 'du byed dang 'gro bar byed pa gnyi ga mgo mnyam du skyes pas 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed spod grang na ;
translated: Or, if both the compounded phenomena and that which is called going arise simultaneously, then that which is called going would cause the compounded phenomena to go.

original: rnam pa gsum char ltar yang mi rigs so //🔽de la 'gro bar byed pa sngar skyes pas /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum char ltar yang mi rigs so // de la 'gro bar byed pa sngar skyes pas /
translated: But in all three cases, it is illogical.🔽If that which is called going arises prior to the compounded phenomena,

original: 'du byed phyis skyes pa spong par byed ces byar ni 'gro bar byed pa skyes pa'i dus na 'du byed ma skyes pas na /
analyzed: 'du byed phyis skyes pa spong par byed ces byar ni 'gro bar byed pa skyes pa'i dus na 'du byed ma skyes pas na /
translated: and that which is called going causes the compounded phenomena to go, then at the time when that which is called going arises, the compounded phenomena have not yet arisen.

original: 'du byed med pa la 'gro bar byed pas yul gzhan du spor med de /
analyzed: 'du byed med pa la 'gro bar byed pas yul gzhan du spor med de /
translated: Since there are no compounded phenomena, that which is called going would not cause them to go to another place.

original: lha sbyin skyes pas bu ma skyes pa gsor med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lha sbyin skyes pas bu ma skyes pa gsor med pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the son of a barren woman, who has not arisen, not being nursed by Devadatta, who has arisen.

original: gal te 'du byed sngar skyes la 'gro bar byed pa phyis skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spod par byed ces byar yang 'du byed skyes pas na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed sngar skyes la 'gro bar byed pa phyis skyes pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spod par byed ces byar yang 'du byed skyes pas na /
translated: If the compounded phenomena arise prior to that which is called going, and that which is called going causes the compounded phenomena to go to another place, then at the time when that which is called going arises, the compounded phenomena have already arisen.

original: 'gro bar byed pa da dung ma skyes te med pas 'gro bar byed pa med pa des /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa da dung ma skyes te med pas 'gro bar byed pa med pa des /
translated: Since the one who makes one go has not yet arisen, it does not exist.🔽

original: 'du byed @153b yul gzhan du spod mi nus te /
analyzed: 'du byed @153b yul gzhan du spod mi nus te /
translated: Since the goer has not yet arisen, it does not exist. Therefore, the goer who does not yet exist is not able to cause the movement of the compounded phenomenon to another place.

original: dper na rta da dung ma skyes pas mi yul gzhan du bskyal bar mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta da dung ma skyes pas mi yul gzhan du bskyal bar mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, since a horse has not yet arisen, it is not able to carry a person to another place.

original: 'du byed dang 'gro bar byed pa gnyis mgo mnyam du skyes pas kyang /
analyzed: 'du byed dang 'gro bar byed pa gnyis mgo mnyam du skyes pas kyang /
translated: Even if the compounded phenomenon and the goer were to arise simultaneously,

original: 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spod bar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas 'du byed yul gzhan du spod bar mi nus te /
translated: the goer would not be able to cause the movement of the compounded phenomenon to another place.🔽For example, it is like the right and left horns of an ox that arise simultaneously, and neither horn is able to cause the other to arise.

original: dper na glang gi rva g-yas g-yon gnyis mgo mnyam du skyes pa gang gis kyang gang skyed pa'i rgyu ma byas pa dang 'dra bar 'du byed pa dang / 'gro bar byed pa gnyi ga mgo mnyam du yul gzhan du phyin na /🔽'gro bar byed pa gnyi ga 'du byed cung zad kyang yul gzhan du spos pa med do //
analyzed: dper na glang gi rva g-yas g-yon gnyis mgo mnyam du skyes pa gang gis kyang gang skyed pa'i rgyu ma byas pa dang 'dra bar 'du byed pa dang / 'gro bar byed pa gnyi ga mgo mnyam du yul gzhan du phyin na / 'gro bar byed pa gnyi ga 'du byed cung zad kyang yul gzhan du spos pa med do //
translated: If the compounded phenomenon and the goer were to go to another place simultaneously,🔽the goer would not cause the compounded phenomenon to move to another place in the slightest.

original: byed pa ni yul de dang gzhan du gnas pa'i 'du byed las kun la yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed pa ni yul de dang gzhan du gnas pa'i 'du byed las kun la yang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The goer is not observed in any compounded phenomenon that is located in that place or another place.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis skye zhing 'gags nas skad cig ma phyi ma la yul gzhan du phyin pa la ma gtogs par 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis skye zhing 'gags nas skad cig ma phyi ma la yul gzhan du phyin pa la ma gtogs par 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba rdzas gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other substance called “going” apart from the arising and ceasing of compounded phenomena in the moment, and their movement to another place in the next moment.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very meaning,

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du skye ba las 'gro ba gzhan med do zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du skye ba las 'gro ba gzhan med do zhes smos te /
translated: it says, “Therefore, apart from the arising of compounded phenomena in another place, there is no other going.”

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan du 'phos pa ma gtogs pa'i 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis rgyun mi 'chad par yul gzhan du 'phos pa ma gtogs pa'i 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas gzhan ni gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As explained above, the meaning is that apart from the arising of compounded phenomena in another place in the moment, there is no other substance called “going.”

original: tshig de dag gi mju  bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig de dag gi mju  bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize those words,

original: de med pa'i phyir skad cig mar grub po zhes smos te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir skad cig mar grub po zhes smos te /
translated: it says, “Because that does not exist, momentariness is established.”

original: de ltar 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa'i 'gro bar byed pa gzhan gang yang med pas na /
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa'i 'gro bar byed pa gzhan gang yang med pas na /
translated: Thus, since there is no other agent that causes formations to go to another place,

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig mar grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig mar grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: formations are established as momentary.

original: yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye pa'i mtshan nyid 'gro ba la ni rgyu mang po rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yul gzhan du bar chad med par skye pa'i mtshan nyid 'gro ba la ni rgyu mang po rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause of going, which is the characteristic of the arising of formations in another place without interruption, should be understood as manifold.

original: skad cig ma snga ma 'jig phyi ma skyes pa'i tshul du 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa la /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma 'jig phyi ma skyes pa'i tshul du 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa la /
translated: The cause of going is manifold because formations go to another place in the manner of the disintegration of the previous moment and the arising of the subsequent moment.

original: rgyu mang pos yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu mang pos yul gzhan du phyin par byed pa yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there are many causes for formations to go to another place.

original: sems kyi dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is also going by the power of mind.

original: sems kyi rgyu byas nas 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa la yod de /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu byas nas 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa la yod de /
translated: The meaning is that there is going to another place by formations after the mind acts as the cause.

original: dper na 'chags pa bsams pa'i sems kyi dbang gis lus la sogs pa'i skad cig @154a * //
analyzed: dper na 'chags pa bsams pa'i sems kyi dbang gis lus la sogs pa'i skad cig @154a * //
translated: For example, by the power of the mind that thinks to move, the body and so on goes to another place.

original: ma'i rgyun gyis gom pa bor nas yul gzhan du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i rgyun gyis gom pa bor nas yul gzhan du phyin pa'o //
translated: The mother’s stream of consciousness goes to another place by taking steps.

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is going by the impetus of a prior action.

original: sngon gyi las kyi rgyu'i shugs kyis 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa yod de /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rgyu'i shugs kyis 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa yod de /
translated: The impetus of a prior action is a cause for the going of the stream of consciousness to another place.

original: dper na srid pa bar mdo'i sems can lta bu sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis ma'i mngal du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: dper na srid pa bar mdo'i sems can lta bu sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis ma'i mngal du 'pho ba'o //
translated: For example, a sentient being in the intermediate state of existence goes to the mother’s womb by the power of a prior action.

original: 'phen pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is going by the impetus of a prior action that projects.🔽The impetus of a prior action is a cause for the going of the stream of consciousness to another place.🔽For example, a sentient being in the intermediate state of existence goes to the mother’s womb by the power of a prior action.🔽There is going by the impetus of a prior action that projects.

original: 'phen pas rgyu byas nas 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'phen pas rgyu byas nas 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa yang yod de /
translated: The impetus of a prior action is a cause for the going of the stream of consciousness to another place.🔽For example, an arrow goes to another place by the power of the person who shoots it.

original: dper na mda' 'phen pa'i mi'i dbang gis mda' yul gzhan du phyin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mda' 'phen pa'i mi'i dbang gis mda' yul gzhan du phyin pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is going by the impetus of a prior action that projects.🔽The impetus of a prior action is a cause for the going of the stream of consciousness to another place.🔽For example, an arrow goes to another place by the power of the person who shoots it.

original: 'brel ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is going by the impetus of a prior action that projects.

original: kha cig 'brel pa'i dbang gis rgyu byas nas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kha cig 'brel pa'i dbang gis rgyu byas nas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin pa yang yod de /
translated: The impetus of a prior action is a cause for the going of the stream of consciousness to another place.🔽For example, an arrow goes to another place by the power of the person who shoots it.

original: dper na rta la mi zhon te rta dang mir 'brel pa yul gzhan du phyin na mi'ang yul gzhan du phyin pa dang / chu dang gzings su 'brel pas chu gang du phyin par gzings kyis kyang phyin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rta la mi zhon te rta dang mir 'brel pa yul gzhan du phyin na mi'ang yul gzhan du phyin pa dang / chu dang gzings su 'brel pas chu gang du phyin par gzings kyis kyang phyin pa lta bu'o //
translated: And if a boat and water are connected, the boat goes wherever the water goes.

original: bskyod pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bskyod pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is also going by the power of being moved.

original: bskyod pas rgyu byas nas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: bskyod pas rgyu byas nas 'du byed yul gzhan du phyin pa'ang yod de /
translated: After being moved, a compounded phenomenon goes to another place.

original: dper na rlung gis bskyod nas rlung gi dbang gis rtsva dang 'dab ma la sogs pa yul gzhan du phyin pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: dper na rlung gis bskyod nas rlung gi dbang gis rtsva dang 'dab ma la sogs pa yul gzhan du phyin pa lta bu'o ;
translated: For example, after being moved by the wind, grass, leaves, and so on go to another place by the power of the wind.

original: / rang bzhin gyi dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rang bzhin gyi dbang gis 'gro ba yang yod zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is also going by the power of nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis rgyu byas nas 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rgyu byas nas 'du byed rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa'ang yod de /
translated: After being moved by nature, compounded phenomena go to another place.

original: dper na rlung thad kar 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin pas 'di langs pa'i rlung yul gzhan du phyin par snang ba dang / me gyen du 'bar ba'i rang bzhin yin pas nam mkha'i phyogs mthon po dag tu me lce 'bar bas phyin par snang ba dang /
analyzed: dper na rlung thad kar 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yin pas 'di langs pa'i rlung yul gzhan du phyin par snang ba dang / me gyen du 'bar ba'i rang bzhin yin pas nam mkha'i phyogs mthon po dag tu me lce 'bar bas phyin par snang ba dang /
translated: For example, since the nature of wind is to move horizontally, it appears to move from one place to another.🔽Since the nature of fire is to blaze upward, it appears to move to high places by means of the flames.

original: chu thur du 'bab pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gshong la sogs pa thur du bab nas yul gzhan du phyin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu thur du 'bab pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gshong la sogs pa thur du bab nas yul gzhan du phyin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since the nature of water is to flow downward, it appears to move to other places by flowing downward into valleys and so on.

original: mthus 'gro ba yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthus 'gro ba yang yod do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some say: It is also said that they move by power.

original: 'du byed kha cig ni mthus rgyu byas nas yul gzhan du phyin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: 'du byed kha cig ni mthus rgyu byas nas yul gzhan du phyin pa yang yod de /
translated: Some compositional factors move by the power of karma.

original: dper na sngags pa dag sngags kyi mthus yul gcig nas gcig tu phyin par byed pa dang / sman 'thungs pa'am /
analyzed: dper na sngags pa dag sngags kyi mthus yul gcig nas gcig tu phyin par byed pa dang / sman 'thungs pa'am /
translated: For example, through the power of mantra, mantra practitioners move from one place to another, or they drink medicine🔽and

original: lus la bskus pa'i mthus sems can rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa dang / rdo khab len @154b gyi mthus lcags 'gul zhing gyen du 'byung ba dang thad kar 'gro bar byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul thob pa'i sems can dag la rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus yul gzhan nas gzhan du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: lus la bskus pa'i mthus sems can rnams yul gzhan du phyin pa dang / rdo khab len @154b gyi mthus lcags 'gul zhing gyen du 'byung ba dang thad kar 'gro bar byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul thob pa'i sems can dag la rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus yul gzhan nas gzhan du phyin pa'o //
translated: By the power of supernatural knowledge, sentient beings who have attained supernatural knowledge go from one place to another by the power of supernatural knowledge.

original: sa bon can dang / sa bon med pa'i dngos po skyes bas skad cig mar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon can dang / sa bon med pa'i dngos po skyes bas skad cig mar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should understand that things that have seeds and things that do not have seeds are momentary because they arise.

original: sngon nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa'i mthus phyis nyon mongs pa med pa'i dngos por skyes te /
analyzed: sngon nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pa'i mthus phyis nyon mongs pa med pa'i dngos por skyes te /
translated: Previously, while possessing the seeds of afflictions, later, by the power of cultivating the noble path, one arises as a thing without afflictions.

original: de bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that they are momentary.

original: tshad ma gang gis de skad cig mar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma gang gis de skad cig mar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: By what valid cognition is it understood that they are momentary?

original: de'i phyir gnas pa la mi rung ba dang ; tha mal mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa la mi rung ba dang ; tha mal mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that because abiding is impossible and the ordinary is impossible.

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma ma yin te /
translated: Things are not momentary.

original: rtag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la ni sngon sa bon can las phyis sa bon med par 'gyur bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la ni sngon sa bon can las phyis sa bon med par 'gyur bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible that what endures with the nature of permanence would be without seed later on, having previously had a seed.

original: rtag tu sa bon dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu sa bon dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would always have a seed.

original: de ltar rtag par sa bon dang bcas par gyur na ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'i phung po lta bu phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas sa bon med pa'i rang bzhin dang / phung po lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa'i phung po tha ma zhes bya ba yang yod mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtag par sa bon dang bcas par gyur na ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'i phung po lta bu phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas sa bon med pa'i rang bzhin dang / phung po lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa'i phung po tha ma zhes bya ba yang yod mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were always to have a seed, then the so-called final aggregates would not be possible, that is, the aggregates that enter into nirvana, the realm that is the abandonment of all the remaining aggregates, which has the nature of being without seed, like the aggregates of an arhat.

original: don de nyid zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that point in detail, it says,

original: sa bon dang sa bon med pa'i dngos por skye ba skad cig ma ni gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir te zhes smos te /
analyzed: sa bon dang sa bon med pa'i dngos por skye ba skad cig ma ni gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir te zhes smos te /
translated: “Because it is not possible for a momentary thing that arises with a seed or without a seed to endure.”

original: sngar sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las de 'gags nas phyis kyang nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems gzhan du 'byung ba dang / sngar sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las skad cig ma de 'gags nas phyis sa bon med pa'i dngos po skad cig ma skye ba yang skad cig ma ma yin pa rtag par gnas pa'i dngos po la ni de lta bu 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngar sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las de 'gags nas phyis kyang nyon mongs pa'i sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems gzhan du 'byung ba dang / sngar sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las skad cig ma de 'gags nas phyis sa bon med pa'i dngos po skad cig ma skye ba yang skad cig ma ma yin pa rtag par gnas pa'i dngos po la ni de lta bu 'byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: But such a thing is not tenable for a thing that is not momentary and that endures permanently.

original: de la rtag pa'i dngos po la ni sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems snga ma la 'gags nas /
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i dngos po la ni sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems snga ma la 'gags nas /
translated: In this regard, it is illogical for the previous mind that possesses a seed to cease,

original: sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems phyi ma skyes ba mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas pa'i sems phyi ma skyes ba mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and for the subsequent mind that possesses a seed to arise.

original: skad cig ma re re la rgyu 'gyur ba med par de bzhin du gnas pa la ni dus gzhan gyi tshe sa bon gyi dngos por mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la rgyu 'gyur ba med par de bzhin du gnas pa la ni dus gzhan gyi tshe sa bon gyi dngos por mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said, “It is illogical for a thing that endures without changing in the least to possess a seed at another time.”

original: 'di ltar sa bon dang @155a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon dang @155a * //
translated: In this way,

original: bcas pa las sa bon dang bcas par 'byung ba yang /
analyzed: bcas pa las sa bon dang bcas par 'byung ba yang /
translated: The second is that which arises with a seed.

original: sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma 'gags pas rgyu byas nas sa bon dang bcas pa skad cig ma phyi ma skye ba yin na /🔽rtag pa'i dngos po de bzhin du mi 'gyur bar gnas pa rnams la ni skad cig ma snga ma snga ma ni rgyu /
analyzed: sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma 'gags pas rgyu byas nas sa bon dang bcas pa skad cig ma phyi ma skye ba yin na / rtag pa'i dngos po de bzhin du mi 'gyur bar gnas pa rnams la ni skad cig ma snga ma snga ma ni rgyu /
translated: If the previous moment that has a seed ceases and acts as the cause, then the subsequent moment that has a seed arises.

original: phyi ma phyi ma ni 'bras bu lta bur 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma ni 'bras bu lta bur 'byung ba med de /
translated: But in the case of permanent things that remain without changing, the previous moment is not a cause and the subsequent moment is not an effect.

original: de ltar ma byung na sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma 'gags nas phyi ma sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma byung na sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma snga ma 'gags nas phyi ma sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma gzhan skyes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: If that were not so, then the previous moment that has a seed would cease and it would not be tenable that a subsequent different moment that has a seed arises.

original: rtag tu yang rang bzhin gcig pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yang rang bzhin gcig pa 'ba' zhig tu gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would always remain as just a single nature.

original: de yang dper na sa bon las myu gu skye ba sngar sa bon 'gags nas phyis gdong myu gu skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang dper na sa bon las myu gu skye ba sngar sa bon 'gags nas phyis gdong myu gu skye ba yin gyi /
translated: For example, a sprout arises from a seed. The seed ceases earlier and the sprout arises later.

original: sa bon ma 'gags pa ni nam yang myu gu mi skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon ma 'gags pa ni nam yang myu gu mi skye ba bzhin no //
translated: It is just like a seed that is not ceased, never producing a sprout.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po rnams la sngar sa bon yod par gnas pa las phyis sa bon med pa'i dngos por 'gyur bar mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po rnams la sngar sa bon yod par gnas pa las phyis sa bon med pa'i dngos por 'gyur bar mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is impossible for permanent things to exist as seeds earlier and then later become things that are not seeds,

original: skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa yang mi rung ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa yang mi rung ste zhes smos te /
translated: it is said, “It is also illogical for the final moment to be without a seed.”

original: gal te ngos po rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ngos po rtag pa yin te /
translated: If a thing is permanent,

original: mi 'jigs par rtag tu de gzhan du gnas na ni sngar sa bon dang bcas pa las dag bcom pa thob pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs par rtag tu de gzhan du gnas na ni sngar sa bon dang bcas pa las dag bcom pa thob pa'i dus kyi skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur bar mi rung ste /
translated: if it is always and without fear that it remains as it is, then it is illogical for it to be the case that the final moment of the one who has attained the state of an arhat is not a thing that is without a seed, that is, a thing that is without a seed.

original: rtag pa'i la ni sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: rtag pa'i la ni sa bon dang bcas pa dang sa bon med pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: For a permanent thing, it is impossible for there to be a twofold nature, one that is endowed with a seed and one that is not endowed with a seed.

original: rtag pa la sngar sa bon dang bcas pa las phyis sa bon med pa'i mtshan nyid du ci'i phyir 'gyur mi srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa la sngar sa bon dang bcas pa las phyis sa bon med pa'i mtshan nyid du ci'i phyir 'gyur mi srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is impossible for a permanent thing to be endowed with a seed earlier and then later become one that is not endowed with a seed,🔽it is said,

original: sngon sa bon dang bcas pa las skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med par khas blangs du mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: sngon sa bon dang bcas pa las skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med par khas blangs du mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: It is not suitable to accept that the final moment lacks a seed, since it previously possessed a seed.

original: sa bon ni sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma 'gags nas skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa'i skad cig ma skye ba yin na /
analyzed: sa bon ni sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma 'gags nas skad cig ma tha ma la sa bon med pa'i skad cig ma skye ba yin na /
translated: If the final moment arises without a seed, then the moment that possesses a seed would cease and the final moment would arise without a seed.

original: rtag pa la ni sngar sa bon nas phyi ma gzhan skye ba med pas so so'i skye bo'i dus na ni sems dang sems las byung ba sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni sngar sa bon nas phyi ma gzhan skye ba med pas so so'i skye bo'i dus na ni sems dang sems las byung ba sa bon dang bcas par gnas pa las /
translated: Since the permanent does not arise from a previous seed, it is not suitable to accept that at the time of ordinary beings, mind and mental factors exist with seeds,

original: tha ma dgra bcom pa'i phung po'i dus na ni sa bon med par 'gyur ro zhes khas blang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: tha ma dgra bcom pa'i phung po'i dus na ni sa bon med par 'gyur ro zhes khas blang bar mi nus so //
translated: but at the time of the final aggregates of an arhat, they exist without seeds.

original: de med na tha ma yang mi srid de 'di ltar tha ma nyid kyang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba @155b la ;
analyzed: de med na tha ma yang mi srid de 'di ltar tha ma nyid kyang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba @155b la ;
translated: If that is not so, then the final moment is impossible, because in that case, the final moment itself does not occur.

original: gal te sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma ni 'gags /
analyzed: gal te sa bon dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma ni 'gags /
translated: If the moment that possesses a seed ceases,

original: phyis sa bon med pa'i skad cig ma skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis sa bon med pa'i skad cig ma skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: then a moment without a seed does not arise later.

original: dus thams cad du rtag par gnas na ni /
analyzed: dus thams cad du rtag par gnas na ni /
translated: If it were to endure forever,

original: rtag tu yang sa bon dang bcas pa'i dngos por gnas kyi sa bon med par 'gyur bar ni phyis kyang med par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rtag tu yang sa bon dang bcas pa'i dngos por gnas kyi sa bon med par 'gyur bar ni phyis kyang med par 'gyur te ;
translated: it would always endure as a thing possessing a seed, and it would never be without a seed.

original: sa bon med pa'i dngos po phyis med par gyur pas na /
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i dngos po phyis med par gyur pas na /
translated: Since a thing without a seed would not exist later,

original: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma zhes bya ba yang yod mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma zhes bya ba yang yod mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be impossible for there to be what is called “the final aggregates of an arhat.”

original: de ltar phung po tha ma mi srid par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar phung po tha ma mi srid par gyur na /
translated: If the final aggregates were impossible,🔽then it would be impossible for the final aggregates of an arhat to arise.

original: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yang mi 'byung bar gyur pas dgra bcom pa la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i phung po tha ma 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yang mi 'byung bar gyur pas dgra bcom pa la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, arhats and so on would not exist.

original: gzugs brnyan skye ba la skad cig ma ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba las rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan skye ba la skad cig ma ni sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba las rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The arising of a reflection should be understood to be momentary because it follows the mind.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad bsgom pa dag sems las thams cad sngon por snang ba dang / thams cad ser por snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yang sems kyi dbang gis 'byung bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad bsgom pa dag sems las thams cad sngon por snang ba dang / thams cad ser por snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yang sems kyi dbang gis 'byung bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: The arising of images such as the appearance of everything as blue or the appearance of everything as yellow, etc. due to the cultivation of the eight liberations also arises by the power of mind, and therefore, they should be understood as momentary.

original: de de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate that, he says:

original: skad cig ma re re la yang sems kyi dbang gis de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la yang sems kyi dbang gis de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they arise by the power of mind in each moment.

original: skad cig ma re re la ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa gzugs brnyan snang ba yang rnal 'byor pa'i sems kyis ji ltar bsams pa de lta de ltar snang ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la ser po dang sngon po la sogs pa gzugs brnyan snang ba yang rnal 'byor pa'i sems kyis ji ltar bsams pa de lta de ltar snang ste /
translated: The appearance of images such as yellow and blue, etc. in each moment also appears in accordance with how the yogi’s mind conceives of them.

original: sems kyi dbang gis snang la sems kyang skad cig ma yin pas na sems las skyes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan yang skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis snang la sems kyang skad cig ma yin pas na sems las skyes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan yang skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
translated: Since they appear by the power of mind and mind is momentary, the images of blue, etc. that arise from mind should be understood as momentary.

original: rgyu skad cig ma yin pa las 'bras bu skad cig ma yin par 'byung ba mi srid pa ni gong du sun phyung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu skad cig ma yin pa las 'bras bu skad cig ma yin par 'byung ba mi srid pa ni gong du sun phyung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is impossible for a momentary cause to give rise to a momentary effect, as has been refuted above.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa lngas nang gi 'du byed rnams skad cig mar bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa lngas nang gi 'du byed rnams skad cig mar bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having thus established the momentariness of internal formations through five verses,

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum zhig phyi'i 'du byed rnams skad cig mar bsgrub bo //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gsum zhig phyi'i 'du byed rnams skad cig mar bsgrub bo //
translated: now, through three verses, he establishes the momentariness of external formations.

original: 'byung ba rnams dang don drug la //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams dang don drug la //
translated: The elements and the six objects

original: skad cig mar ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: skad cig mar ni brjod par bya //
translated: are to be expressed as momentary.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: phyi'i 'du byed 'di dag ste /
analyzed: phyi'i 'du byed 'di dag ste /
translated: these external formations

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ste /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung ste /
translated: are the great elements: earth, water, fire, and wind,

original: 'byung ba chen po dang / kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg dang sgra dang chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs so //🔽de la chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs ni rnam @156a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dang / kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg dang sgra dang chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs so // de la chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs ni rnam @156a * //
translated: and the forms of the color, smell, taste, touch, sound, and the form of the phenomena base.

original: bar rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: bar rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Among them, the form of the phenomena base is imperceptible form.

original: de rnams skad cig mar brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams skad cig mar brjod do //
translated: Those are expressed as momentary.

original: skam dang skye dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skam dang skye dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Drying, arising, and so on.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las chu'i khams ni skam pa dang / skye ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las chu'i khams ni skam pa dang / skye ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
translated: The water element is said to be momentary because of the reasons of drying up and generation.

original: rang bzhin gyis /🔽g-yo zhing skye pa 'bri ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis / g-yo zhing skye pa 'bri ba'i phyir //
translated: By nature

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽rlung gi khams ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang skye zhing 'bri ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rlung gi khams ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang skye zhing 'bri ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
translated: because of the shaking and the decrease of generation.🔽Here, the wind element is said to be momentary because of the reasons of shaking by nature and the decrease of generation.

original: sa ni de las 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sa'i khams ni chu dang rlung las 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis skad cig mar brjod do ;
analyzed: sa ni de las 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la sa'i khams ni chu dang rlung las 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis skad cig mar brjod do ;
translated: Earth is said to be momentary because of the reason of its origination from water and wind.

original: / kha dog dang dri ro reg pa yang mtshungs pas de yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /🔽don drug las kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: / kha dog dang dri ro reg pa yang mtshungs pas de yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba la / don drug las kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa bzhi ni /
translated: Color, smell, taste, and tactility are also momentary for the same reason.

original: chu dang sa dang rlung la brten te /
analyzed: chu dang sa dang rlung la brten te /
translated: From among the six objects, the four—color, smell, taste, and tactility—are based on water, earth, and wind.

original: de dag dang rang bzhin gcig pas na sa dang chu dang rlung gi skabs skam pa dang skye ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
analyzed: de dag dang rang bzhin gcig pas na sa dang chu dang rlung gi skabs skam pa dang skye ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs nyid kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
translated: Since they are of the same nature as those, they are said to be momentary by the reason of drying up, growing, etc., in the case of earth, water, and wind.

original: 'byung ba shing la rag lus shing //
analyzed: 'byung ba shing la rag lus shing //
translated: The arising of fire depends on fuel.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: me'i khams skad cig mar 'byung ba yang shing la rag lus pa'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
analyzed: me'i khams skad cig mar 'byung ba yang shing la rag lus pa'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
translated: the arising of the fire element in a moment is said to be momentary by the reason that it depends on fuel.

original: je che je cher dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: je che je cher dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of being observed as increasing.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: sgra ni je che je cher dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
analyzed: sgra ni je che je cher dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do //
translated: sound is said to be momentary by the reason of being observed as increasing.

original: sems kyi rjes 'brang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'brang zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which follows the mind.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, the form of the form aggregate that is not form of the form aggregate, which is the imperceptible form of the form base, should be known to be momentary by the reason of following the mind.

original: 'dra ba la ;
analyzed: 'dra ba la ;
translated: In the case of the similar.

original: phyi rol rnams kyang skad cig ma //
analyzed: phyi rol rnams kyang skad cig ma //
translated: The external are also momentary.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: skad cig mar mi 'dod pa rnams la 'dri ba'i gtan tshigs kyis 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / don drug po thams cad skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig mar mi 'dod pa rnams la 'dri ba'i gtan tshigs kyis 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / don drug po thams cad skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who do not accept that things are momentary should be questioned with this argument, and they will understand that the four great elements and all six sense objects are momentary.🔽How is it said?

original: ji ltar brjod ce na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / don drug po rnams gtan tshigs dang tshad ma gang gi skad cig mar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod ce na zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / don drug po rnams gtan tshigs dang tshad ma gang gi skad cig mar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means, by what reason and valid knowledge is it said that the four great elements and the six sense objects are momentary?

original: chu ni skam zhing skye ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chu ni skam zhing skye ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Water dries up and grows.

original: chu'i khams ni skam pa dang skye ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni skam pa dang skye ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the water element is said to be momentary by the reason of drying up and growing.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽lteng ka dang / @156b mtsho dang rdzing bu la sogs pa'i chu bags kyis skye ba dang skam par dmigs te zhes smos te /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / lteng ka dang / @156b mtsho dang rdzing bu la sogs pa'i chu bags kyis skye ba dang skam par dmigs te zhes smos te /
translated: In order to teach that very meaning,🔽it is said that water in ponds, lakes, pools, and so on is observed to gradually grow and dry up.

original: lteng ka dang mtsho la sogs pa dbyar lta bu char chu che ba'i dus na ni char zhag du ma'i snga rol nas bab la /
analyzed: lteng ka dang mtsho la sogs pa dbyar lta bu char chu che ba'i dus na ni char zhag du ma'i snga rol nas bab la /
translated: Ponds, lakes, and so on, during the rainy season and so on, are filled long before the rains.

original: chu nyid gcig gis lhug ces chen por snang bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chu nyid gcig gis lhug ces chen por snang bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Water itself does not appear to be expanding.

original: skad cig ma re re khad kyis je che je cher snang ba dang / dgun dpyid la sogs pa char chung zhing nyi ma tsha ba la sogs pa'i dus na yang nyin gcig tu lhug ces mi skam gyi skad cig ma re re khad kyis je chung je chung ngu skam zhing 'bri bas na chu skad cig ma yin par mngon no
analyzed: skad cig ma re re khad kyis je che je cher snang ba dang / dgun dpyid la sogs pa char chung zhing nyi ma tsha ba la sogs pa'i dus na yang nyin gcig tu lhug ces mi skam gyi skad cig ma re re khad kyis je chung je chung ngu skam zhing 'bri bas na chu skad cig ma yin par mngon no
translated: It appears to expand little by little in each instant, and it does not dry up in a single day during the winter, spring, and so on, when there is little rain and the sun is hot, but it dries up and diminishes little by little in each instant. Therefore it is evident that water is momentary.

original: // skad cig ma re re ma 'byung ba med na phyis bye brag tu 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te gnyi ga yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // skad cig ma re re ma 'byung ba med na phyis bye brag tu 'gyur ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir te gnyi ga yang mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were not the case that each instant does not arise without a cause, then later it would not be the case that it changes into something different.

original: gal te chu 'di rtag pa zhig ste /
analyzed: gal te chu 'di rtag pa zhig ste /
translated: If this water were permanent,

original: skad cig ma re re la snga ma ni 'gags nas phyi ma ni je che je cher 'gyur ba med pa dang / 'bri ba'i dus na yang khad kyis je chung je chung ngu 'gyur ba med na ni dus gcig tu cher snang ba'i rgyu yang med la /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la snga ma ni 'gags nas phyi ma ni je che je cher 'gyur ba med pa dang / 'bri ba'i dus na yang khad kyis je chung je chung ngu 'gyur ba med na ni dus gcig tu cher snang ba'i rgyu yang med la /
translated: If it is not the case that the former is ceased in each moment and the latter is increased more and more, and also if it is not the case that at the time of decrease it is decreased more and more gradually, then there is no cause for its appearing large at one time.

original: dus gcig tu chung ngu snang ba'i rgyu yang med pas rtag pa zhig na ni yang na rtag par chen po 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus gcig tu chung ngu snang ba'i rgyu yang med pas rtag pa zhig na ni yang na rtag par chen po 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur //
translated: And there is no cause for its appearing small at one time. If it is permanent, then either it would always appear as only large,

original: yang na rtag par chung ngu 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: yang na rtag par chung ngu 'ba' zhig tu snang bar 'gyur gyi //
translated: or it would always appear as only small.

original: par 'ga' je cher snang pa dang par 'ga' je chung ngu snang ba gnyis 'byung du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: par 'ga' je cher snang pa dang par 'ga' je chung ngu snang ba gnyis 'byung du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable for both the appearance of its increasing and the appearance of its decreasing to occur.

original: rlung yang rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang skye ba dang 'bri ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rlung yang rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang skye ba dang 'bri ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, because wind moves, arises, and decreases by nature.

original: rlung yang skad cig mar brjod pa ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i gtan tshigs dang / skye ba'i gtan tshigs dang / 'bri ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rlung yang skad cig mar brjod pa ni rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba'i gtan tshigs dang / skye ba'i gtan tshigs dang / 'bri ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement that “wind is momentary” is meant to show that it is momentary by the reason of its inherent motion, by the reason of its arising, and by the reason of its diminishing.

original: de nyid kyi don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of that, he says:

original: gnas pa la ni g-yo ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa la ni g-yo ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: Motion would not exist for something enduring.

original: 'gro ba med pa de ni bsgrubs zin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa de ni bsgrubs zin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: That it does not exist has already been established.

original: skad cig ma ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not momentary,

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i dngos po la ni gnas gcig nas gcig tu phyin par byed pa'i rang bzhin med de //
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa'i dngos po la ni gnas gcig nas gcig tu phyin par byed pa'i rang bzhin med de //
translated: but rather, for an entity that endures with the characteristic of permanence, there is no nature of going from one location to another.

original: rtag pa la 'gro ba med par ni sngar bsgrubs zin te /
analyzed: rtag pa la 'gro ba med par ni sngar bsgrubs zin te /
translated: That permanence does not go has already been established earlier.

original: ji ltar bsgrubs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrubs she na /
translated: How was it established?

original: dngos po rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis yul gzhan du phyin pa la ma gtogs par dngos po yul gcig nas @157a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams skad cig ma'i ngang gis yul gzhan du phyin pa la ma gtogs par dngos po yul gcig nas @157a * //
translated: Apart from entities going to another place by means of being momentary, there is no other nature of going for entities that endure for a long time.

original: gcig tu phyin par byed pa ni gang yang med do zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: gcig tu phyin par byed pa ni gang yang med do zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has been established that there is no such thing as a single entity that moves.

original: rlung ni de lta ma yin gyi //
analyzed: rlung ni de lta ma yin gyi //
translated: But the wind is not like that.

original: shar gyi phyogs la sogs pa nas langs nas nub la sogs pa'i phyogs su phyin par 'gro bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shar gyi phyogs la sogs pa nas langs nas nub la sogs pa'i phyogs su phyin par 'gro bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: It arises from the east and other directions and moves to the west and other directions, so it should be understood as momentary.

original: de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'bri ba med do zhes bya ba la /🔽rtag pa'i dngos po ni dus thams cad du yang skye ba dang 'bri ba med par gnas pa'i phyir bar 'ga' skye //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'bri ba med do zhes bya ba la / rtag pa'i dngos po ni dus thams cad du yang skye ba dang 'bri ba med par gnas pa'i phyir bar 'ga' skye //
translated: And it does not increase or decrease because it remains the same.

original: bar 'ga' 'bri bar mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bar 'ga' 'bri bar mi 'gyur //
translated: A permanent entity would not increase or decrease at any time, so it would never increase or decrease.

original: de lta na ni ma yin gyi rlung 'di dang po chung ngur langs pas las phyis je che je cher ldang ba dang / dang por chen por langs pa las phyis je chung je chung ngu 'gyur bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma yin gyi rlung 'di dang po chung ngur langs pas las phyis je che je cher ldang ba dang / dang por chen por langs pa las phyis je chung je chung ngu 'gyur bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: But that is not the case, for this wind, having arisen at first as a small wind, later arises as a larger and larger wind, and having arisen at first as a large wind, later becomes smaller and smaller, so it should be understood as momentary.

original: sa ni de las skyes pa dang / 'gyur ba bzhi'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa ni de las skyes pa dang / 'gyur ba bzhi'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Earth is understood as momentary because it arises and changes in four ways.

original: sa skad cig mar brjod pa yang de las skyes pa'i gtan tshigs dang / 'gyur ba bzhi'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa skad cig mar brjod pa yang de las skyes pa'i gtan tshigs dang / 'gyur ba bzhi'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement that earth is momentary is also made by the reason of arising from that and by the reason of the four changes.

original: de las skyes zhes bya ba'i sgra gang la bya bar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de las skyes zhes bya ba'i sgra gang la bya bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the term arising from that,🔽it is said:

original: de zhes bya ba ni chu dang rlung gnyis la bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chu dang rlung gnyis la bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: That refers to water and wind.

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra chu dang rlung gnyis la bya ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra chu dang rlung gnyis la bya ste /
translated: The term that refers to water and wind.

original: chu dang rlung gnyis las sa skyes pas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: chu dang rlung gnyis las sa skyes pas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o ;
translated: Since earth arises from water and wind, it should be understood to be momentary.

original: / chu dang rlung gnyis las ji ltar sa skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: / chu dang rlung gnyis las ji ltar sa skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate how earth arises from water and wind,🔽it is said:

original: chags pa ni chu dang rlung du bcas pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: chags pa ni chu dang rlung du bcas pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Attachment arises from water and wind.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be their result.

original: dang po 'jig rten chags pa na thog ma nyid du las kyi dbang gis nam mkha' la rlung gi khams chags so ;
analyzed: dang po 'jig rten chags pa na thog ma nyid du las kyi dbang gis nam mkha' la rlung gi khams chags so ;
translated: When the world first forms, by the power of karma, the wind element forms in space.

original: / de nas 'khor lo'i rgyun tsam gyi char bab nas chu'i khams chags so //
analyzed: / de nas 'khor lo'i rgyun tsam gyi char bab nas chu'i khams chags so //
translated: Then, a rain falls, the size of chariot wheels, and the water element is formed.

original: de nas rlung gis chu bskyod pas chu'i dbu ba las ri rab dang / gling bzhi la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rlung gis chu bskyod pas chu'i dbu ba las ri rab dang / gling bzhi la sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the wind stirs the water, and from the foam of the water, Sumeru and the four continents are formed.

original: de bas na sa ni chu dang rlung gi 'bras bu yin la //
analyzed: de bas na sa ni chu dang rlung gi 'bras bu yin la //
translated: Thus, the earth is the result of the water and wind.

original: chu dang rlung ni sa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chu dang rlung ni sa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: And the water and wind are the cause of the earth.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin pas na de'ang skad cig mar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba las //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin pas na de'ang skad cig mar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba las //
translated: Since it is the result of these, the earth should be understood as momentary.

original: chu dang rlung gi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: chu dang rlung gi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The water and wind are the result of the fire.

original: chu dang rlung gnyis ni skad cig ma yin par bsgrubs pas //
analyzed: chu dang rlung gnyis ni skad cig ma yin par bsgrubs pas //
translated: Since it has been established that the water and wind are momentary,

original: de'i 'bras bu yang skad cig ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang skad cig ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: their result should be understood as momentary.

original: rgyu skad cig ma yin pa las 'bras @157b bu skad cig ma ma yin par rtag pa 'byung bar ni mi srid pas gong du bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: rgyu skad cig ma yin pa las 'bras @157b bu skad cig ma ma yin par rtag pa 'byung bar ni mi srid pas gong du bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Since it is impossible for a permanent result not to arise from a momentary cause, this has been established above.

original: sa la 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi dmigs te zhes bya ba las 'di la sngon dang mi 'dra bar kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams pa bzhi dmigs pas na /
analyzed: sa la 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi dmigs te zhes bya ba las 'di la sngon dang mi 'dra bar kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba rnams pa bzhi dmigs pas na /
translated: Since the four kinds of change are observed in the earth, such as color, shape, etc.,

original: skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be known as momentary.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi bye brag gi phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi bye brag gi phyir //
translated: Because of the specific karma of sentient beings,

original: las kyis byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyis byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is said to be created by karma.

original: sa la las kyis byas pa'i dbang gis gzhan du 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: sa la las kyis byas pa'i dbang gis gzhan du 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: There is a change in the earth through the power of karma.

original: 'di ltar mtho ris la sogs pa'i gnas na lha rnams kyi las dge ba'i dbang gis sa gzhi shing bal bzhin du 'jam zhing mnyen pa dag 'byung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas na sems can dmyal ba las mi dge ba'i las kyi bye brag gi dbang gis sa gzhi lcags bsregs pa rab tu tsha ba dang bcas pa dang ngam grog dang tsher ma la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs🔽'byung ba dag kyang snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtho ris la sogs pa'i gnas na lha rnams kyi las dge ba'i dbang gis sa gzhi shing bal bzhin du 'jam zhing mnyen pa dag 'byung ba dang / sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas na sems can dmyal ba las mi dge ba'i las kyi bye brag gi dbang gis sa gzhi lcags bsregs pa rab tu tsha ba dang bcas pa dang ngam grog dang tsher ma la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba dag kyang snang ngo //
translated: In the lower realms, by the power of the specific nonvirtuous karma of the hell beings, the ground appears as a burning iron surface and various sufferings such as ravines and thorns appear.

original: gzhan yang sa gzhi gcig las sems can gyi rmo brko dang lag byad kyis ma phyin pa'i dus na ni lo tog la sogs pa mi 'khrungs la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa gzhi gcig las sems can gyi rmo brko dang lag byad kyis ma phyin pa'i dus na ni lo tog la sogs pa mi 'khrungs la /
translated: Moreover, when the ground is not tilled by the plow of sentient beings, crops do not grow.

original: sa de nyid las rmo brko ba la sogs pa lag byad kyis phyin pa'i dus na lo tog bzang du skye bas na skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: sa de nyid las rmo brko ba la sogs pa lag byad kyis phyin pa'i dus na lo tog bzang du skye bas na skad cig ma ste /
translated: When the ground is tilled by the plow, good crops grow.

original: 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is one type of change.

original: bsnun pa la sogs pa dag gis 'jig pa byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsnun pa la sogs pa dag gis 'jig pa byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: and by striking, etc.

original: tho ba dang / 'jor la sogs pas bsnun cing brko ba'i dbang gis kyang sa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: tho ba dang / 'jor la sogs pas bsnun cing brko ba'i dbang gis kyang sa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of striking and digging with hammers, shovels, etc., earth becomes different.

original: sngon khung dang gshong du mi gnas pa las 'jor gyis brkos pa dang / khung bu dang gshong du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon khung dang gshong du mi gnas pa las 'jor gyis brkos pa dang / khung bu dang gshong du 'gyur te /
translated: Before, it did not exist in holes and ravines, but when dug by shovels, it becomes holes and ravines.

original: 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of change.

original: me la sogs pa 'byung bas byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me la sogs pa 'byung bas byas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the power of the origination of fire, etc.

original: me la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i dbang gis kyang sa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po'i dbang gis kyang sa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of the origination of the great elements of fire, etc., earth becomes different.

original: mes bsregs na kha dog sngon po dang / dmar por 'gyur ba dang / rlung gis bdas nas ma tho ba las dma' bar 'gyur ba dang / chur bcug na gsher ba dang / zhig par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mes bsregs na kha dog sngon po dang / dmar por 'gyur ba dang / rlung gis bdas nas ma tho ba las dma' bar 'gyur ba dang / chur bcug na gsher ba dang / zhig par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When burned by fire, it becomes blue and red; when blown by wind, it becomes lower than the surface; when put in water, it becomes wet and dissolves.

original: 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: This is the third kind of change.

original: dus gzhan du 'pho ba'i phyir dus kyis byas pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dus gzhan du 'pho ba'i phyir dus kyis byas pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the passage of time, it is said that there is change by time.

original: sa'i dus kyis @158a * //
analyzed: sa'i dus kyis @158a * //
translated: The time of the earth

original: byas nas gzhan du 'gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: byas nas gzhan du 'gyur ba yod de /
translated: is the cause of the transformation of the earth into something else.🔽At a good time, it is the cause of the production of good crops, etc.

original: dus bzang po'i tshe la 'brul la sogs pa bzang du 'khrungs pa'i gzhi byed pa las dus ngan pa'i tshe na 'bru la sogs pa ngan du 'khrungs pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / dbyar gyi tshe na rtsva la sogs pa sngon po skyed par byed la /
analyzed: dus bzang po'i tshe la 'brul la sogs pa bzang du 'khrungs pa'i gzhi byed pa las dus ngan pa'i tshe na 'bru la sogs pa ngan du 'khrungs pa'i rgyu byed pa dang / dbyar gyi tshe na rtsva la sogs pa sngon po skyed par byed la /
translated: At a bad time, it is the cause of the production of bad crops, etc. In summer, it produces green grass, etc.🔽In winter, it becomes pale, frozen, etc. In some places, it was formerly a wilderness, but later it becomes a place where people live.

original: dgun gyi dus na ni skya bor 'gyur zhing 'khyags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba dang / sa phyogs kha cig na sngon dgon par gnas pa las phyis grong dang 'gro ba lang long dag na gnas par gyur pa dang / sngon grong na gnas par gyur pa las //
analyzed: dgun gyi dus na ni skya bor 'gyur zhing 'khyags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba dang / sa phyogs kha cig na sngon dgon par gnas pa las phyis grong dang 'gro ba lang long dag na gnas par gyur pa dang / sngon grong na gnas par gyur pa las //
translated: Formerly, it was a place where people lived, but later it becomes a wilderness.

original: phyis dgon par gyur ba dag snang ste 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyis dgon par gyur ba dag snang ste 'di ni 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four transformations.

original: de'ang skad cig ma re re la 'jug pa'i rgyu med na de skye bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'ang skad cig ma re re la 'jug pa'i rgyu med na de skye bar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, if there is no cause for the transformation of the earth at each moment, it would not be possible for it to be transformed.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi po de yang skad cig ma re re la skye zhing 'jig par 'gyur ba med de //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi po de yang skad cig ma re re la skye zhing 'jig par 'gyur ba med de //
translated: These four kinds of change occur in each moment, but they do not arise and cease.

original: rtag pa'i dngos po la ni gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po la ni gzhan nas gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi 'byung bar mi rung ste /
translated: For a permanent thing, the occurrence of the four kinds of change is not possible.

original: de lta na ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not so.

original: 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi dmigs pas na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi dmigs pas na /
translated: Because the four kinds of change are perceived,

original: sa yang skad cig ma yin pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa yang skad cig ma yin pa rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the earth is momentary.

original: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa rnams ni sa la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: Color, smell, taste, and tactility are like earth, etc.

original: de bzhin du skad cig mar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig mar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, they should be understood as momentary.

original: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa ste /
analyzed: kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg pa ste /
translated: Color, smell, taste, and tactility🔽are like earth, etc.

original: don rnam pa bzhi yang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang rang bzhin gcig cing rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de dag 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi skam pa dang / skye ba dang / rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: don rnam pa bzhi yang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang rang bzhin gcig cing rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de dag 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten pas 'byung ba chen po bzhi skam pa dang / skye ba dang / rang bzhin gyis g-yo ba dang /
translated: The four objects are earth, water, fire and wind, and since they are of the same nature and derivative form is based on the four great elements, the four great elements are established as momentary through the four reasons of drying up, arising, natural movement and

original: de las 'byung ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhi'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar bsgrubs te /
translated: arising from them and transformation.

original: grub na de la brten pa'i kha dog la sogs pa yang skad cig mar grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: grub na de la brten pa'i kha dog la sogs pa yang skad cig mar grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: If they are established, then it should be understood that color and so on that depend on them are also established as momentary.

original: dpe na lha sbyin gyi lus bsregs pa dang / lha sbyin la brten pa'i kha dog dang dri la sogs pa yang ma bsregs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe na lha sbyin gyi lus bsregs pa dang / lha sbyin la brten pa'i kha dog dang dri la sogs pa yang ma bsregs pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, when Devadatta's body is burned, the color, smell and so on that depend on Devadatta are not unburned.

original: bsregs pa bzhin du me skad cig mar bsgrubs na me la yod pa'i kha dog ser po dang dri la sogs pa yang skad cig mar ma bsgrubs pa ma yid kyi skad cig mar bsgrubs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsregs pa bzhin du me skad cig mar bsgrubs na me la yod pa'i kha dog ser po dang dri la sogs pa yang skad cig mar ma bsgrubs pa ma yid kyi skad cig mar bsgrubs pa nyid do //
translated: If it is established that the burning is momentary, then the color, smell, etc. which exist in the fire are also established as momentary.

original: me yang skad cig ma'i 'byung ba @158b shing la rag las pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me yang skad cig ma'i 'byung ba @158b shing la rag las pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fire is momentary because it depends on the momentary elements of the fuel.

original: me skad cig mar brjod pa yang me 'byung ba chen po shing la rag las shing 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod de //
analyzed: me skad cig mar brjod pa yang me 'byung ba chen po shing la rag las shing 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs kyis skad cig mar brjod de //
translated: The fire is said to be momentary because it depends on the fuel, the great elements, and because of the reason of the elements.

original: shing la ji ltar rag las she na /🔽shing yod na ni mi 'byung //
analyzed: shing la ji ltar rag las she na / shing yod na ni mi 'byung //
translated: How does the fire depend on the fuel?🔽If the fuel exists, the fire exists.

original: shing med na ni me mi 'byung /
analyzed: shing med na ni me mi 'byung /
translated: If the fuel does not exist, the fire does not exist.

original: shing mang du bcug na ni me cher 'bar /
analyzed: shing mang du bcug na ni me cher 'bar /
translated: If much fuel is added, the fire burns strongly.

original: shing nyung ngu bcug na ni me chung ngu 'bar bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shing nyung ngu bcug na ni me chung ngu 'bar bas na skad cig mar rig par bya'o //
translated: If little fuel is added, the fire burns weakly. Therefore, it should be understood as momentary.

original: me shing la rag las pas na rag las pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: me shing la rag las pas na rag las pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason of dependence, he says:

original: me 'byung la me dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shing de bzhin du mi gnas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me 'byung la me dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shing de bzhin du mi gnas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fire does not remain together with the wood that arose simultaneously with it.

original: kha cig me skad cig ma 'dod kyang //
analyzed: kha cig me skad cig ma 'dod kyang //
translated: Some assert that fire is momentary,

original: shing skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de sun 'byin te /
analyzed: shing skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de sun 'byin te /
translated: but they do not assert that wood is momentary.🔽The first wood that produces the fire is related to and remains together with the fire.

original: dang po shing gis me byung la me dang lhan cig tu 'brel zhing gnas pa'i shing de yang ji tsam ci tsam du mes shing bsregs te me 'das shing mi gnas te /
analyzed: dang po shing gis me byung la me dang lhan cig tu 'brel zhing gnas pa'i shing de yang ji tsam ci tsam du mes shing bsregs te me 'das shing mi gnas te /
translated: But to the extent that the fire burns the wood, the fire passes and does not remain.

original: zhigs pa de tsam du shing yang zhigs shing mi gnas te /
analyzed: zhigs pa de tsam du shing yang zhigs shing mi gnas te /
translated: To that extent, the wood also disintegrates and does not remain.

original: de bas na me dang shing lhan cig tu gnas pa yang min la /
analyzed: de bas na me dang shing lhan cig tu gnas pa yang min la /
translated: Therefore fire does not remain together with wood.

original: me bzhin du shing yang mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: me bzhin du shing yang mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: Just as with fire, wood is also impermanent.

original: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du shing ni mi rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du shing ni mi rtag pa yin la /
translated: If others think that wood is impermanent,

original: me ni rtag pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: me ni rtag pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: but fire is permanent,

original: de ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: to demonstrate that this is illogical,

original: tha mar shing med par yang gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha mar shing med par yang gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said that in the end, it is illogical for fire to remain without wood.

original: shing tshig pa'i tshe ni gnas par mi nus so zhes smos te /
analyzed: shing tshig pa'i tshe ni gnas par mi nus so zhes smos te /
translated: When the fuel is consumed, the fire cannot remain.

original: mes shing bsregs na shing zad de med par gyur pa na /
analyzed: mes shing bsregs na shing zad de med par gyur pa na /
translated: When the fire burns the fuel, the fuel is exhausted and becomes nonexistent.

original: mjug tu me yang gnas par mi nus te /
analyzed: mjug tu me yang gnas par mi nus te /
translated: In the end, the fire cannot remain.

original: shing tsheg ste zad pa dang / me yang mi gnas te mi snang bar gyur pas na me skad cig mar grub bo //
analyzed: shing tsheg ste zad pa dang / me yang mi gnas te mi snang bar gyur pas na me skad cig mar grub bo //
translated: When the fuel is consumed, the fire does not remain, and since it becomes invisible, it is established that the fire is momentary.

original: gal te me rtag pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te me rtag pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: If the fire were permanent,

original: shing zad pa'i 'og tu yang me snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: shing zad pa'i 'og tu yang me snang bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: it would be reasonable for the fire to appear even after the fuel is exhausted.

original: gzhan gyis brgal ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brgal ba /
translated: Objection:

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rim bzhin du skad cig mar bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi rim bzhin du skad cig mar bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established the four great elements as momentary,

original: de nas gdod kha dog dang dri dang ro dang / reg skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: de nas gdod kha dog dang dri dang ro dang / reg skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i rigs na /
translated: it would be reasonable to then establish that color, smell, taste, and tactility are momentary.

original: de ltar ni ma bsgrubs kyi sa dang chu dang rlung gsum skad cig mar bsgrubs nas //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma bsgrubs kyi sa dang chu dang rlung gsum skad cig mar bsgrubs nas //
