translated: But that is not how it is established. Having established earth, water, and wind as momentary,

original: de nas kha dog la sogs pa'i don bzhi la skad cig mar bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de nas kha dog la sogs pa'i don bzhi la skad cig mar bsgrubs te /
translated: then the four objects such as color and so on are established as momentary.

original: de'i 'og tu gdod me skad cig mar bsgrub ces rgol ba la /🔽tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba la bde bar kha @159a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gdod me skad cig mar bsgrub ces rgol ba la / tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba la bde bar kha @159a * //
translated: After that, it is said that fire is to be established as momentary.

original: dog la sogs bsngar  bshad de /
analyzed: dog la sogs bsngar  bshad de /
translated: In the verse composition, color and so on are explained first.

original: me ni phyis bshad do zhes smos te /
analyzed: me ni phyis bshad do zhes smos te /
translated: Fire is explained later.

original: tshigs bcad sbyar ba la mi bde bas tshigs bcad sbyar ba bde bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tshigs bcad sbyar ba la mi bde bas tshigs bcad sbyar ba bde bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the verse composition is uncomfortable, in order to make the verse composition comfortable,

original: kha dog la sogs pa don bzhi sngar skad cig mar bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa don bzhi sngar skad cig mar bsgrubs nas /
translated: after first establishing the four topics such as color as momentary,

original: me phyis skad cig mar bsgrubs te bshad do //🔽kha cig 'di skad du sgra ni rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: me phyis skad cig mar bsgrubs te bshad do // kha cig 'di skad du sgra ni rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: fire is later established as momentary and explained.

original: mi rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: Sound is permanent, it is not impermanent.

original: gal te sgra skad cig ma re re la 'jig cing skye ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sgra skad cig ma re re la 'jig cing skye ba yin na ni /
translated: If sound were to disintegrate and arise in each moment,

original: dril bu la sogs pa'i sgra skyes ma thag tu 'gags pas phyis sgra mi 'byung ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: dril bu la sogs pa'i sgra skyes ma thag tu 'gags pas phyis sgra mi 'byung ba'i rigs na /
translated: then the sound of a bell and so on would cease immediately after arising and it would be logical that sound would not occur later,

original: phyis kyang sgra 'byung bar snang bas sgra rtag pa'o zhes zer ba la //
analyzed: phyis kyang sgra 'byung bar snang bas sgra rtag pa'o zhes zer ba la //
translated: but since sound appears later, sound is permanent.

original: de ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i chung du grag go //
analyzed: de ltar mi rigs par bstan pa'i chung du grag go //
translated: It is said that this is illogical.

original: de nas de'ang 'gags nas je chung je chung par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas de'ang 'gags nas je chung je chung par bya ste /
translated: Then, after that sound has ceased, it becomes progressively smaller.

original: je chung je chung dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: je chung je chung dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is observed to become progressively smaller.

original: dril bu la sogs pa'i sgra dus gzhan du 'byung zhing grag pa yang skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dril bu la sogs pa'i sgra dus gzhan du 'byung zhing grag pa yang skad cig mar rig par bya ste /
translated: The sound of a bell and so on that occurs and resounds at another time should be known to be momentary.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dril bu'i sgra dang po cher grag pa las /🔽de'i 'og tu cher grag pa 'gags nas /
analyzed: dril bu'i sgra dang po cher grag pa las / de'i 'og tu cher grag pa 'gags nas /
translated: Because the sound of a bell resounds more loudly at first.🔽After that, the sound that resounded more loudly ceases.

original: de bas chung ngu grag go //
analyzed: de bas chung ngu grag go //
translated: Then, it resounds with less volume.🔽Then, after that has ceased, it becomes progressively smaller.

original: de nas de'ang 'gags nas je chung je chung ngu gyur ba'i rjes la mi grag par gyur pas na skad cig mar gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de'ang 'gags nas je chung je chung ngu gyur ba'i rjes la mi grag par gyur pas na skad cig mar gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: After that, it does not resound. Therefore, it should be known to be momentary.

original: sgra rtag pa yin na skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa yin na skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To demonstrate the error if sound were permanent,

original: skad cig ma med du zin na ni skad cig ma re re la je chung ngu 'gyur bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma med du zin na ni skad cig ma re re la je chung ngu 'gyur bar dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes smos te /
translated: if it were not momentary, it would not be observed to become progressively smaller at each moment.

original: gal te dril bu la sogs pa'i sgra skad cig ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dril bu la sogs pa'i sgra skad cig ma ma yin te /
translated: If the sound of a bell and so on were not momentary,

original: rtag pa zhig yin du zin na ni /
analyzed: rtag pa zhig yin du zin na ni /
translated: If it were permanent,

original: sgra de je chung je chung ngu 'gyur nas mjug tu mi grag par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgra de je chung je chung ngu 'gyur nas mjug tu mi grag par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: then that sound would not gradually become softer and softer until finally it is not heard.

original: dus thams cad du grag pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus thams cad du grag pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The fault would be incurred that it would be heard at all times.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs kyang sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir skad cig mar grub ste ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyi gzugs kyang sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir skad cig mar grub ste ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, form belonging to the phenomena element is established as momentary because it follows the mind, as previously explained.

original: chos kyi skye mched ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs la bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs la bya ste /
translated: The phenomena element refers to imperceptible form.

original: de'ang so sor thar ba'i sdom pa dang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de'ang so sor thar ba'i sdom pa dang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is the three types of vows: pratimokṣa vows, absorption vows, and uncontaminated vows.

original: sdom pa de gsum sems kyi rjes su 'brang zhing sems kyi rgyu las skyes pas ni sems skad cig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdom pa de gsum sems kyi rjes su 'brang zhing sems kyi rgyu las skyes pas ni sems skad cig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since those three vows follow the mind and arise from the cause of the mind, they are momentary because the mind is momentary.

original: @159b de'i 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang skad cig mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @159b de'i 'bras bur gyur pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs kyang skad cig mar 'gyur te /
translated: Nonindicative form that is the result of those vows is also momentary.

original: chos gang sems las skyes pa de dag ni skad cig ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: chos gang sems las skyes pa de dag ni skad cig ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has been established earlier that any phenomenon that arises from the mind is momentary.

original: dri ba las kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar grub ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ba las kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar grub ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, the question itself establishes that all formations are momentary.

original: mu stegs / pa dang 'jig rten pa dag 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa 'di ni 'dod kyi skad cig mar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mu stegs / pa dang 'jig rten pa dag 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa 'di ni 'dod kyi skad cig mar mi 'dod do //
translated: The tīrthikas and worldly people accept that formations are impermanent but do not accept that they are momentary.

original: ji ltar mi rtag par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag par 'dod ce na /
translated: How do they accept that they are impermanent?

original: nang gi 'du byed rnams kyang mjug tu 'chi bar snang ba la /
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed rnams kyang mjug tu 'chi bar snang ba la /
translated: They say that internal formations are seen to end in death and

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang mjug tu chag par snang bas na mi rtag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang mjug tu chag par snang bas na mi rtag pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: pots and so on are seen to end in breakage, so they are impermanent.

original: de ltar mi rtag par 'dod la /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag par 'dod la /
translated: They accept that they are impermanent in that way.

original: skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la ji ltar skad cig ma mi 'dod pa dris nas dris pa'i lan med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis kyang 'du byed rnams skad cig mar mi grub bo //
analyzed: skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la ji ltar skad cig ma mi 'dod pa dris nas dris pa'i lan med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis kyang 'du byed rnams skad cig mar mi grub bo //
translated: But they do not accept that they are momentary. When they are asked why they do not accept that they are momentary, they have no answer. This reason also establishes that formations are momentary.

original: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'du byed mi rtag par 'dod la skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la ji ltar dri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'du byed mi rtag par 'dod la skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la ji ltar dri bar bya zhe na /
translated: Those who assert that formations are impermanent but not momentary are to be questioned as follows.

original: de dag la 'di skad du dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad du dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are to be questioned in the following manner.

original: khyod mi rtag par 'dod la /
analyzed: khyod mi rtag par 'dod la /
translated: You assert that they are impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams skad cig mar mi 'dod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'du byed rnams skad cig mar mi 'dod ces bya ba la /
translated: Why do you not assert that formations are momentary?

original: mi rtag pa par 'dod la skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la 'di skad dri par bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa par 'dod la skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la 'di skad dri par bya ste /
translated: Those who assert that they are impermanent but not momentary are to be questioned as follows.

original: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
translated: How are they to be questioned?

original: khyed 'du byed mi rtag pa'o zhes zer zhing mi rtag par 'dod na /
analyzed: khyed 'du byed mi rtag pa'o zhes zer zhing mi rtag par 'dod na /
translated: You say that formations are impermanent and assert that they are impermanent.

original: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma ra ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams skad cig ma ra ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces dri bar bya'o //
translated: Why do you not assert that formations are momentary?

original: gal te 'di skad du skad cig ma re re la la mi rtag par mi rig go zhes zer na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du skad cig ma re re la la mi rtag par mi rig go zhes zer na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they were to say, “We do not know that they are impermanent in each moment,”🔽then they should be asked this.

original: de skad du dris pa dang / skad cig mar mi 'dod du 'du byed rnams mjug tu 'chi ba dang / bum pa la sogs pa chag par mthong bas de'i phyir mi rtag par ni mi 'dod de //
analyzed: de skad du dris pa dang / skad cig mar mi 'dod du 'du byed rnams mjug tu 'chi ba dang / bum pa la sogs pa chag par mthong bas de'i phyir mi rtag par ni mi 'dod de //
translated: We do not assert that conditioned phenomena are momentary because they are seen to perish in the end, like death, and because a pot and so on is seen to break.

original: de bzhin du 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig par mthong na ni skad cig mar bdag cag 'dod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma re re la 'jig par mthong na ni skad cig mar bdag cag 'dod na /
translated: If conditioned phenomena were seen to disintegrate in each moment, we would assert that they are momentary.

original: de ltar skad cig ma re re la mi rtag cing 'jig par mi rig cing ma mthong bas na skad cig ma mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar skad cig ma re re la mi rtag cing 'jig par mi rig cing ma mthong bas na skad cig ma mi 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: But since we do not know or see them to be impermanent and disintegrating in each moment, we do not assert that they are momentary.🔽In response to that, it is said:

original: de la 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: You should ask them this:

original: skad cig ma re re la 'jig par ma mthong bas na skad cig mar mi 'dod do zhes zer ba de la yang @160a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma re re la 'jig par ma mthong bas na skad cig mar mi 'dod do zhes zer ba de la yang @160a * //
translated: If they say, “We do not assert that they are momentary because we do not see them disintegrating in each moment,”

original: 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that you should ask them this.

original: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should you ask them?

original: de'i phyir / skad cig mar grub pa'i mar me la sogs pa mi g-yo ba'i tshe na yang de mi rig na ji ltar skad cig mar 'dod ces smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / skad cig mar grub pa'i mar me la sogs pa mi g-yo ba'i tshe na yang de mi rig na ji ltar skad cig mar 'dod ces smos te /
translated: if one does not perceive a lamp, etc., which are established as momentary, when they are not moving, how can one assert that they are momentary?

original: gang dang gang skad cig mar mi rig par de dang de skad cig mar mi 'dod na zhi mar me dang chu'i rgyun la sogs pa skad cig ma yin par ni sangs rgyas dang mu stegs pa gnyi ga la grub ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang skad cig mar mi rig par de dang de skad cig mar mi 'dod na zhi mar me dang chu'i rgyun la sogs pa skad cig ma yin par ni sangs rgyas dang mu stegs pa gnyi ga la grub ste /
translated: If one does not perceive something as momentary, one does not assert that it is momentary. Both Buddhists and non-Buddhists establish that a lamp, a stream of water, etc., are momentary.

original: de ltar de dag skad cig ma yin yang mar me dang chu la sogs pa rlung gis bskyed de mi g-yo ba'i dus na skad cig ma yin par rig na ;
analyzed: de ltar de dag skad cig ma yin yang mar me dang chu la sogs pa rlung gis bskyed de mi g-yo ba'i dus na skad cig ma yin par rig na ;
translated: Thus, even though they are momentary, if one perceives that a lamp, a stream of water, etc., are momentary when they are not moved by the wind,

original: ci'i phyir de dag la yang skad cig ma yin par 'dod ces sri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag la yang skad cig ma yin par 'dod ces sri bar bya'o //
translated: why does one assert that they are momentary?

original: gal te 'di skad du sngon gyi bzhin du phyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de la yang 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du sngon gyi bzhin du phyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de la yang 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one says, “Because one does not see them later as before,” one should ask, “What is the difference between the earlier and later moments?”

original: de skad du dris pa dang / gal te 'di ska du mar me ni sngon che zhing kha dog gsal ba las phyis de dag mi snang gi / mar me chung zhing mi gsal bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de skad du dris pa dang / gal te 'di ska du mar me ni sngon che zhing kha dog gsal ba las phyis de dag mi snang gi / mar me chung zhing mi gsal bar gyur nas /
translated: they would say, “Because the flame of a butter lamp is at first large and bright and later it becomes small and dim.

original: je chung je chung ba'i mjug tu mar me de nyid shi nas mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skad cig mar 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: je chung je chung ba'i mjug tu mar me de nyid shi nas mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skad cig mar 'gyur zhes zer ba la /
translated: In the end, after becoming smaller and smaller, the butter lamp goes out and disappears. Therefore it is momentary.”

original: de la ma gtogs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan dag ni lo dang zla bar bzhag na yang /
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan dag ni lo dang zla bar bzhag na yang /
translated: They say that other compounded phenomena such as pots, which can be left for years or months,🔽do not become smaller and smaller and therefore are not asserted to be momentary.

original: je chung je chung ngu mi 'gyur bas na skad cig mar mi 'dod do zhes zer na yang de la 'di skad du dri'o //
analyzed: je chung je chung ngu mi 'gyur bas na skad cig mar mi 'dod do zhes zer na yang de la 'di skad du dri'o //
translated: But they should be asked the following.

original: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be asked?

original: de'i phyir / 'o na yang 'du byed rnams la yang phyis de ltar ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'o na yang 'du byed rnams la yang phyis de ltar ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Why don’t you also assert that later?”

original: de ltar dang po snang la /
analyzed: de ltar dang po snang la /
translated: Thus, those that first appear

original: phyis mi snang ba rnams skad cig mar 'dod la /
analyzed: phyis mi snang ba rnams skad cig mar 'dod la /
translated: and later disappear are asserted to be momentary.

original: myu gu dang / khang khyim dang / bum pa la sogs pa yang dang po snang la /
analyzed: myu gu dang / khang khyim dang / bum pa la sogs pa yang dang po snang la /
translated: Also, a sprout, a house, a pot, and so on, first appear.

original: bar du dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa gzhan du gyur nas //
analyzed: bar du dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa gzhan du gyur nas //
translated: In the middle, the shape, color, and so on, change.

original: phyis mi snang bar gyur na /
analyzed: phyis mi snang bar gyur na /
translated: In the end, they disappear.

original: ci'i phyir skad cig mar mi 'dod do zhes dri bar bya'o ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir skad cig mar mi 'dod do zhes dri bar bya'o ;
translated: Why do you not accept that they are momentary?”

original: / gal te 'di skad du mar me la sogs pa dang / de ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / gal te 'di skad du mar me la sogs pa dang / de ma yin pa'i 'du byed rnams mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they say, “Because the characteristics of a lamp and so on and those of other compounded phenomena are different,”

original: de skad du dris pa dang / gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du mar me dang / bum pa la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan dag mtshan nyid mi @160b 'dra ste ;🔽mar me ni skad cig ma'i dang gis 'byung zhing //
analyzed: de skad du dris pa dang / gal te gzhan dag 'di skad du mar me dang / bum pa la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan dag mtshan nyid mi @160b 'dra ste ; mar me ni skad cig ma'i dang gis 'byung zhing //
translated: then, having asked this, if others say, “A lamp and a pot and so on are other compounded phenomena whose characteristics are not similar.

original: tsha ba dang snang bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: tsha ba dang snang bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: A lamp arises by the power of a wick and oil and is characterized by heat and light.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni nam zhig na phyis zhig cing sra ba dang / chu blugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni nam zhig na phyis zhig cing sra ba dang / chu blugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: A pot, etc., is destroyed later, and has the characteristic of being solid and suitable for holding water.

original: mar me ni skad cig ma yin la /
analyzed: mar me ni skad cig ma yin la /
translated: A lamp is momentary,

original: 'du byed gzhan skad cig ma ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'du byed gzhan skad cig ma ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: but other formations are not momentary.

original: de la yang 'di skad du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'di skad du bstan par bya'o //
translated: This should be taught to them.

original: ji skad du bstan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan par bya zhe na /
translated: How should it be taught?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni rnam par gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni rnam par gnyis te /
translated: Dissimilarity is twofold:

original: rang bzhin mi mthun pa dang / 'jug pa mi mthun pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi mthun pa dang / 'jug pa mi mthun pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: dissimilarity of nature and dissimilarity of function.

original: de la 'du byed rnams phan tshun mi mthun pa la rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams phan tshun mi mthun pa la rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two kinds of dissimilarity among formations:

original: rang bzhin mi mthun pa dang / 'jug pa mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi mthun pa dang / 'jug pa mi mthun pa'o //
translated: dissimilarity of nature and dissimilarity of function.

original: de la rang bzhin mi mthun pa ni me'i rang bzhin tsha ba dang / chu'i rang bzhin gsher ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi mthun pa ni me'i rang bzhin tsha ba dang / chu'i rang bzhin gsher ba lta bu'o //
translated: Dissimilarity of nature is like the nature of fire being hot and the nature of water being wet.

original: 'jug pa mi mthun pa ni mar me la sogs pa skad cig ma re re la skye zhing 'jig la /
analyzed: 'jug pa mi mthun pa ni mar me la sogs pa skad cig ma re re la skye zhing 'jig la /
translated: The mode of engagement is incompatible because a flame and so on arises and disintegrates in every instant.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed gzhan rnams ni skyes nas dus tha gi zad cig gis chos te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed gzhan rnams ni skyes nas dus tha gi zad cig gis chos te /
translated: Other formations such as a vase and so on arise and then endure for a period of time.

original: phyis 'jig pa'i tshul 'jug go //
analyzed: phyis 'jig pa'i tshul 'jug go //
translated: Later, they engage in the mode of disintegration.

original: de la gal te rang bzhin mi mthun par 'dod na ni de'i phyir dpe rung ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la gal te rang bzhin mi mthun par 'dod na ni de'i phyir dpe rung ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: If you assert that they are incompatible by nature, then the example is suitable.

original: gal te mar me ni tsha ba dang ; gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gal te mar me ni tsha ba dang ; gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: If you assert that a flame has the nature of heat and illumination,

original: de ma yin pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan ni sra ba dang chu blugs su rung ba'i rang bzhin yin pas 'dod na ni /🔽de ltar na mar me skad cig ma de 'du byed /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i bum pa la sogs pa 'du byed gzhan ni sra ba dang chu blugs su rung ba'i rang bzhin yin pas 'dod na ni / de ltar na mar me skad cig ma de 'du byed /
translated: and other formations such as a vase and so on that are not that have the nature of solidity and the ability to hold water,

original: skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i dper rung gi /
analyzed: skad cig mar bsgrub pa'i dper rung gi /
translated: then in that case, the flame is suitable as an example that proves that formations are momentary.

original: mthun pa gcig gi dper mthun pa gcig ston par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: mthun pa gcig gi dper mthun pa gcig ston par ni mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not logical to teach one example that is compatible for a compatible meaning.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach that very meaning,

original: de rang bzhin nyid ni de'i dpe ma yin te /
analyzed: de rang bzhin nyid ni de'i dpe ma yin te /
translated: that nature is not an example of that.

original: ji ltar mar mel mar me dang / ba lang la ba langs bzhin no zhes smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar mar mel mar me dang / ba lang la ba langs bzhin no zhes smos te /
translated: Just as a lamp is established by a lamp, and a cow is established by a cow.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed 'ga' zhing rtag pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed 'ga' zhing rtag pa'am /
translated: Thus, if one establishes any compounded phenomenon as permanent or

original: mi rtag par bsgrub na /
analyzed: mi rtag par bsgrub na /
translated: impermanent,🔽one establishes it by means of an example that is not the same nature as

original: de la rang bzhin mi gcig pa'i dpe gzhan gyis bsgrubs te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi gcig pa'i dpe gzhan gyis bsgrubs te /
translated: This is established by other examples of things that are not of the same nature.

original: dper na nyi ma'i 'od tsha / bar sgrub pa la /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma'i 'od tsha / bar sgrub pa la /
translated: For example, in order to establish that the light of the sun is hot,

original: de dang rang bzhin gcig pa med dper gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dang rang bzhin gcig pa med dper gzhag ste /
translated: one posits an example that is not the same nature as it.

original: tsha ba khyad med bzhin zhes bya ba dang / ba men bsgrub pa la dper na ba lang gzhag ste /
analyzed: tsha ba khyad med bzhin zhes bya ba dang / ba men bsgrub pa la dper na ba lang gzhag ste /
translated: For example, “just as heat is not different.” In order to establish that a🔽cow is a cow, one posits an example that is not the same nature as it.

original: ba men ni dper na ba lang 'dra ste zhes dper @161a * //
analyzed: ba men ni dper na ba lang 'dra ste zhes dper @161a * //
translated: For example, “just as a cow is like a cow.” It is not possible to posit an

original: gzhag go // rang bzhin gcig pa ni dper gzhag par mi rigs pa ste /🔽dper na mar me dang mar me 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhag go // rang bzhin gcig pa ni dper gzhag par mi rigs pa ste / dper na mar me dang mar me 'dra'o //
translated: example that is the same nature as it.🔽For example, one does not posit “just as a lamp is like a lamp” or “just as

original: ba lang dang blang 'dra'o zhes dper mi 'jog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang dang blang 'dra'o zhes dper mi 'jog pa bzhin no //
translated: a cow is like a cow” as an example.

original: de ste 'jug pa mi mthun na yang de bas na dper bstan te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ste 'jug pa mi mthun na yang de bas na dper bstan te zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the mode of engagement is not the same, then an example is presented.

original: gal te mar me de las gzhan pa /
analyzed: gal te mar me de las gzhan pa /
translated: If a lamp is different from that,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed skye zhing 'gags ba'i 'jug pa mi mthun zhes zer ba yang /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed skye zhing 'gags ba'i 'jug pa mi mthun zhes zer ba yang /
translated: Also, the operation of compounded phenomena such as pots is not the same in terms of arising and ceasing.

original: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i dper mar me gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i dper mar me gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, a lamp is posited as an example of a pot.

original: 'di ltar mar me ni skad cig mar 'jig rten du grags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mar me ni skad cig mar 'jig rten du grags te /
translated: In this way, a lamp is renowned in the world as momentary and disintegrating.

original: bum pa skad cig ma yin yang skad cig mar 'jig rten du ma grags te /
analyzed: bum pa skad cig ma yin yang skad cig mar 'jig rten du ma grags te /
translated: A pot is a momentary thing, but it is not renowned in the world as being momentary.

original: de bas na mar me skad cig mar grags pa des dper byas nas /
analyzed: de bas na mar me skad cig mar grags pa des dper byas nas /
translated: Therefore, taking as an example a lamp that is renowned as momentary,

original: bum pa skad cig mar ma grags par skad cig mar sgrub po //
analyzed: bum pa skad cig mar ma grags par skad cig mar sgrub po //
translated: a pot that is not renowned as momentary is established as being momentary.

original: de la 'di skad ces dris te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces dris te /
translated: In this regard, the following question is asked:

original: bzhon pa 'dug la zhon pa 'gro bar 'dod dam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dug la zhon pa 'gro bar 'dod dam zhes bya ba la /
translated: Do you assert that a rider goes while the mount remains seated?

original: mi rtag par 'dod la skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la yang 'di skad du dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag par 'dod la skad cig mar mi 'dod pa de dag la yang 'di skad du dri bar bya ste /
translated: Those who assert impermanence but do not assert momentariness should be asked the following:

original: khyed skad cig mar mi 'dod pa rnams la rta la mi zhon pa rta ni yul gar yang ma song ste 'dug la /
analyzed: khyed skad cig mar mi 'dod pa rnams la rta la mi zhon pa rta ni yul gar yang ma song ste 'dug la /
translated: You who do not assert momentariness, a horse that is not ridden by a rider does not go anywhere.

original: de la zhon pa'i mi yul gzhan du phyin par 'dod dam zhes zer te /
analyzed: de la zhon pa'i mi yul gzhan du phyin par 'dod dam zhes zer te /
translated: The other says, The man riding it wants to go to another place.

original: gal te bzhon pa rta yul gzhan du ma phyin na de la zhon pa'i mi yang gdon mi za bar yul gzhan du mi phyin bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bzhon pa rta yul gzhan du ma phyin na de la zhon pa'i mi yang gdon mi za bar yul gzhan du mi phyin bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the horse, the mount, does not go to another place, then the man riding it certainly will not go to another place.

original: gal te mi yul gzhan du phyin na gdon mi za bar bzhon pa rta yang yul gzhan du phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi yul gzhan du phyin na gdon mi za bar bzhon pa rta yang yul gzhan du phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the man goes to another place, then the horse, the mount, certainly will go to another place.

original: de ltar mi 'dod do zhes zer na zhes bya ba la /🔽de skad du dris pa dang / skad cig mar mi 'dod pa dag 'di skad zer te /🔽rta la mi zhon la mi yul gzhan du phyin na /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod do zhes zer na zhes bya ba la / de skad du dris pa dang / skad cig mar mi 'dod pa dag 'di skad zer te / rta la mi zhon la mi yul gzhan du phyin na /
translated: If you say, That is not so,

original: rta yul gzhan du ma phyin par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: rta yul gzhan du ma phyin par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: then, when asked in this way, those who do not accept momentariness say, We do not accept that the man goes to another place without the horse going to another place.

original: mi bzhin du rtas kyang yul gzhan du phyin par 'dod do zhes zer na yang /
analyzed: mi bzhin du rtas kyang yul gzhan du phyin par 'dod do zhes zer na yang /
translated: But just as the man goes to another place, so too the horse goes to another place.🔽 But if you say, That is not so,

original: de la yang 'di skad du dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'di skad du dri bar bya'o //
translated: then you should be asked this:

original: ji skad du dri zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dri zhe na /
translated: How should you ask?

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa 'dug la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun du 'gro'o zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa 'dug la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rgyun du 'gro'o zhes byar mi rung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that the consciousness that is located in the eye, etc. goes in a continuum.

original: dper na rta la zhon pa'i mi yul gzhan du phyin na rtas kyang yul gzhan du phyin pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: dper na rta la zhon pa'i mi yul gzhan du phyin na rtas kyang yul gzhan du phyin pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: For example, if a man mounted on a horse goes to another place, then the horse also goes to another place.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig mar 'dod na ni @161b de'i gnas su gyur pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga yang skad cig mar mi 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig mar 'dod na ni @161b de'i gnas su gyur pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga yang skad cig mar mi 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: If you assert that the consciousnesses that are located in the eye, etc. are momentary, then it is not correct that the five sense faculties such as the eye, which are their locations, are not momentary.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po ni rtag par 'dug na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i dbang po ni rtag par 'dug na /
translated: If the sense faculties such as the eye are permanent,

original: de la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun du 'gro bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rgyun du 'gro bar mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not correct that the consciousnesses that are located in them go in a continuum through a succession of moments.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rtag na ni ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rtag na ni ;
translated: If the sense faculties such as the eye are permanent,

original: de la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the consciousnesses that are located in them would also be permanent.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa mi rtag na ni dbang po rnams kyang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa mi rtag na ni dbang po rnams kyang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If consciousness is impermanent, then the faculties would be impermanent.

original: gal te 'di skad du mar me snying po la gnas la rgyun du 'gro yang snying po ni gnas so zhes zer na yang /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du mar me snying po la gnas la rgyun du 'gro yang snying po ni gnas so zhes zer na yang /
translated: If you say that the wick of a lamp abides and the flame moves on,

original: de la 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: then you should be asked this:

original: gal te skad cig mar mi 'dod pa dag 'di skad du zer te /
analyzed: gal te skad cig mar mi 'dod pa dag 'di skad du zer te /
translated: If those who do not accept momentariness say this,

original: mar me ni mar me'i snying po la gnas shing 'bar la mar me nyid rgyun du 'gro zhing 'jig tu zin kyang de'i snying po mi 'jig cing rtag par gnas pas mthong ngo //
analyzed: mar me ni mar me'i snying po la gnas shing 'bar la mar me nyid rgyun du 'gro zhing 'jig tu zin kyang de'i snying po mi 'jig cing rtag par gnas pas mthong ngo //
translated: then you should ask them this: “You see that the flame of a lamp abides in the wick and burns, and that the lamp itself moves on and is destroyed, but its wick is not destroyed and abides permanently.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la gnas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la gnas la /
translated: In the same way, consciousness abides in the faculties such as the eyes.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig cing rgyun du 'gro ba'i dbang po ni mi 'jig cing rgyun du gnas so zhes zer na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig cing rgyun du 'gro ba'i dbang po ni mi 'jig cing rgyun du gnas so zhes zer na /
translated: Consciousness is destroyed and moves on, but the faculties do not perish and abide permanently.”

original: de la yang 'di skad du dri zhing lan glan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang 'di skad du dri zhing lan glan par bya'o //
translated: You should ask them this and they should answer.

original: ji skad du lan glan zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du lan glan zhe na /
translated: How is this answered?

original: de'i phyir / snying po ni skad cig ma re re la rgyun du 'gyur zhing skye ba'i phyir ma mthong ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / snying po ni skad cig ma re re la rgyun du 'gyur zhing skye ba'i phyir ma mthong ngo zhes smos te /
translated: To respond, it says: The core is not seen because it is constantly changing and arising in each moment.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du mar me'i me lces snying po bsregs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du mar me'i me lces snying po bsregs nas /
translated: Thus, as long as the flame of the lamp burns the wick,

original: mar me'i rgyun skad cig ma re re la 'das shing zhigs pa de tsam du snying po bsregs pa yang skad cig ma re re zhig nas gzhan du gyur bas na /
analyzed: mar me'i rgyun skad cig ma re re la 'das shing zhigs pa de tsam du snying po bsregs pa yang skad cig ma re re zhig nas gzhan du gyur bas na /
translated: the continuity of the lamp passes and disintegrates in each moment, and to that extent the burning of the wick also changes from one moment to the next.

original: mar me ni zhig gi / snying po ni ma zhig ste /
analyzed: mar me ni zhig gi / snying po ni ma zhig ste /
translated: The lamp is extinguished but the wick is not extinguished.

original: phyi na gnas pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: phyi na gnas pa ma mthong ste /
translated: The wick that remains is not seen.

original: de dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa skad cig ma yin na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar rnam par shes pa skad cig ma yin na /
translated: In the same way, if consciousness is momentary,

original: de'i gnas dbang po rnams skad cig mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas dbang po rnams skad cig mar 'gyur ro //
translated: its basis, the sense faculties, would be momentary.

original: gal te 'di skad du 'du byed rnams skad cig ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du 'du byed rnams skad cig ma yin na /
translated: If one says, “If formations are momentary,

original: mar me la sogs pa bzhin du ci'i phyir /🔽skad cig mar ma grub cas zer na yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa bzhin du ci'i phyir /🔽skad cig mar ma grub cas zer na yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: why are they not established as momentary like a lamp and so on?”

original: gal te skad cig mar mi 'dod pa dag 'di skad du 'dri ste /
analyzed: gal te skad cig mar mi 'dod pa dag 'di skad du 'dri ste /
translated: If those who do not assert momentariness ask this:

original: gal te mar me skad cig ma yin pa bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed gzhan yang skad cig ma yin na /🔽ji ltar mar me skad cig ma yin par 'jig rten du grags pa bzhin du @162a * //
analyzed: gal te mar me skad cig ma yin pa bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed gzhan yang skad cig ma yin na / ji ltar mar me skad cig ma yin par 'jig rten du grags pa bzhin du @162a * //
translated: If, like a flame, other compounded phenomena such as a vase are momentary,🔽why are they not known to be momentary in the world,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed gzhan yang skad cig mar ci'i phyir 'jig rten du ma grags shing ma grub ces zer na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed gzhan yang skad cig mar ci'i phyir 'jig rten du ma grags shing ma grub ces zer na /
translated: just as a flame is known to be momentary in the world?

original: 'di skad du lan glan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du lan glan par bya'o //
translated: This is the response:

original: ji skad du lan glan zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du lan glan zhe na /
translated: How is it responded to?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / phyin ci log gi dngos po'i phyir 'dra ba'i rgyud rgyun du 'byung bas de dag skad cig mar mi shes so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / phyin ci log gi dngos po'i phyir 'dra ba'i rgyud rgyun du 'byung bas de dag skad cig mar mi shes so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of erroneous things, a similar continuum arises and they are not known to be momentary.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag mi rtag pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di dag mi rtag pa yin mod kyi /
translated: These things such as vases are impermanent.

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba'i 'du shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la rtag pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log skyes pa'i dngos po dang / rgyu byed pas skad cig ma ma yin yang rtag pa'i 'du shes skye'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang ba'i 'du shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la rtag pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log skyes pa'i dngos po dang / rgyu byed pas skad cig ma ma yin yang rtag pa'i 'du shes skye'o //
translated: The conception of permanence arises in relation to things that are not momentary due to the activity of causes.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung bas na /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung bas na /
translated: Because they arise through the continuum of moments.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma rnams kha dog dang / dbyibs la sogs pa skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra ba sha stag rgyun du 'byung bas na /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma rnams kha dog dang / dbyibs la sogs pa skad cig ma snga ma dang 'dra ba sha stag rgyun du 'byung bas na /
translated: Because the subsequent moments arise in a continuum that is exactly the same in terms of color, shape, and so on as the prior moments,

original: de dag gis skad cig mar ma shes so //
analyzed: de dag gis skad cig mar ma shes so //
translated: they do not understand them to be momentary.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clearly demonstrate that very point,

original: gang gi phyir gcig nas gcig tu 'gyur ba yod kyang de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes phyin ci log skye ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig nas gcig tu 'gyur ba yod kyang de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes phyin ci log skye ste zhes smos te /
translated: it says, “Because the conception that ‘it is this very thing’ arises in relation to that which is different from one moment to the next, even though it is different.”

original: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung bas na skad cig ma snga ma snga ma ni 'gags /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis 'byung bas na skad cig ma snga ma snga ma ni 'gags /
translated: Because conditioned phenomena arise through the continuum of moments, the prior moments cease and

original: phyi ma phyi ma gzhan dag skye ste /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma gzhan dag skye ste /
translated: the subsequent moments arise as something else.

original: gcig nas gcig tu 'gyur ba'i bye brag yod du zin kyang skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skye ba rnams snga ma 'dra ba sha stag skye bas na skad cig ma ni ma yin par rig gi / snga ma mthong ba nyid bdag gis phyis kyang de
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu 'gyur ba'i bye brag yod du zin kyang skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma skye ba rnams snga ma 'dra ba sha stag skye bas na skad cig ma ni ma yin par rig gi / snga ma mthong ba nyid bdag gis phyis kyang de
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the later moments are not produced.

original: mthong do snyam du blo phyin ci log skye'o //
analyzed: mthong do snyam du blo phyin ci log skye'o //
translated: The thought “I saw that very same thing before” is a mistaken cognition.

original: de ltam yin na ni mi rtag pa la rtag pa phyin ci log pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltam yin na ni mi rtag pa la rtag pa phyin ci log pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were not so, then the error of permanence would not exist in relation to impermanence.

original: gal te 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma yin pa las /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas rnams skad cig ma yin pa las /
translated: If conditioned states are momentary,🔽then the later moments are produced as exactly the same as the former.

original: skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma rnams snga ma dang 'dra ba 'ba' zhig skyes pas snga ma ma yin yang snga ma nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo phyin ci log skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma rnams snga ma dang 'dra ba 'ba' zhig skyes pas snga ma ma yin yang snga ma nyid mthong ngo snyam pa'i blo phyin ci log skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the thought “I saw that very same thing before” is not a mistaken cognition.

original: dngos po rnams rtag tu gnas pas phyis mthong ba'i dus na yang /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rtag tu gnas pas phyis mthong ba'i dus na yang /
translated: Since things endure permanently, when one sees them later,

original: snga ma nyid mthong bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: snga ma nyid mthong bar gyur na ni /
translated: one sees that very same thing.

original: des dngos po rnams phyin ci ma log pa mthong bas mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa dang / mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ci log med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des dngos po rnams phyin ci ma log pa mthong bas mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'dzin pa dang / mi rtag pa la rtag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ci log med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it sees things without error, it would not be mistaken, for it would not apprehend the impure as pure or the impermanent as permanent.

original: de med na yang kun nas nyon mongs @162b pa yang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de med na yang kun nas nyon mongs @162b pa yang med par 'gyur na /
translated: If that does not exist, then affliction would not exist.

original: rnam par byang ba ga la yod ces dris pa las kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar grub po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ga la yod ces dris pa las kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar grub po zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that is so, then how could purification exist?

original: gal te sems can rnams la phyin ci log med par gyur na ni phyin ci log med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams la phyin ci log med par gyur na ni phyin ci log med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If sentient beings were not mistaken, then because they would not be mistaken, affliction such as attachment would not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni phyin ci log las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ni phyin ci log las 'byung ngo //
translated: Because all affliction arises from error.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gyur na sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis thar par 'gyur bas mjug tu rnam par byang zhing mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba ga la yod de /
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gyur na sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis thar par 'gyur bas mjug tu rnam par byang zhing mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba ga la yod de /
translated: Thus, if there were no defilement, sentient beings would be liberated by nature. How could there be purification and nirvana in the end?

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nirvana itself would not exist.

original: de lta ni ma yin gyi sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa las phyis mya ngan las 'das par gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin gyi sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa las phyis mya ngan las 'das par gyur te /
translated: But that is not the case. First there is defilement and then there is nirvana.

original: de ltar na dris pa las lan med pa'i sgo nas kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar na dris pa las lan med pa'i sgo nas kyang 'du byed thams cad skad cig mar grub bo //
translated: Thus, even from the point of view of the unanswerable questions, all conditioned things are established as momentary.

original: gang zag la bdag med par grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The Chapter on the Absence of a Person as a Self

original: bdag med pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The twelve verses on the analysis of the absence of a self

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi las 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi las 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'i don bstan te /
translated: The four summaries of the Dharma teach the meaning of impermanence of all conditioned things.

original: de'ang rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: de'ang rnam pa gnyis su bshad do //
translated: That is explained in two ways.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: med pa'i don kyang mi rtag pa'i don du bstan la /
analyzed: med pa'i don kyang mi rtag pa'i don du bstan la /
translated: The meaning of nonexistence is taught as the meaning of impermanence.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa'i don kyang mi rtag pa'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa'i don kyang mi rtag pa'i don du bstan to //
translated: The meaning of momentary disintegration is also taught to be the meaning of impermanence.

original: da ni chos thams cad la bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don rgya cher ston te /
analyzed: da ni chos thams cad la bdag med pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi mdo'i don rgya cher ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the Dharma discourse called “The Selflessness of All Phenomena” is taught extensively.

original: chos thams cad bdag med par tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis sgrub pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis sgrub pa'i sgo nas /
translated: All phenomena are selfless is established through twelve verses.

original: gang zag la yang bdag med par sgrub bo //
analyzed: gang zag la yang bdag med par sgrub bo //
translated: The selflessness of the person is also established.

original: gong du skad cig mar bstan pa'i sgo nas yang gang skad cig ma yin pa des bdag med pa yin pas de'i ska bas su bdag med par bsgrubs zin mod kyi /
analyzed: gong du skad cig mar bstan pa'i sgo nas yang gang skad cig ma yin pa des bdag med pa yin pas de'i ska bas su bdag med par bsgrubs zin mod kyi /
translated: Above, through the teaching of momentariness, it was already established that whatever is momentary is selfless.

original: mu stegs pa dang / 'jig rten pa dag phung po la ma gtogs pa'i bdag dang / byed pa po dang ; lta ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / shed can dang / shed bdag la sogs pa yod par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: mu stegs pa dang / 'jig rten pa dag phung po la ma gtogs pa'i bdag dang / byed pa po dang ; lta ba po dang / tshor ba po dang / shed can dang / shed bdag la sogs pa yod par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen te /
translated: However, non-Buddhists and worldly people, due to distorted clinging, conceive of a self that is not included in the aggregates, as well as an agent, a seer, a feeler, a sentient being, a person, and so on.

original: de dag gi phyin ci log dang bral ba'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang gang zag la bdag med pa bsgrub po //
analyzed: de dag gi phyin ci log dang bral ba'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhan gyis kyang gang zag la bdag med pa bsgrub po //
translated: And since they are free from error, the selflessness of the person can be established by other arguments as well.

original: gang zag yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya @163a * //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya @163a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The person exists or does not exist.

original: bdag dang gang zag yod par smra ba rnams /
analyzed: bdag dang gang zag yod par smra ba rnams /
translated: Those who maintain that the self and the person exist

original: gang zag rang bzhin med par 'dod pa la 'di skad du 'dri ste /
analyzed: gang zag rang bzhin med par 'dod pa la 'di skad du 'dri ste /
translated: ask those who maintain that the person lacks intrinsic nature the following question:🔽The Lord Buddha has said that there are various kinds of persons: the ordinary person, the person who is a stream-winner, the person who is a once-returner, the person who is a non-returner, the person who is a worthy one, the person who is a bodhisattva,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / dgra bcom pa'i gang zag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / dgra bcom pa'i gang zag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag dang /
translated: and the person who is a tathagata.

original: gang zag gcig 'jig rten du 'byung ba na 'jig rten kun la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag gcig 'jig rten du 'byung ba na 'jig rten kun la phan pa dang bde bar byed pa ste /
translated: When a single person appears in the world, he brings benefit and happiness to all the world.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gang zag go zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i gang zag go zhes gsungs la /
translated: This is the person who is a tathagata.

original: rang gi sde pa las kyang /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa las kyang /
translated: And our own schools say:

original: aa sam bi ti pa dag phung po dang gcig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: aa sam bi ti pa dag phung po dang gcig pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Asambidvipaka

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i gang zag rdzas su yod la /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'i gang zag rdzas su yod la /
translated: s assert that the person substantially exists and is neither the same as nor different from the aggregates.

original: tshig gis brjod du med par yang 'dod cing /🔽mu stegs pa dang 'jig rten pa dag bdag dang gang zag yod par 'dod na /🔽khyed gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams gang zag ces bya ba 'di yod pa zhig tu 'dod dam /
analyzed: tshig gis brjod du med par yang 'dod cing / mu stegs pa dang 'jig rten pa dag bdag dang gang zag yod par 'dod na / khyed gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams gang zag ces bya ba 'di yod pa zhig tu 'dod dam /
translated: They also assert that it cannot be expressed in words.

original: med pa zhig tu 'dod pa smros shig ces dri'o //
analyzed: med pa zhig tu 'dod pa smros shig ces dri'o //
translated: If tīrthikas and worldly people assert that the self and the person exist, then you who assert that the person does not exist should say whether you assert that this so-called person exists or does not exist.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni de skad du 'dri ba la gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams kyis lan smras pa zhes bya ba'i don btags par yod par brjod pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni de skad du 'dri ba la gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams kyis lan smras pa zhes bya ba'i don btags par yod par brjod pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “they say” means that those who assert that the person does not exist respond to that question.

original: btags pa zhes bya ba dang / tshig tsam zhes bya ba dang / tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba dang / ming tsam zhes bya ba dag don gcig go //
analyzed: btags pa zhes bya ba dang / tshig tsam zhes bya ba dang / tha snyad tsam zhes bya ba dang / ming tsam zhes bya ba dag don gcig go //
translated: The phrase “they say that it is imputedly existent” means that the terms “imputed,” “mere words,” “mere conventions,” and “mere names” have the same meaning.

original: rdzas su yod ces bya ba yang /
analyzed: rdzas su yod ces bya ba yang /
translated: The phrase “it substantially exists” means that

original: rang bzhin yod ces bya ba dang / don dam par yod ces bya ba dag dang don gcig ste ;
analyzed: rang bzhin yod ces bya ba dang / don dam par yod ces bya ba dag dang don gcig ste ;
translated: “Exists by intrinsic nature” and “exists ultimately” are synonymous.

original: gang zag ces bya ba btags pa dang / ming tsam dang / tha snyad tsam du ni yod ces bya la /
analyzed: gang zag ces bya ba btags pa dang / ming tsam dang / tha snyad tsam du ni yod ces bya la /
translated: The person is said to exist as a designation, as a mere name, as a mere convention.

original: rdzas dang rang bzhin du ni yod pa ma yin te med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas dang rang bzhin du ni yod pa ma yin te med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It does not exist substantially or intrinsically; it is said to be nonexistent.

original: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Akṣayamatisūtra says:

original: gang zag gi sgra de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyi sems can drang ba'i phyir bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag gi sgra de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyi sems can drang ba'i phyir bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: All these terms “person” were taught by the Tathāgata to lead sentient beings by means of conventional expressions.

original: gang zag yod par 'dod pa rnams kyis smras pa /🔽khyed cag gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams yang na gang zag yod do zhes bya ba'i phyogs bzung ste /🔽@163b gang zag yod par mi smra ba /
analyzed: gang zag yod par 'dod pa rnams kyis smras pa / khyed cag gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams yang na gang zag yod do zhes bya ba'i phyogs bzung ste / @163b gang zag yod par mi smra ba /
translated: Those who assert the person say:🔽You who assert that the person does not exist should take a position and say either “The person exists” or “The person does not exist.”

original: yang na ni gang zag mod do zhes bya ba'i phyogs bzung ste /
analyzed: yang na ni gang zag mod do zhes bya ba'i phyogs bzung ste /
translated: You who do not say that the person exists should take a position and say either “The person exists” or “The person does not exist.”

original: gang zag med par mi smra bar ci'i phyir btags par ni yod par yang smra la /
analyzed: gang zag med par mi smra bar ci'i phyir btags par ni yod par yang smra la /
translated: Why do we say that the person exists as a nominal reality and not as a substantial reality?

original: rdzas su med par smra ste /
analyzed: rdzas su med par smra ste /
translated: We say that it exists as a nominal reality and not as a substantial reality.

original: phyogs gcig tu chang par mi smra zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu chang par mi smra zhe na /
translated: Why do we not say that it is a part of both?

original: lan du ji ltar phyogs gcig ma yin par bzung na yod pa'i nyes pa dang med pa'i nyes pa'i skabs su yang mi 'gyur ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: lan du ji ltar phyogs gcig ma yin par bzung na yod pa'i nyes pa dang med pa'i nyes pa'i skabs su yang mi 'gyur ro zhes smos te /
translated: The answer is that if one holds that it is not a part of either, then one will not be vulnerable to the faults of the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig bzung na yang yod pa'i skyon gyis gos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig bzung na yang yod pa'i skyon gyis gos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one holds only to the position of existence, one will be vulnerable to the faults of existence.

original: med pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig bzung na yang med pa'i skyon gyis gos par 'gyur te /🔽de ltar phyogs gcig kho nar chad pa ma yin par bzung na ni yod pa'i nyes pas kyang mi gos /
analyzed: med pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig bzung na yang med pa'i skyon gyis gos par 'gyur te / de ltar phyogs gcig kho nar chad pa ma yin par bzung na ni yod pa'i nyes pas kyang mi gos /
translated: If one holds only to the position of nonexistence, one will be vulnerable to the faults of nonexistence.

original: med pa'i nyes pas mi gos pas na phyogs gcig tu chad par ma bzung ste /
analyzed: med pa'i nyes pas mi gos pas na phyogs gcig tu chad par ma bzung ste /
translated: If one holds that it is not a part of either, then one will not be vulnerable to the faults of existence and nonexistence.

original: phyogs gcig tu bzung na nyes pas ji ltar gos par 'gyur ba ni phyis 'chang do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu bzung na nyes pas ji ltar gos par 'gyur ba ni phyis 'chang do //
translated: How is one vulnerable to the faults of holding to a position of either existence or nonexistence? This will be explained later.

original: de'ang rdzas su med par ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag yod par smra ba rnams 'di skad du gang zag de rdzas kyi dngos por med cing rang bzhin med par ci mngon zhe na zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: de'ang rdzas su med par ji ltar rig par bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag yod par smra ba rnams 'di skad du gang zag de rdzas kyi dngos por med cing rang bzhin med par ci mngon zhe na zhes 'dri'o //
translated: If you ask, How is it known that it does not exist substantially? those who maintain that the person exists ask, How is it known that the person does not exist as a substantial reality and does not exist intrinsically?

original: de'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that,

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes smos so //
translated: it says, because it is not perceived.

original: k'a ri k'a de nyid kyi don dgrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: k'a ri k'a de nyid kyi don dgrol ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of that verse,

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su mi dmigs so zhes smras te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas su mi dmigs so zhes smras te /
translated: it says, it is not perceived substantially, like form and so on.

original: de la dngos po rnams rdzas su yod par sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dngos po rnams rdzas su yod par sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two valid cognitions that establish that things exist substantially.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: They are direct valid cognition and inferential valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar gzugs nas chos kyi bar du chos 'di bdag yod pa yin pas mig gi dbang po dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas dmigs shing mngon sum du mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs nas chos kyi bar du chos 'di bdag yod pa yin pas mig gi dbang po dang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pas dmigs shing mngon sum du mthong ste /
translated: In this way, since this phenomenon, the self, exists, it is perceived and directly seen by the eye faculty, eye consciousness, and so on, just as form is.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas bcad pa de bzhin te gang zag ni dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gang gis kyang ma dmigs shing ma mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas bcad pa de bzhin te gang zag ni dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gang gis kyang ma dmigs shing ma mthong ste /
translated: The person is not perceived or seen by any faculty or consciousness.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ma bcad pas na gang zag rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad mas ma bcad pas na gang zag rdzas su yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not ascertained by direct valid cognition, the person does not substantially exist.🔽“

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni blos rig par bya ste /🔽gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyis gang zag ni blos mi rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni blos rig par bya ste / gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyis gang zag ni blos mi rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The person is perceived by the mind.”🔽The proponents of the person say, “The person is not something that is not perceived by the mind.”

original: gang zag mi dmigs so zhes bshad pa dang / gang zag tu smra ba rnams 'di skad @164a * //🔽du rgol te /🔽gang mig gis mthong ba de 'ba' zhig rdzas su yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag mi dmigs so zhes bshad pa dang / gang zag tu smra ba rnams 'di skad @164a * // du rgol te / gang mig gis mthong ba de 'ba' zhig rdzas su yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The proponents of the person argue as follows:

original: gzhan rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan rdzas su yod pa ma yin no zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: “It is not correct to say that only that which is seen by the eye substantially exists and that the others do not substantially exist.

original: mig gis mi mthong la rdzas su yod cing blos rig pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gis mi mthong la rdzas su yod cing blos rig pa yang yod de /
translated: It is not seen by the eye but it substantially exists and is perceived by the mind.

original: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bzhin no ;
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bzhin no ;
translated: It is like the collection of the mind and mental factors.”

original: /'di ltar dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: /'di ltar dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang /
translated: In this way, the so-called object of observation

original: mig gis mthong ba 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa zhes bya bar yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mig gis mthong ba 'ba' zhig la dmigs pa zhes bya bar yang ma zad kyi /
translated: is not only what is seen by the eye, but also

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes blos rig cing bcad pa la yang dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig go zhes blos rig cing bcad pa la yang dmigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: what is known and ascertained by the mind through the mental consciousness, thinking, “This is like this.”

original: de bas na gang zag de gzhan dag gis ma rig ma dmigs su zin kyang /
analyzed: de bas na gang zag de gzhan dag gis ma rig ma dmigs su zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, although that person is not known or observed by others,

original: bdag cag gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyi blos ni gang zag mi dmigs pa dang mi rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag cag gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyi blos ni gang zag mi dmigs pa dang mi rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not the case that the mind of those of us who speak of the person does not observe or know the person.

original: gang zag dag gcig gis rig cing dmigs te /
analyzed: gang zag dag gcig gis rig cing dmigs te /
translated: One person knows and observes the person.

original: de ltar na gang zag blos mngon sum du byas pas mngon sum gyi tshad mas bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag blos mngon sum du byas pas mngon sum gyi tshad mas bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, since the person is ascertained by the valid knowledge of direct perception through being made directly perceptible by the mind,

original: gang zag rdzas su yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: the person exists substantially.”

original: gang zag dmigs su rung ba 'jug gi tshad mas kyang sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag dmigs su rung ba 'jug gi tshad mas kyang sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: “Since the person is also established by the valid knowledge of engaging inference,🔽the person exists.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes gsungs na ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhes smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes gsungs na ji ltar dmigs pa yin zhes smos te /
translated: How is it objectified?

original: gang zag rdzas su med cing dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su med cing dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If the person does not substantially exist but is objectified,

original: mdo dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can dag tshe 'di nyid la gang zag tu dmigs gang zag tu 'dogs so zhes bka' mi stsol ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: mdo dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can dag tshe 'di nyid la gang zag tu dmigs gang zag tu 'dogs so zhes bka' mi stsol ba'i rigs so //
translated: it would not be proper for the Lord to say in the sūtras, “Sentient beings in this very life objectify the person and designate the person.”

original: de lta ma yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de lta ma yin gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: But it is not improper, for the Lord has said,

original: sems can dag tshe 'di nyid la gang zag la dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: sems can dag tshe 'di nyid la gang zag la dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: “Sentient beings in this very life objectify and designate the person.”

original: ji ltar gang zag mi dmigs pa yin zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag mi dmigs pa yin zhes zer ro //
translated: How can it be that the person is not objectified?

original: de la dmigs zhes bya ba ni sems kyis mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dmigs zhes bya ba ni sems kyis mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here objectify means the mind sees.

original: 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni tshig tu yang smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dogs so zhes bya ba ni tshig tu yang smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Designate means they also speak of it in words.

original: de ni de ru dmigs kyang rdzas su dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ru dmigs kyang rdzas su dmigs par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But that does not mean that they objectify the person substantially.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phyin ci log gi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of misconception.

original: gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyis gang zag dmigs su zin kyang gang zag rdzas su yod pa las de dag gis dmigs shing mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /🔽gang zag rdzas @164b su med bzhin du /
analyzed: gang zag tu smra ba rnams kyis gang zag dmigs su zin kyang gang zag rdzas su yod pa las de dag gis dmigs shing mthong ba ni ma yin gyi / gang zag rdzas @164b su med bzhin du /
translated: Even though the proponents of the person do apprehend the person, they do not apprehend and see the person as substantially existent.

original: de dag gis dmigs shing mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag gis dmigs shing mthong ste /
translated: They apprehend and see the person as substantially nonexistent.

original: de bas na de dag gis gang zag dmigs pa yang phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis gang zag dmigs pa yang phyin ci log yin no //
translated: Therefore, their apprehension of the person is also a misconception.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes bka' skal pa yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes bka' skal pa yang /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the sūtras, “In this life, they apprehend and designate a self.”

original: gang zag nyid yang dag par rdzas su yod pa la dgongs te bdag dmigs so zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag nyid yang dag par rdzas su yod pa la dgongs te bdag dmigs so zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He did not intend that they apprehend a self that is the person that is substantially real.

original: sems can rnams kyi bdag med bzhin du bdag tu lta zhing bdag tu dmigs so zhes phyin ci log tu smra ba la dgongs nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bdag med bzhin du bdag tu lta zhing bdag tu dmigs so zhes phyin ci log tu smra ba la dgongs nas /
translated: He intended that they speak deceptively, saying, “Sentient beings, who are selfless, view a self and apprehend a self.”

original: tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la bdag tu dmigs shing 'dogs so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: In this very life, one observes and designates a self.

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is this known?

original: gang zag tu smra bas dris pa /
analyzed: gang zag tu smra bas dris pa /
translated: The proponents of the person ask this.

original: gang zag 'di yod pa las gang zag tu dmigs shing 'dogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag 'di yod pa las gang zag tu dmigs shing 'dogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the person is observed and designated because this person exists.

original: gang zag tu dmigs pa phyin ci log tu yin par ci mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zag tu dmigs pa phyin ci log tu yin par ci mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is it known that the observation of the person is erroneous?

original: lan du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir te zhes smos te /
analyzed: lan du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir te zhes smos te /
translated: The answer is: because of affliction.

original: gang zag dang bdag tu lta ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na phyin ci log yin par mngon no //
analyzed: gang zag dang bdag tu lta ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas na phyin ci log yin par mngon no //
translated: Since the view of the person and the view of self are by nature afflictions, it is evident that they are erroneous.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six types of affliction:

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste drug yod pa las /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ste drug yod pa las /
translated: attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, view, and doubt.

original: gang zag tu lta ba 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: Among these six, to which affliction does the view of the person belong?

original: de'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar nga dang nga'i zhes bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de ltar nga dang nga'i zhes bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: This defilement is the characteristic of the afflicted view of the self, which is the defilement of “I” and “mine.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa drug yod pa las nga dang nga'i zhes lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa drug yod pa las nga dang nga'i zhes lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: From among the six defilements, this defilement of the view of “I” and “mine” is the characteristic of the defilement of the afflicted view of the self.

original: gal te gang zag tu smra ba dag 'di skad du gang zag tu lta ba 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin yang phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te gang zag tu smra ba dag 'di skad du gang zag tu lta ba 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid yin yang phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: If the proponents of the person think that this view of the person is the characteristic of defilement but is not the characteristic of error,

original: mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the following is stated to demonstrate the untenability of that:

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar mi 'os so zhes smos te /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar mi 'os so zhes smos te /
translated: That which is not erroneous is not suitable to be a defilement.

original: gang dang gang du kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa de dang de dag phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang du kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa de dang de dag phyin ci log yin te /
translated: Wherever there is defilement, there is error.

original: dper na rtag pa dang gtsang par 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rtag pa dang gtsang par 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the grasping of the permanent and the pure.

original: gang dang gang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa de dang de dag la phyin ci log med de /🔽dper na mi @165a * //
analyzed: gang dang gang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa de dang de dag la phyin ci log med de / dper na mi @165a * //
translated: Whatever is not defiled is not perverted.

original: rtag pa dang mi gtsang bar 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi gtsang bar 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the grasping of the impermanent and the impure.

original: de bas na bdag dang gang zag tu 'dzin pa 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur bar mi rigs te gdon mi za bar phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang gang zag tu 'dzin pa 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na ni phyin ci log ma yin par 'gyur bar mi rigs te gdon mi za bar phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the grasping of the self and the person were to become the nature of defilement, it would not be reasonable that they are not perverted; they would certainly be perverted.

original: de nyon mongs pa yin par ji ltar rig ce na zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba dang / gang zag tu smra ba'i rnams 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa yin par ji ltar rig ce na zhes bya ba ni bdag tu smra ba dang / gang zag tu smra ba'i rnams 'dri ba ste /
translated: How do you know that is a defilement? This is the question of those who advocate the self and the person.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin par ci mngon zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin par ci mngon zhes 'dri'o //
translated: How do you know that the view of the transitory collection itself is the nature of defilement?

original: lan du / k'a ri k'a las /
analyzed: lan du / k'a ri k'a las /
translated: In response, the Kārikā says:

original: nyon mongs rgyus zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyon mongs rgyus zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “The cause of defilement.”

original: k'a ri k'a de nyid kyi don dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: k'a ri k'a de nyid kyi don dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of that verse, it says:

original: 'di ltar 'di'i rgyu las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i rgyu las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo zhes smos te /
translated: Thus, the cause of these, desire and so on, arise.
