original: 'di ltar nga dang bdag tu lta ba'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nga dang bdag tu lta ba'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the afflictions such as desire, hatred, ignorance and so on arise from the view of the transitory collection that conceives the aggregates to be mine and I.

original: de ltar bdag tu lta ba 'di nyon mongs pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin par mngon no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu lta ba 'di nyon mongs pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs su lta ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin yin par mngon no //
translated: Thus, since this view of the self acts as the cause of the afflictions, it is clear that the view of the transitory collection is the nature of the afflictions.

original: gang zag yod par smra ba rnams 'di skad du rgol te /
analyzed: gang zag yod par smra ba rnams 'di skad du rgol te /
translated: Those who assert the existence of the person argue as follows:

original: 'di ltar gang zag rdzas su med kyi bdag par yod do zhes smras na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag rdzas su med kyi bdag par yod do zhes smras na /
translated: You say that the person does not substantially exist but it does exist as a nominal reality.

original: btags pa yang gzhi med par 'dogs mi srid de /
analyzed: btags pa yang gzhi med par 'dogs mi srid de /
translated: But it is impossible to impute something without a basis.

original: dper na bum pa zhes bya ba bum pa med par 'dogs me srid kyi /
analyzed: dper na bum pa zhes bya ba bum pa med par 'dogs me srid kyi /
translated: For example, it is impossible to impute a vase without a vase.

original: bum pa la brten nas bum pa zhes 'dogs pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: bum pa la brten nas bum pa zhes 'dogs pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: Just as a vase is imputed in dependence on a vase,

original: gang zag 'di ci la brten te 'dogs she na /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ci la brten te 'dogs she na /
translated: On what basis is this person imputed?

original: lan du gang zag ces 'dogs pa 'di yang gang zag rdzas su yod pa las 'dogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lan du gang zag ces 'dogs pa 'di yang gang zag rdzas su yod pa las 'dogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The answer is that this imputation of “person” is not imputed on the basis of a substantially existent person.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la 'dogs pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la 'dogs pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is merely imputed on the basis of the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de bas na mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore a sūtra says:

original: dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am /
translated: Whether it is a monk or a brahmin,

original: gang su yang rung ba bdag gam bdag gi zhes 'dogs pa de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nyid la nga'am bdag gi zhes lta zhing 'dogs par zad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang su yang rung ba bdag gam bdag gi zhes 'dogs pa de dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga nyid la nga'am bdag gi zhes lta zhing 'dogs par zad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: anyone who imputes “self” or “mine” does so in terms of the five appropriated aggregates alone.

original: de skad du lan glan pa dang / gzhan dag gis dris pa /
analyzed: de skad du lan glan pa dang / gzhan dag gis dris pa /
translated: This is the answer, and others ask:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la /🔽gang zag du gdags pa de las gang zag gcig ces dri'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la / gang zag du gdags pa de las gang zag gcig ces dri'am /
translated: On what basis is the person imputed?🔽Is it asked whether the person is one or many?

original: de ste tha dad ces bya zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ste tha dad ces bya zhes smos te /
translated: Or is it asked whether it is different?

original: khyed gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i bar dag phung po lnga la gang zag tu 'dogs na phung po lnga dang gang zag tu gcig @165b ste ;🔽phung po lnga gang yin pa gang zag kyang de yin /
analyzed: khyed gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam par shes pa'i bar dag phung po lnga la gang zag tu 'dogs na phung po lnga dang gang zag tu gcig @165b ste ; phung po lnga gang yin pa gang zag kyang de yin /
translated: You who assert that the person does not exist, if you designate the five aggregates from form to consciousness as the person, the five aggregates and the person are the same.🔽The person is the five aggregates.

original: gang zag gang yin pa phung po lnga yang de yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gang yin pa phung po lnga yang de yin te /
translated: The five aggregates are the person.

original: rang bzhin gcig las phung po lnga la gang zag tu 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig las phung po lnga la gang zag tu 'dogs pa'am /
translated: Either the person is designated as the five aggregates from one nature,

original: 'on te phung po lnga dang gang zag tha dad de phung po lnga la ma gtogs par gang zag logs shig na yod pa phung po lnga la gdags zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: 'on te phung po lnga dang gang zag tha dad de phung po lnga la ma gtogs par gang zag logs shig na yod pa phung po lnga la gdags zhes 'dri'o //
translated: or the person is separate from the five aggregates, and the person is designated as the five aggregates.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag med par smra ba rnams kyis lan smras so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag med par smra ba rnams kyis lan smras so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ It is said” means that the response is said by those who propound that the person does not exist.

original: gcig dang tha dad mi brjod de /
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad mi brjod de /
translated: “ One and different are not mentioned” means that the person is not mentioned as the same as or different from the aggregates.

original: de ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: “ For that reason” means that the person is not mentioned as the same as or different from the aggregates.

original: gang zag de ni gong du bshad pa ltar na gtags pa tsam du yod kyi rdzas su med pas na gang zag dang phung po rang bzhin gcig pa zhes kyang mi brjod do /
analyzed: gang zag de ni gong du bshad pa ltar na gtags pa tsam du yod kyi rdzas su med pas na gang zag dang phung po rang bzhin gcig pa zhes kyang mi brjod do /
translated: The person is said to be merely imputed, not substantially existent, as explained above. Therefore, it is not said that the person and the aggregates are essentially identical.

original: phung po nyid bdag yin no zhes mi smra'o //
analyzed: phung po nyid bdag yin no zhes mi smra'o //
translated: It is not said that the aggregates themselves are the self.

original: phung po lnga dang gang zag tu tha dad pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang gang zag tu tha dad pa zhes kyang mi brjod de /
translated: It is not said that the person is different from the five aggregates.

original: phung po la ma gtogs par bdag logs shig na yod do zhes kyang mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po la ma gtogs par bdag logs shig na yod do zhes kyang mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not said that the self exists separately from the aggregates.🔽Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams 'dri ba'i tshig ste /
translated: This is a question from the proponents of the person.

original: khyed phung po dang gzugs gang zag tu gcig bar yang ci'i phyir mi smra la /
analyzed: khyed phung po dang gzugs gang zag tu gcig bar yang ci'i phyir mi smra la /
translated: Why do you not say that the person is the same as the aggregates or form,

original: tha dad par yang ci'i phyir mi smra zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad par yang ci'i phyir mi smra zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and why do you not say that it is different?🔽Because of two faults.

original: skyon gnyis kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams kyis lan 'debs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: skyon gnyis kyi phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams kyis lan 'debs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This is the response of those who assert that the person does not exist.

original: phung po dang gang zag gcig par smras na yang skyon med par 'gyur tha dad ces smras na yang skyon yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po dang gang zag gcig par smras na yang skyon med par 'gyur tha dad ces smras na yang skyon yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were said that the aggregates and the person are the same, there would be no error. But if it were said that they are different, there would be an error.

original: nyes pa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas na gcig pa yang mi smra /
analyzed: nyes pa gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas na gcig pa yang mi smra /
translated: Since two errors would occur, it is not said that they are the same.

original: tha dad par yang mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And it is not said that they are different. This is the meaning.

original: skyon gnyis po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gnyis po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the two errors, it says:

original: phung po bdag tu 'gyur ba dang / de nyid rdzas su 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phung po bdag tu 'gyur ba dang / de nyid rdzas su 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the aggregates would be the self, and because it would be a substantial existent.

original: gal te phung po dang gang zag gcig go zhes smras na ni ji ltar bdag ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin du //
analyzed: gal te phung po dang gang zag gcig go zhes smras na ni ji ltar bdag ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin du //
translated: If it were said that the aggregates and the person are the same, then just as the self is by nature permanent,

original: phung po lnga yang rtag pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po lnga yang rtag pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: the five aggregates would also be by nature permanent.

original: de bas na phung po lnga nyid bdag yin no zhes mi smra ste /
analyzed: de bas na phung po lnga nyid bdag yin no zhes mi smra ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not said that the five aggregates themselves are the self.

original: phung po lnga nyid kyang bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga nyid kyang bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: The five aggregates themselves are not by nature the self.

original: gzhan yang phung po lnga dang bdag gcig par gyur na ;
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po lnga dang bdag gcig par gyur na ;
translated: Moreover, if the five aggregates and the self were the same,

original: phung po rdzas su yod pa bzhin du gang zag kyang rdzas su yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phung po rdzas su yod pa bzhin du gang zag kyang rdzas su yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If the person were substantially existent, like the aggregates, then the person would be substantially existent.

original: gang zag ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin gyi btags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin gyi btags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the person is not substantially existent, because it exists as a designation.

original: 'di ni nyes pa gcig go //🔽gal te phung po nga la ma gtogs par gang zag logs shig na yod do zhes smras na ni ji ltar mu stegs pa rnams kyis @166a * //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa gcig go // gal te phung po nga la ma gtogs par gang zag logs shig na yod do zhes smras na ni ji ltar mu stegs pa rnams kyis @166a * //
translated: This is the first fault.

original: bdag ces bya ba phung po la ma gtogs par logs shig na rdzas su yong ngo zhes smras pa ltar na /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba phung po la ma gtogs par logs shig na rdzas su yong ngo zhes smras pa ltar na /
translated: If you say that the person exists separately from the aggregates, then just as the tīrthikas say that the self is substantially existent, existing separately from the aggregates,

original: gang zag ces bya ba yang logs shig na rdzas su yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag ces bya ba yang logs shig na rdzas su yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: then the person would be substantially existent, existing separately.

original: gang zag ces bya ba ni phung po la ma gtogs par logs shig na yang rdzas dang rang bzhin grub par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag ces bya ba ni phung po la ma gtogs par logs shig na yang rdzas dang rang bzhin grub par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the person does not exist substantially, existing separately from the aggregates.🔽The person does not exist substantially, existing separately from the aggregates.

original: de ltar gang zag btags par yod pas na brjod du med par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag btags par yod pas na brjod du med par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the person exists as a designation, it is not suitable to say that it is inexpressible.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar na gang zag rdzas su med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar na gang zag rdzas su med par 'gyur te /
translated: As explained above, the person would not exist substantially.

original: btags pa tsam du yod pas na /
analyzed: btags pa tsam du yod pas na /
translated: Since it exists as a mere designation,

original: gang zag gi phung po dang rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag gi phung po dang rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: the person would be the same nature as the aggregates.

original: phung po nyid gang zag gi rang bzhin yin no zhes kyang ma brjod la /
analyzed: phung po nyid gang zag gi rang bzhin yin no zhes kyang ma brjod la /
translated: It is not said that the aggregates are the nature of the person.

original: phung po la ma gtogs par gang zag logs shig na yod par yang mi brjod la /
analyzed: phung po la ma gtogs par gang zag logs shig na yod par yang mi brjod la /
translated: It is also not said that the person exists separately, apart from the aggregates.

original: don du na phung po la yang gang zag gi rang bzhin med /
analyzed: don du na phung po la yang gang zag gi rang bzhin med /
translated: In fact, the person does not have the nature of the aggregates.

original: phung po la ma gtogs par gang zag ces bya ba logs shig na yang rdzas su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phung po la ma gtogs par gang zag ces bya ba logs shig na yang rdzas su med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that the so-called person does not exist substantially separately from the aggregates.

original: de'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos por grub bo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos por grub bo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is established as an indeterminate thing.

original: gang gi phyir phung po dang gang zag gnyis gcig par yang mi brjod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po dang gang zag gnyis gcig par yang mi brjod /
translated: Because it is not said that the person and the aggregates are the same,

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa'i phyir na /
translated: and because it is not said that they are different,

original: gal te gzhan dag phung po dang gang zag gcig gam zhes 'dri na gcig pa yin no zhes lung mi bstan to //
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag phung po dang gang zag gcig gam zhes 'dri na gcig pa yin no zhes lung mi bstan to //
translated: If someone asks, “Are the aggregates and the person the same?” it is not proper to answer, “They are the same.”

original: gal te phung po dang gang zag tha dad pa gcig yin nam zhes 'dri na yang /
analyzed: gal te phung po dang gang zag tha dad pa gcig yin nam zhes 'dri na yang /
translated: If someone asks, “Are the aggregates and the person different?”

original: tha dad pa yin no zhes kyang lung du mi bstan te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin no zhes kyang lung du mi bstan te /
translated: it is not proper to answer, “They are different.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang zag rang bzhin med pa'i phyir phung po dang gcig par yang bstan du mi rung la /
analyzed: gang zag rang bzhin med pa'i phyir phung po dang gcig par yang bstan du mi rung la /
translated: Because the person does not intrinsically exist, it is not proper to say that it is the same as the aggregates.

original: tha dad pa yang bstan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang bstan du mi rung ste /
translated: Nor is it proper to say that it is different from them.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la kha dog nag por yang bstan du med ;
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la kha dog nag por yang bstan du med ;
translated: For example, it is not proper to say that the son of a barren woman is black,

original: dmar por yang bstan du med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmar por yang bstan du med pa bzhin no //
translated: nor is it proper to say that he is white.

original: 'di yan chad du spyir mu stegs pa bdag tu smra ba dang / sangs rgyas pa gang zag yod par smra ba gnyi ga spyir bsdus te sun phyung ste /
analyzed: 'di yan chad du spyir mu stegs pa bdag tu smra ba dang / sangs rgyas pa gang zag yod par smra ba gnyi ga spyir bsdus te sun phyung ste /
translated: Up to this point, the non-Buddhist proponents of the existence of the self and the Buddhist proponents of the existence of the person have been refuted in general.

original: da ni bstan pa 'di la zhugs pa sam bi ti pa dag gang zag rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i lta ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bstan pa 'di la zhugs pa sam bi ti pa dag gang zag rdzas su yod par 'dod pa'i lta ba sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the view of the Sammitiyas who assert that the person substantially exists, he says:

original: gang rnams ston pa'i bstan pa las 'das te gang zag rdzas su yod par 'dod pa de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang rnams ston pa'i bstan pa las 'das te gang zag rdzas su yod par 'dod pa de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Those who, having transgressed the Teacher’s doctrine, assert that the person substantially exists, should be addressed as follows.”

original: gang rnams zhes bya ba ni sam bi ti pa dag go //
analyzed: gang rnams zhes bya ba ni sam bi ti pa dag go //
translated: “Those” refers to the Sammitiyas.

original: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ston pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The “Teacher” is the Buddha Bhagavan.

original: de'i bstan pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i bstan pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis te /
translated: His “doctrine” is the twelve branches of scripture,

original: chos @166b thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos @166b thams cad mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med par bshad pa'o //
translated: which explain that all phenomena are impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless.

original: 'das pa ni gsung rab kyi don phyin ci log tu gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa ni gsung rab kyi don phyin ci log tu gsungs pa ste /
translated: “Transgress” means to explain the meaning of the scriptures in a distorted way.

original: ji ltar phyin ci log tu gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyin ci log tu gsungs she na /
translated: How is it distorted?

original: 'di ltar gang zag ces bya ba rdzas su yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag ces bya ba rdzas su yod la /
translated: It is as follows: They say that the so-called person substantially exists.

original: de yang phung po lnga dang gcig pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: de yang phung po lnga dang gcig pa zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: Moreover, they say that it is not the same as the five aggregates.

original: tha dad pa zhes kyang mi brjod ces 'dod cing zer te /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes kyang mi brjod ces 'dod cing zer te /
translated: It is also not said to be different.

original: de dag la 'di skad du dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad du dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “one should ask them this.”

original: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dri bar bya zhe na /
translated: In what way should one ask?🔽Therefore it says:

original: de'i phyir / rdzas kyang yod la mi brjod la //🔽dgos pa smra bar bya ba yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rdzas kyang yod la mi brjod la // dgos pa smra bar bya ba yin //
translated: It exists substantially but is not described.

original: zhes smos te /🔽ji ltar bdag cag gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams kyis phung po dang gang zag gcig par smras na ni phung po yang bdag bzhin du rtag par 'gyur ba dang / gang zag kyang phung po bzhin du rdzas su yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur pas gcig par mi smra la /
analyzed: zhes smos te / ji ltar bdag cag gang zag med par 'dod pa rnams kyis phung po dang gang zag gcig par smras na ni phung po yang bdag bzhin du rtag par 'gyur ba dang / gang zag kyang phung po bzhin du rdzas su yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur pas gcig par mi smra la /
translated: It is to be spoken of for a purpose.🔽Just as we who assert that the person does not exist say that if the aggregates and the person are said to be the same, the aggregates would be permanent like the self and the person would be substantially existent like the aggregates, so we do not say they are the same.

original: phung po dang tha dad par smras na ni gang zag de mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag bzhin du rdzas su yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas na tha dad par yang mi smra'o zhes dgos pa brjod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: phung po dang tha dad par smras na ni gang zag de mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i bdag bzhin du rdzas su yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas na tha dad par yang mi smra'o zhes dgos pa brjod pa bzhin du /
translated: If we say that the aggregates and the person are different, the person would be substantially existent like the self imputed by tīrthikas, so we do not say they are different.

original: khyed kyi gang zag rdzas su yang yod la phung po dang gcig par yar mi brjod /
analyzed: khyed kyi gang zag rdzas su yang yod la phung po dang gcig par yar mi brjod /
translated: You say that the person substantially exists, but you do not say that it is the same as the aggregates.

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod na /
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod na /
translated: You do not say that it is different from the aggregates.🔽Why do you have to state the reason that it cannot be said to be the same as the aggregates and that it cannot be said to be different from the aggregates?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?

original: ci'i phyir phung po dar gcig tu brjod du med pa dang / ci'i phyir phung po dang tha dad par yang brjod du med pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dgos pa smra dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po dar gcig tu brjod du med pa dang / ci'i phyir phung po dang tha dad par yang brjod du med pa'i gtan tshigs dang / dgos pa smra dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why do you have to state the purpose?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams la 'dri ba ste /🔽gang zag dang phung po gcig par yang mi brjod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang zag tu smra ba rnams la 'dri ba ste / gang zag dang phung po gcig par yang mi brjod /
translated: Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa'i dgos pa ci'i phyir smra dgos she na zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de'i lan du /
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa'i dgos pa ci'i phyir smra dgos she na zhes bya ba'i don to // de'i lan du /
translated: Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?🔽Why do you have to state the purpose?

original: gcig dang tha dad mi brjod na //🔽dgos pa med par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig dang tha dad mi brjod na // dgos pa med par mi rung ngo //
translated: Why do you have to state the purpose?

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: Why do

original: ji ltar phung po dang gang zag tu rang bzhin gcig par yang mi brjod na ni ci'i phyir gcig par mi brjod pa'i dgos pa dang gtan tshig med du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar phung po dang gang zag tu rang bzhin gcig par yang mi brjod na ni ci'i phyir gcig par mi brjod pa'i dgos pa dang gtan tshig med du mi rung ngo //
translated: If you do not say that the aggregates and the person are essentially identical, then you must state an indispensable purpose and reason for not saying that they are identical.

original: gal te tha dad par yang mi brjod na ni ci'i phyir tha dad par mi brjod pa'i dgos pa dang gtan tshigs smra dgos te /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par yang mi brjod na ni ci'i phyir tha dad par mi brjod pa'i dgos pa dang gtan tshigs smra dgos te /
translated: If you do not say that they are different, then you must state an indispensable purpose and reason for not saying that they are different.

original: dgos pa dang gtan tshigs med pa ni gang zag rdzas su yod par mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: dgos pa dang gtan tshigs med pa ni gang zag rdzas su yod par mi 'gro'o //
translated: Without a purpose and reason, it does not follow that the person substantially exists.

original: gzhan yang gal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te /
translated: Moreover,

original: phung po dang gang zag gcig par yang mi brjod na ni gang na gcig par mi brjod par de na tha dad par 'gyur te /🔽dper na me dang chu gnyis tha @167a * //
analyzed: phung po dang gang zag gcig par yang mi brjod na ni gang na gcig par mi brjod par de na tha dad par 'gyur te / dper na me dang chu gnyis tha @167a * //
translated: if you do not say that the aggregates and the person are identical, then they would be different, just as fire and water are different.

original: dad pas na gcig par mi brjod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dad pas na gcig par mi brjod pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, since fire and water are different, they are not said to be identical.

original: de lta na ni phung po dang gang zag tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni phung po dang gang zag tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the aggregates and the person would be different.

original: gal te phung po dang gang zag tha dad par mi brjod na ni gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phung po dang gang zag tha dad par mi brjod na ni gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: If you do not say that the aggregates and the person are different, then they would be identical.

original: dper na me dang me'i tsha ba gnyis gcig pas na tha dad par mi 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na me dang me'i tsha ba gnyis gcig pas na tha dad par mi 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, since fire and the heat of fire are the same, they are not different.

original: de lta na ni phung po dang gang zag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni phung po dang gang zag gcig pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that were so, the person and the aggregates would be the same.

original: gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the same.

original: tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'grub bo //
translated: The statement “They are different” is not established.

original: ci ste dpe tsam gyi phyir gang zag mi brjod par 'dod de zhes bya ba la /🔽gal te gang zag tu smra ba rnams 'di skad du zer te /
analyzed: ci ste dpe tsam gyi phyir gang zag mi brjod par 'dod de zhes bya ba la / gal te gang zag tu smra ba rnams 'di skad du zer te /
translated: If you say that you do not want to describe the person because it is merely an analogy,

original: gang zag rdzas su yod la /
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod la /
translated: the proponents of the person might say, “The person exists substantially.

original: phung po dang gcig par yang mi brjod /
analyzed: phung po dang gcig par yang mi brjod /
translated: We do not say that it is the same as the aggregates,🔽nor do we say that it is different. It is not suitable to teach that it is like this.

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa dngos su 'di 'dra zhes ni bstan du mi rung gi /'jig rten na rdzas su yod la gcig par yang mi brjod /
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa dngos su 'di 'dra zhes ni bstan du mi rung gi /'jig rten na rdzas su yod la gcig par yang mi brjod /
translated: In the world, something that exists substantially is not said to be the same,

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: nor is it said to be different.

original: gang zag 'di yang rdzas su yang yod la phung po dang gcig par yang mi brjod /
analyzed: gang zag 'di yang rdzas su yang yod la phung po dang gcig par yang mi brjod /
translated: In the same way, this person exists substantially, but we do not say that it is the same as the aggregates,🔽nor do we say that it is different.

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod par bdag cag 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod par bdag cag 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: We maintain that they are not described as different.

original: dpe gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir smras ba /
analyzed: dpe gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir smras ba /
translated: In order to demonstrate the example, he says:

original: dper na me dang sreg pa gnyis tha dad par yang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na me dang sreg pa gnyis tha dad par yang ma yin /
translated: For example, fire and fuel are not described as different

original: tha mi dad par yang ma yin par brjod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha mi dad par yang ma yin par brjod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and not described as non-different.

original: bsreg pa ni shing la bya'o //
analyzed: bsreg pa ni shing la bya'o //
translated: Fuel is to be taken as wood.

original: 'di ltar me dang shing gnyis rdzas su yod kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar me dang shing gnyis rdzas su yod kyang /
translated: Thus, although fire and wood exist as substances,

original: me dang shing gnyis tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me dang shing gnyis tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: fire and wood are not different,

original: gang gi phyir shing las me 'byung ba na me dang shing gnyis tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shing las me 'byung ba na me dang shing gnyis tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: because when fire arises from wood, fire and wood are not different.

original: gal te me dang shing gnyis tha dad na ni shing med par yang me 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te me dang shing gnyis tha dad na ni shing med par yang me 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If fire and wood were different, then fire would arise without wood.

original: shing med par me 'byung ba ma mthong bas de bas na tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shing med par me 'byung ba ma mthong bas de bas na tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: But since fire arising without wood is not seen, therefore they are not different.

original: me dang shing gnyis tha mi dad cing gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: me dang shing gnyis tha mi dad cing gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Fire and wood are not non-different and not the same,

original: shing ni me'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: shing ni me'i rgyu yin la /
translated: because wood is the cause of fire,🔽and fire is the result of wood.

original: tsha ba'i rang bzhin med pa yin la /
analyzed: tsha ba'i rang bzhin med pa yin la /
translated: Fire is not the result of fuel, because it does not have the nature of heat.

original: me ni shing gi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: me ni shing gi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Fire is the result of fuel, because it has the nature of heat.

original: tsha ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas rang bzhin gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tsha ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas rang bzhin gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the same in nature, because🔽if they were the same in nature, then just as one is burned by touching fire, so one would be burned by touching fuel.

original: gal te rang bzhin gcig na ni me la reg na 'tshig par 'gyur ba bzhin du shing la reg na yang tshig par 'gyur ba'i skyong du 'gyur ba dang / shing la reg na mi 'tshig pa bzhin du me dang shing gnyis rang bzhin gcig pas me la reg na yang mi 'tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gcig na ni me la reg na 'tshig par 'gyur ba bzhin du shing la reg na yang tshig par 'gyur ba'i skyong du 'gyur ba dang / shing la reg na mi 'tshig pa bzhin du me dang shing gnyis rang bzhin gcig pas me la reg na yang mi 'tshig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And just as one is not burned by touching fuel, so one would not be burned by touching fire, because fire and fuel would be the same in nature.

original: de yang 'dra bar gang zag rdzas su yod la phung po gcig pa @167b zhes kyang mi brjod /
analyzed: de yang 'dra bar gang zag rdzas su yod la phung po gcig pa @167b zhes kyang mi brjod /
translated: Moreover, they say that the person exists substantially, but it is not said to be the same as the aggregates,

original: tha dad par yang mi brjod do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi brjod do zhes smra'o //
translated: nor is it said to be different from them.

original: yang de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang de la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Again, it should be said to them:

original: gang zag tu smra ba rnams de skad du smra ba la /
analyzed: gang zag tu smra ba rnams de skad du smra ba la /
translated: When the proponents of the person speak in that way,

original: 'di skad du lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di skad du lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: this is the way to respond to them.

original: me dang bsreg pa mi brjod pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten mthong ba dang ; gtsug lag las kyang mi rung ste /
analyzed: me dang bsreg pa mi brjod pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig rten mthong ba dang ; gtsug lag las kyang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also illogical that fire and fuel are characterized by mutual dependence, because they are not seen in the world in that way, nor are they seen in that way in the treatises.

original: nye bar dmigs pa gnyis su'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa gnyis su'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are observed as two.

original: khyed kyi me dang shing gnyis gcig par mi brjod /
analyzed: khyed kyi me dang shing gnyis gcig par mi brjod /
translated: You do not say that fire and fuel are one.
